loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is married and has five children. He does carpentry to earn a living. He has been in the business for 12 years. He has employed one person in the business. Peter also does farming to supplement his income. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained on business management skills. He hopes to grow his business in the future. Peter has requested for 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy timber and nails.

loans.use: To buy timber and nails

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine lives in the coastal town of Kisauni, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children and runs a retail shop that has been in operation for the last three years. She started the business from her own savings.

Catherine was introduced to Yehu by a friend and is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase additional retail stock such as flour, beans, salt, sugar, etc.

Catherine is optimistic that the income from this loan will help her pay for her children's education. The challenge for her business has been the high cost of goods, a situation she hopes to resolve by purchasing the items in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase additional retail stock such as flour, beans, salt, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is from Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occdental. She is 53 years old, widowed and has ten adult-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Theresa is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members. Ma. Theresa has been engaged in her business for 4 years and earns 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
 
In 2010, Ma. Theresa joined Kiva partner, GDMPC. Ma. Theresa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Fatima Carolina

texts.es:
Fatima es una joven muy trabajadora, sus padres le enseñaron desde muy joven a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente y sobre todo con mucha humildad, tiene 21 años y es muy alegre, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Cuando Fatima tiene un tiempito libre le gusta salir a pasear, sobre todo porque se distrae de lo atariado de su trabajo, en ocasiones le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la pizza, por ella la comería todos los días nos comenta. Estudio la carrera de administración pero debido a que no encontraba trabajo tomo la decisión y sobre todo ahorro y inicio su negocio de venta de Ropa como recorredora. Ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 40 clientes en el día,  ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo carismática, por ello los clientes siempre le compran sus productos sus productos.

Fatima está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como pantalones, polares, chompas, casacas, entre otros, así de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y poder tener mas variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño: “Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Fatima is a hardworking young woman. Her parents taught her at a very young age that one should earn a living with the sweat of one's brow and with great humility. Fatima is 21 years old and very cheerful. Her home is located in the city of Ica, which is known for its agriculture, especially its crops of cotton, grapes, asparagus, and other commodities. When she has a little bit of free time, Fatima likes going for walks because it provides a distraction from her work. Sometimes she like to eat one of her favorite foods, pizza, and says that she would eat it every day if she could. Fatima studied for a degree in Management, but she could not find a job in that field. At that point, she made the decision to use all of her savings to start a business selling clothes as a traveling vendor. Fatima works approximately eight hours a day and can serve up to 40 customers each day. She believes she is doing well in her business because she is very friendly with the customers and exhibits her charisma. For this reason, her customers are always willing to buy her products.

Fatima is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business such as trousers, fleece pullovers, sweaters, jackets, and other items. This will improve her earnings and provide her with a wider variety of products to offer to her customers. Fatima will continue to strive for her greatest wish of having a home of her own.

loans.use: to buy trousers, fleece pullovers, sweaters, jackets, and other items.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora tiene 49 años, es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, además de tener muchas ganas de progresar.  Su pareja es Pedro, quien se dedica al comercio y es el padre de sus dos hijos. Vive en compañía de su pareja y el último de sus hijos (de 14 años). Su casa es propia, la cual logró comprar, como mucho esfuerzo, con la ayuda de su pareja.
Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes, para eso implementó una tienda en su vivienda con un capital inicial fruto de los ahorros en común que tiene con su pareja. Primero realizó pequeñas compras, logrando vender todos sus productos. Gracias a la buena acogida que tuvo, decidió comprar en mayores cantidades y seguir adelante. Se inició en el negocio hace más de 2 años, tiempo que le valió para hacerse conocida entre sus clientes. Adicionalmente, también se dedica a la compra de autos usados, los arregla y los revende a mayor precio. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es poder contar con un ingreso económico que le sirve para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar.

Este es su quinto préstamo con la institución MFP y está contenta de contar con un apoyo financiero para seguir avanzando con su negocio. Por eso se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. 
Con el monto solicitado, de 3000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes en mayor volumen, ya que considera que a mayor variedad de stock logrará mayor preferencia de sus clientes. También usará parte del dinero en el pintado y arreglo de un auto usado para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
Dora is 49 years old and is a dynamic hardworking woman with a great desire to get ahead.  Pedro, her husband is a merchant and the father of her two children.  She lives with her husband and youngest son (age 14).  They own their home, which she managed to buy with great effort, and her husband’s help. 

She is in the grocery business, so she set up a store in her home with her and her husband’s savings.  At first she began with small purchases, succeeding at selling all her merchandise.  Thanks to the nice welcome she had, she began buying larger quantities and moving ahead.  She began this business two years ago, and this time allowed her to become better known to her customers.  She also sells used cars.  She fixes them up and resells them at a profit.  What she likes about her business is being able to count on an income that allows her to help her husband pay the household expenses.

This will be her fifth loan through MFP and she is happy to be able to count on financial support that allows her to get ahead with her business.  She is committed to being on time with her payments, as she was with previous loans.

She will invest the 3,000 PEN in groceries in quantity, and she believes that the larger inventory will help her customers prefer her.  She will also use part of the money to paint and repair a used car for resale.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.en: Jhonny is 36 years old, and is married to Emelda, a wife who helps him manage their corn production business. The couple work hard to lift their family up from poverty. Right now, Jhonny is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 40,000 to buy fertilizers and corn seeds to sustain his farm. He hopes to increase his profits so that he can sustain the financial needs of his family and save money for the future. He believes that through his patience in managing his farm business he will be able to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and corn seeds to sustain his farm.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria, aged 40, is married with three school-aged children. She has a retail shop where she sells different products that she can offer to the community. Maria has had this business for 18 years and she earns approximately PHP 3,000 monthly. Maria is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase a variety of products so that she can offer more products to the community to acquire more customers, thus increasing her income. She wants to buy canned goods, noodles and other daily basic necessities to sell to the community. In the future, Maria hopes that her business will expand to sustain her family's daily needs and also to finance her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles and other daily basic necessities to sell.

loans.name: Pedro Josue

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 30 años de edad, vive en la pujante ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por la generosidad de su gente y en la cual se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, también se desarrolla la pesca y también tiene una comida exquisita un ejemplo de ellos es el riquísimo Chupe de Camarones, al igual que lo maravilloso de sus playas. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, asimismo le gusta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Lomo Saltado”.

Día a día Pedro trabaja en una empresa de venta de artefactos, este trabajo es un poco duro ya que siempre tiene que estar de pie, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas diarias en las cuales atiende a los clientes que se acercan con mucha amabilidad y sobre todo con mucho respeto y por ello el cree que le va bien en su trabajo, además de que le gusta lo que hace y por ello lo hace con mucho ánimo.

Pedro está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda como colocar el piso ya que es de tierra, así de esta manera el podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y poder seguir trabajando día a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Seguir mejorando su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Pedro, 30, lives in the booming city of Camana, a city known for the generosity of its people and its agriculture, especially the cultivation of rice. There is also a fishing industry here, and a delicious cuisine, for example, the delicious "Chupe de Camarones" (Peruvian shrimp chowder).  The area also features marvelous beaches.  When he has free time, Pedro really likes to play soccer with his friends and neighbors.  He also enjoys one of his favorite dishes, the rich "Lomo Saltado" (a Peruvian beef dish).

Day by day, Pedro works in a company selling appliances.  This work is somewhat difficult, since he always has to be on foot.  He works about 9 hours each day.  He treats the customers who approach him with friendliness, and most of all, respect, and he believes that this is why he is doing well in his job.  Also, he enjoys what he does, and so does his work with a lot of enthusiasm.

Pedro is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they are providing he will be able to make some improvements to his house, such as to put in a floor, since he currently has a dirt floor.  In this way, he will be able to have a better quality of life and continue to work toward his greatest dream: "to continue to improve his house."

loans.use: to improve his house (put in a floor)

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a single mother of two. She sells teddy bears to earn a living. She has been in the business since 2008. She also does farming to supplement her income. Ruth has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills. She hopes to grow her business in the future. Ruth has requested for 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy teddy bears for resale.

loans.use: To buy teddy bears for resale

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en: Jenefer is 33 years old and is a married woman with 3 children ages 2, 7 and 11. She runs a store selling dry goods to her community. Jenefer works hard to provide the best service to her customers and keep them loyal to her store. She hopes to expand her business and purchase items that are not in her inventory yet. She requested a loan from CEVI to buy more merchandise to sell such as ready-to-wear clothes and kitchenware. Jenefer hopes for this loan to help her achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as clothes and kitchenware

loans.name: Marly

texts.en:
Marly is from Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Marly is married and has one child. 

To make a living, Marly owns & operates a retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for 11 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

 In 2011, Marly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marly is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is a resident of Kisauni, Kenya and is a clothes seller, a business she has been running for 2 years. She is a married mother of 2 children. She started the business from her husband’s income. He is a mason.

On learning about Yehu from her friends, Mwanapili joined the group members to access loans. She is therefore applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a new stock of dresses, hair clips and trousers. She believes the additional income from this loan will help her pay her children’s school fees. Her ambition is to be an established boutique owner in the region, despite the challenges of seasonal business climate and inflation.

loans.use: to buy a new stock of dresses, hair clips and trousers.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is a hard-working business man.  He runs a barber shop to earn a living.  He has been in the business for eight years.  He has employed one person in the business.  He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.
  
Gideon hopes to grow his clientele in the future.  He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a shaving machine.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es:
Martha es jefa de familia, vive sola con sus cuatro hijas, quienes son menores de edad y estudian.
Cuando ella se separa de su compañero retoma su actividad comercial,como forma de generar ingresos y poder contribuir  con gastos de su familia , como pago de estudios  y otras necesidades básicas del núcleo familiar .
 Ella vende , y cobra según el horario de estudio de su hija menor, cuando ésta está en la escuela ella realiza sus ventas y cobros.Algunos días por las mañanas y otros por las tardes.
Ella vive en una zona residencial ubicada en la provincia de Cartago, tipo clase baja media,vendiendo sus productos en barrios cercanos a su lugar de residencia.
Ella es la primera vez que solicita un crédito, y lo hace a la fundación , por recomendación de una buena amiga suya, quien ha sido nuestra clienta.
Como jefa de hogar ha tenido  que enfrentar obstáculos, como el no tener mucho tiempo para el negocio por cuidar a sus hijas, esto lo ha ido superando al tener ya hijas adolescentes que le ayudan con algunas tareas de la casa y cuidar a su niña más pequeña.
Pero el obstáculo mayor es la falta de dinero, para atender sus clientes, este obstáculo lo podrá vencer con apoyo económico que le brinde la fundación mediante un crédito.
texts.en:
Martha is the head of her household; she lives alone with her 4 daughters who are all minors attending school.

When she separated from her partner, she went back to her work in retail trade to generate income and be able to contribute to the expenses of the household, such as the educational expenses and other basic needs for her nuclear family.

She sells products through a catalog (lingerie and cosmetics), and she collects according to the school schedule of her youngest daughter.  She makes her sales and collects when her daughter is in school, some days in the mornings and others in the afternoons.  

Martha lives in a lower middle-class residential neighborhood located in Cartago province. She sells her products in neighborhoods close to her place of residence.

This is the first time that Martha has requested a loan, and she is doing it through the Fundacion on the recommendation of a good friend of hers who has been our client.  As head of household, Martha has had to confront obstacles, such as not having much time for her business because she must care for her daughters.  She has overcome this by having her daughters who are already adolescents help with the household chores and care for her youngest daughter.  But her biggest obstacle is that she lacks the money she needs to meet the demands of her customers.  She will be able to overcome this obstacle because of the financial support provided by the Fundacion in the form of a loan.

loans.use: to buy products through a catalog: lingerie and cosmetics

loans.name: Levita

texts.en: Levita is engaged in the vending business. She sells vegetables, fish and dressed chicken in their village using her three wheeled bicycle as her service. Through her business, she was able to send her children to school and have them finish their high school education. It was not easy for her to gain sufficient income for them to pursue their studies in college because she is the only one working for money to support all of them. Levita wants to expand her business and increase her products in order to gain more profit. Thus, she wants to have available a loan amounting to PHP 13, 000 to grow her rolling store business that will help her daily living. Levita is 54 years old and is already a widow. She has three children and they are living in Naguilian, Isabela.

loans.use: to buy different vegetables and fruits for her store.

loans.name: Gulzada

texts.ru: Гулзаде 28 лет, мать 3 детей.  Гулзада в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается торговлей продуктами питания на рынке. Начатый  с суммы 20,000 сом бизнес благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости Гулзад, на сегодня приносит около 15,000 сом в месяц . В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулзад обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS)  на расширение ассортимента товаров.  Доходы от кредита Гулзад планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса, а в будущем хотела бы открыть баню для местных жителей.
texts.en:
Gulzada is a 28-year-old mother of three children. She sells food in the market as the main source of income for her family. Launched with the amount of 20,000 soms, Gulzada with hard work and perseverance today brings in about 15,000 soms per month. With the aim to further develop her business, Gulzada appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 70,000 soms to expand the range of goods. 

Gulzada plans to invest the income from her loan to further increase her business and in the future to open a bathhouse for the local residents.

loans.use: to broaden the assortment of goods

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед уже два года как занимается торговлей. У него имеется продуктовый магазин. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Чамшед берет кредит для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Jamshed has been engaged in trade for two years. He has a grocery store. He is 36 years old, married and has six children. Jamshed is taking a loan to increase his inventory.

loans.use: to purchase candy, tea, soft drinks, butter and sausages

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es: Carlos Humberto de treinta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace varios años ya tiene experiencia en el rubro y siempre trata de obtener las mejores cosechas, para él es muy importante su trabajo pues sabe que es su mayor fuente de ingresos para sostener a su familia, el terreno donde siembra es de mucha incidencia agrícola y está cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores y es muy conocido por ser el mejor vendedor, por la calidad de sus productos y por dar un excelente servicio; Carlos es un hombre luchador entregado a su labor,  siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le ayuden a salir adelante, en esta cosecha que se acerca quiere aumentar la producción y necesita invertir en insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, herramientas etc. Carlos Humberto tiene muy buenas referencias crediticias y da la seguridad que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Carlos Humberto is 35 years old and lives with his life companion and their children. He has been growing corn and beans for many years. Carlos already has experience in this line of work and always tries to obtain better yields. His work is very important to him because he knows that it is the greatest source of income for sustaining his family. The land that he cultivates has great agricultural impact and is located near his home. Carlos sells his products in all of the surrounding neighborhoods and is well-known for being one of the best sellers because of the quality of his products and the excellent service he provides.

Carlos is a determined individual who is diligent at his work. He always expects new opportunities to be available so that he can get ahead. For this harvest, he wants to increase production, but he needs to invest in supplies. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can buy corn seeds, bean seeds, insecticides, herbicides, tools, and other items. Carlos Humberto has very good credit references and is confident that he can repay his debt so that he can provide his family a full life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, herbicides, tools, and other items.

loans.name: Tolib

texts.ru: Толиб проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ему 48 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Толиб предоставляет услугу. Он работает в мужском салоне, парикмахером. В этой области он 15 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения свадебного подарка (мебели) для дочери.
texts.en:
Tolib lives in the town of Istaravshan. He is 48 years old, married, and has three children. Tolib provides services as a barber in the men's salon. He has 15 years experience in this area. 

The loan is for the purchase of a wedding gift of furniture for his daughter.

loans.use: to purchase a wedding gift (furniture)

loans.name: Maylinda

texts.en: Maylinda is 31 years old, is married and has five children. She is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Maylinda used her last loan to purchase lumber facilities to update her service offerings. Her business has grown and become successful. Now she's taking a new loan to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Positively, she hopes to be able to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 51 years old. She is from Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is separated and has 13 children. Virginia used her last loan to purchase motor accessories and supplies needed to expand the seating capacity on her motor transport. Her transport business is successful, and she's now taking a new loan for her other business, to purchase tools and equipment to expand the business. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment to expand her business

loans.name: Chance Group

texts.fr:
Marie  fait partie du groupe  Chance et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle est célibataire et a 47 ans.Elle a 8 enfants, âgés de 4  à 22 ans, dont  7 étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de chaussure depuis  3 ans. 

Elle est à son  dixième  crédit à  Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son  capital et acheter beaucoup de paires de chaussures, à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter des parcelles et voir ses enfants  terminer les études et exercer les hautes fonctions (comme celle de la présidence de la République)
texts.en: Marie is a member of the Chance group and lives in Bujumbura. She is single and 47 years old. She has 8 children, aged between 4 and 22, 7 of whom go to school. She has been selling shoes for 3 years. This is her 10th loan from Turame. The Kiva-sponsored loan that she will receive will increase her capital and she will buy many pairs of shoes for resale, in order to earn more money. In the years ahead, she would like to buy plots of land and watch her children finish their studies and hold high-level posts, like the presidency of the Republic.

loans.use: to buy many pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Lucena

texts.en:
Maria Lucena is from Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old, married, and has two children. To make a living, Maria Lucena  raises crops, which she has been doing for five years.  She earns 4,500 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Maria Lucena joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David used his previous loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy shoe soles to sell. Since he serviced the loan, his business has grown. With the additional income from his business, he was able to improve his farming. He has now requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy shoe soles.

loans.use: to buy shoe soles

loans.name: Helyn

texts.en:
Helyn is 38 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Helyn owns and operates a gardening business, which she has been doing for three years.  She earns 4,000 PHP each month. 

Helyn is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers and seedlings. Helyn been a member of  GDMPC since 2006. In the future, Helyn plans to save in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is married and has two children.  He runs a retail shop to earn a living, which he has been doing for five years.  He employs one person in the business.  

Stephen is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES, which he will use to buy sugar, cooking fat, maize flour and salt.  He has expanded his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.  In the future, Stephen hopes to expand his business into wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking fat, maize flour, and salt.

loans.name: Begaiym

texts.ru: Бегайым 46 лет, мать 2 детей.  Бегайым работает медсестрой в местной больнице и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начатый  с суммы 10,000 сом бизнес благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости Бегайым, на сегодня приносит около 15,000 сом в месяц. Хозяйство Бегайым  насчитывает 1 корову и 8  овцематок, также Бегайым  возделывает 4 га земли в пшеницей и сахарной свеклой. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бегайым обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Бегайым планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Begaiym is 46 years old. She is the mother of two. Begaiym works as a registered nurse at the local hospital, and as an additional source of income for her family, raises livestock and grows produce. Thanks to Begaiym’s hard work and resilience, her business, launched from the amount of 10,000 now brings in about 15,000 KGS per month. Begaiym’s farm includes one cow and eight ewes. Begaiym also works 4 ha [about 7.5 acres] of land, growing wheat and sugar beet. In order to develop her business, Begaiym has turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 120,000 KGS for the purchase of additional livestock. Begaiym plans to use the resulting revenues for expanding her business further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 22-year-old single man who has been working in printing and billboard installation since 2009. His business is going on just fine, but he needs a little bit of support. Alaa is a hardworking man with a good reputation and he is well known in the region.

Alaa is applying for a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to apply for a driving license necessary for his business flexibility, in order to transport by himself the finished product and to reduce the cost of transportation. This will help a lot to increase his profit and to expand his business zone.

Alaa hopes to buy updated printing machines in the future and open a special printing company.

loans.use: to apply for a driving license necessary for his business flexibility

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is married and has two children.  She sells clothes to earn a living.  She has been in the business for six years. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.

She hopes to grow her business in the future.  She has requested 90,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 32-year-old housewife caring for three children. Her husband is serving in the military and she has started a small home based retail business selling clothes.

Helping each other at home has been affecting the improvement of their living conditions, so Rania has decided to continue on working to try to expand the business. She has applied for this loan to bring in more summer clothes.

loans.use: to bring in more summer clothes

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es: Jaime Antonio de treinta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos los cuales aún asisten a la escuela; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol entre otros, tiene ya diez años de dedicarse a la agricultura y le ha dado experiencia muy valiosa para desempeñarse mejor en el rubro, siempre obtiene muy buenas cosechas, por lo tanto, lo que comercia a los alrededores es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precio accesible, además de un servicio excelente; Jaime Antonio es un hombre trabajador y de hogar siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan encontrar un futuro mejor, en esta temporada de siembra aumentará la producción en dos manzanas de terreno pero necesita invertir en insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, abono, entre otros. Jaime Antonio tiene muy buenas referencias crediticias y tiene la certeza que cancelará el financiamiento y a la vez le ofrecerá a su familia la calidad de vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Jaime Antonio is 34 years old and lives with his life partner and their children, who are still in school. He works growing corn, beans, and other crops. He has worked in agriculture for 10 years, which has provided him with very valuable experience to perform better in his trade. 
He always procures very good crops and therefore the product he sells in the surrounding areas is very high quality. He sells at affordable prices and offers an excellent service as well.
Jaime Antonio is a hard worker and a family man. He is always on the lookout for new opportunities that may allow him to have a better future. During this sowing season he will increase production on 3.5 acres of land, but he needs to invest in supplies, which is why he is requesting a loan from Integral. This will allow him to purchase corn seed, beans, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizer, and other items. Jaime Antonio has very good credit references and is certain that he will pay off the financing in full and also that he will offer his family the quality of life they deserve.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed, beans, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizer.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark, 26 years old, is a married entrepreneur in Mohon, Panaon with one child, and he is earning from his transport service business. It was started almost 2 years ago now and he earns 6,000 PHP a month.

To improve business, he borrowed the amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, which he just joined recently, to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba is taking out another Kiva loan of 40,000 KES to establish a video shop business. With the loan, she wants to purchase a television, chairs and tables for use at the video room. She is giving thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a television, chairs and tables for use at the video room.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is requesting another loan for 40,000 KES, which she will use to do plumbing in her house. With the loan, she wants to purchase water pipes for water installation in her house. This loan will help to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes for installing in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants and prepare the soil for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is single and has one child.  To earn a living, she runs a salon, which she has been doing for three years.  She employs three people in her business. 

Hannah is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy a blow drier and hair treatments.  She has expanded her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  In the future, she hopes to increase her clientele.

loans.use: to purchase a blow drier and hair treatments.

loans.name: Las Escogidas 4 Group

texts.en:
Juliana is one of the members of the group Las Escogidas 4 (The Chosen). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. This group is located in one of the rural villages surrounding the main city of San Pedro de Macoris. 

Juliana has had seven loans with us and she has grown her business. She has operated her business for around four years, selling miscellaneous products such as clothes, shoes, jewelry, cosmetics and many other items. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to increase her inventory by buying a dozen of each product. 

Juliana said that her most difficult challenge is to develop her business and to take care of her children. She wants to have a store where she can provide products that her community needs.

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products like clothes, shoes, cosmetics, jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase coffee plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es: Cuando Rosalía se casó ella comenzó a trabajar en el negocio del café ayudando a su esposo en las labores de cultivo y cosecha. Recuerda que al principio le era muy difícil pues no estaba acostumbrada a ese tipo de actividades, pues además de ayudar a su esposo se encargaba de todas las labores del hogar y de atender a sus hijos. Con el tiempo fue adquiriendo experiencia y sus hijos crecieron y todo fue más sencillo. Sin embargo su esposo murió hace unos meses y ella se tuvo que hacer cargo por completo de las fincas de café, siendo sus hijos quienes le ayudan, pero como ellos ya están casados no pueden descuidar sus otras actividades. Rosalía produce café orgánico, esto quiere decir que no utiliza componentes químicos para fertilizar y necesita de un crédito para realizar labores de limpieza y preparación de su terreno. A ella le gustaría en un futuro aumentar su producción para tener mejores ingresos y para esto piensa comprar 300 plantas más de café. Otra de las cosas que tiene planeado hacer con los ingresos extra que obtenga será construir una bodega al lado de su finca para almacenar leña, café y algunas herramientas de trabajo para no tener que estar transportando diariamente estas cosas.
texts.en:
When Rosalía got married she started working in the coffee business helping her husband with the growing and harvesting tasks.  She recalls that at the beginning it was very difficult because she wasn’t used to this type of activity and because in addition to helping her husband she also did all the household tasks and cared for her children.  In time, she acquired experience and her children grew and everything became simpler.  However, her husband died a few months ago and she had to completely take over the coffee farm with help from her children but since they are already married they can’t neglect their other activities.

Rosalía produces organic coffee which means she uses no chemicals to fertilize and she needs a loan to do the clearing tasks and to prepare the soil.  In future, she’d like to increase production to earn higher income and to do so she’s thinking about buying 300 more coffee plants.  Another one of the things she has planned to do with extra income she earns is to build a warehouse next to her farm to store firewood, coffee and some work tools so that she doesn’t have to be transporting these things every day.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and to prepare the soil for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for his next coffee crop.

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice lives in Yei. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for two years. She is 40 years old, married, and has six children; three of them are still in school. 

Rejoice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina is 35 year old, married, and has six children; three of them are still in school. The family lives in Yei where she has run a food stall for the past three years.
 
Clementina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This will be her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase beans and groundnuts paste to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and groundnuts paste to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and seed coffee plants.

loans.name: Ema

texts.en:
Ema lives in Yei. She sells clothes and has been in this business for three years. She is 35 years old, married, and has no children. 

Ema heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 Sudanese Pounds in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela  buys sacks of raw rice and retails them in her community where she lives at Elmina in Cape Coast. She is a widow and has four children. She uses her income to take care of her family. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice to keep to retail later as the price of rice keeps increasing. She wishes to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice to store for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food  such  as beans, bananas and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia is a twenty-five-year-old ambitious woman living in Kasese, Uganda.She has been selling clothes for four years.Her hardships are customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase stock to meet the tastes and preferences of her customers. Her personal goals are educating children, buying a car, and building a permanent house.  Her business goals are buying land to grow crops, hiring employees to help expand her business, and expanding the business into new markets.  Sylivia intends to buy land for farming with the loan facility.

loans.use: to buy land for farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee seeds to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy a motorcycle.
The business has been very lucrative a he has been able to provide basics to the family a such as timely payment of his children's school fees. He has challenges of accidents and high fuel costs. His vision is to own at least six motorcycles. Charles needs the loan to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a 42-year-old housewife caring for three daughters. 

Asmaa and her husband work together at home to make different types of pickles to sell. Using their income and their oldest son’s income, they manage to improve their living conditions. 

They reserve a part of the business income in order to expand the business by making a greater quantity and adding new types of pickles each time.

Now Asmaa has applied for this loan to buy more plastic jars of different sizes.

loans.use: to buy more plastic jars of different sizes.

loans.name: Rafaelito

texts.en:
Rafaelito lives in Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He sells appliances, which he has been doing for five years. He earns an income of 4,000 PHP a month.
 
Rafaelito is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, which he will use to purchase new items to expand his product offering. He joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand his product offering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare her fields and buy organic fertilizer for her coffee business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and coffee plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot of land to plant more coffee.

loans.name: Luz De Maria

texts.es: Luz de María, cuarenta años de edad vive junto a su familia en casa propia, ella es una muy buena comerciante tiene varios negocios pequeños donde recibe ingresos,  posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, una venta de ropa y un molino, todo es muy rentable, ya tiene varios años de dedicarse al negocio y está muy orgullosa de poderlos sostener, es muy conocida en la zona por su honestidad y buen servicio se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues saben que lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y a precios accesibles; Luz de María es una mujer activa, enérgica, dedicada a su labor siempre pendiente apuntándole a las nuevas oportunidades que le se le presentan, Luz quiere comprar insumos para su negocio pero necesita capital por eso  solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mercadería para tienda, zapatos, ropa, etc. Luz de María tiene capacidad de pago y está segura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en: Luz de María is 40 years old and lives in a home of her own.  She is a good businesswoman and has various small businesses where she receives income.  She has a store where she sells primary needs products, a store where she sells clothing, and a mill.  Each is very profitable.  She has been doing this for several years and is very proud to be able to maintain them.  She is very well known within her zone because of her honesty and the good service she has given to many customers, and they know that she sells good quality items at good prices.  Luz de María is an active, energetic, woman dedicated to her work and always on the lookout for new opportunities presented to her.  Luz wants to buy supplies for her business, but needs working capital, so she has requested a loan, through INTEGRAL, that will allow her to buy merchandise for her store, including shoes, clothing, etc.  Luz de María is able to pay and she is certain that she can meet the demand and at the same time provide a better life to her family.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, con la intensión de fortalecer el negocio y poder obtener mejores ganancias, se comprara frutas, verduras y ropa, de las que podemos mencionar, sandias, manzanas, fresas, blusas, faldas, pantalones.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, esto la ha motivado a seguir trabajando con préstamos, para poderse desarrollar en el comercio y también generar mayores ganancias, ella esta realizando ventas de antojitos y frutas tres veces por semana y los otros dias se dedica a la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Candelaria decided to ask for a new loan in order to strengthen her business, so that she can obtain higher profits. She will purchase fruits, vegetables, and clothing. Some examples would be watermelons, apples, strawberries, blouses, skirts, and pants.
Her last loan had positive effects, which has motivated her to keep working with loans so that she can develop her business and also generate higher profits. She is selling snacks and fruit three times a week and the rest of the time she works selling clothing.

loans.use: to purchase watermelons, apples, strawberries, blouses, skirts, pants.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 28-year-old single man who has been working in glass-cleaning since 2004. He is in the business of cleaning the front glass of all shops and buildings.

His business is expanding and he has to expand it more and more through increasing his tools, detergents, and staff working with him. That's why he applied for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. 

In the future, he will try his best to open a private office in which to keep his tools and detergents, rather than keeping them at home.

Also in the future, he hopes to open a private big company that deals with all cleaning services.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants and prepare the fields for planting.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela, tiene la edad  de 35 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y su hijo los cuales son su mayor prioridad. El con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de una máquina para coser, y de esta manera poder realizar la fabricación de la ropa con mayor eficiencia y mejor calidad. Con esta compra pretende hacer más ropa y así cumplir con los pedidos a corto plazo. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 35 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and her son, and they are her greatest priority.

She will use this loan to buy a sewing machine.  This way she will be able to make clothes with greater efficiency and better quality.  With this purchase she intends to make more clothes and to fill orders in the short term.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has had no previous loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR provided the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge Ignacio, tiene la edad  de 18 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres y hermanos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. El con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de abarrotes para la pulpería, y de esta manera poderle ofrecer a los clientes una mayor cantidad de productos para el consumo humano y todos de buena calidad. Con esta compra pretende tener mejores ingresos para invertir más en su pulpería y cumplir metas que en el futuro le mejorará su calidad de vida para él y su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jorge Ignacio is 18 years old, single and lives with his parents and brothers, whom are his main priority. 

With his loan he will buy groceries for his local store, and in this way will be able to offer the customers a greater quantity of products and of high quality.  With this purchase he hopes to have better profits, to invest more in his local store, and reach his goals that in the future he will increase the quality of life for him and his family. 

This is the first loan he received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't have other loans in state banks before, but FUDECOSUR brought him the loan with better facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy groceries

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has been in farming for 13 years and currently employs one farmhand at her farm, producing and selling maize and beans. She is widowed and has an adult son who is 27 years old.

Joyce has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. She plans to own a farm of not less than 3,000 birds. She says her farming income will go into her savings to secure her old-age days.

She points at diseases and poor roads network as the leading challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure two dairy cows

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en:
Shaban is a farmer in the Kitake area of Western Kenya and lives with his wife and one child aged 4 years in his rural home. He has been practicing mixed farming for 6 consecutive years and selling the main produce of maize and poultry products to the local markets.

Shaban has made a loan request amounting to 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry birds for his business. He says he wants to save bigger chunk of his farming income to secure his family's future.

He laments the high costs of maintaining the poultry birds. He is thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan services.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Musyene Thuyimanaye Group

texts.en: Josinta is a thirty-one-year-old woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling clothes for two years. Her hardships are inadequate capital to purchase stock, finding customers, and high taxes. Her personal goals are educating her children, building a permanent house, and saving for a wedding since she is still cohabiting. Her business goals are buying land to grow crops, expanding her business into new markets, and moving her business to a more permanent location. Josinta wants money to buy clothes to sell. She is a member of the above mentioned group where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aseel

texts.en:
Aseel, 21, is a young married lady. Her husband works in an aluminum shop and they have one child.

Aseel wants to provide her child with the best environment and care. Because of that, she started a small clothing sales business. 

Now she has applied for this youth loan to bring in a summer collection of clothes to increase her revenue.

loans.use: to bring in a summer collection of clothes.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is 38 years old, married, and has two children.  To earn a living, he runs a retail shop. He employs one person in the business.  

Harrison is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy sugar, cooking, maize flour, and salt. Since joining Faulu Kenya, he has expanded his business because he has been trained in business management skills.  In the future, Harrison hopes to expand his business into wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking, maize flour, and salt.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a thirty-eight-year-old married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

She has personal goals of educating her children, building a permanent house, and buying a car. She has been a farmer for the last ten years. She is facing hardships of price fluctuations, inflation, and seasonal weather variations that make planning difficult. 

She has a vision of diversifying her business to include a retail shop, buying land to grow more crops, and hiring employees to help her expand her business. Beatrice wants a loan to buy onions for planting and paying for employees that are weeding the garden.

loans.use: to buy onions for planting and pay employees that are weeding  the garden.

loans.name: El Banquito Del Ahorro Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen de 58 años tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su vecindario; ya son aproximadamente 15 años que tiene el negocio y junto a su esposo atienden a sus clientes, cuando empezó era una bodega pequeñita pero gracias a sus préstamos  ahora es uno de las más surtidas del lugar, gracias a su trabajo es que han podido sustentar los gastos de la familia, darle estudios a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda, en su bodega vende toda clase de productos sobretodo productos de pan llevar, con el crédito obtenido por medio de la alcancía EL BANQUITO DEL AHORRO al cual pertenece, comprará azúcar y arroz que son los más vendidos en su bodega, lo que más desea la Sra. Carmen es hacer más grande su negocio.
*La Sra. Carmen es la Sra. que parece a la derecha de la fotografia viste polo morado con flores y lleva un bolso cruzado.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen is 58 years old and has a grocery store that has been in operation for approximately 15 years.  She and her husband attend to the public who have faithfully supported her business.  When she started, Carmen's store was very small but thanks to the loans her establishment is now one of the most well-stocked stores in the area.  Her work has enabled her to maintain the family expenses, provide an education for her children, and make improvements to her home.  Her store sells all types of products for everyday consumption.  

The loan she obtained is through her Communal Bank "El Banquito del Ahorro" (The Little Savings Bank), where she is a member.  Carmen will buy rice and sugar, since these are the products that she sells the most in her store.  What she hopes for the most is to continue in her business.  

*In the photo, Sra. Carmen is the fourth person on the right with a shoulder bag.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a resident of Kisii, South Rift Kenya where he resides with his family of two children aged five and three years. He has been in farming and lumbering for more than five years and meets his family's needs through his farming business. His farm produces maize, beans, milk and bananas.

Edward has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow to boost his dairy farming. He adds the income from dairy farming will be used more specifically to expand his lumbering business. He plans to expand his lumbering business and improve the living standards of his children as well as educate them.

He laments of heavy rains and poor roads network.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre joven de 18 años quien nación y vivió toda su vida en el campo, es casado con María Mercedes con quien tiene un hijo y viven en la parroquia de "Tixan" que pertenece al cantón "Alausí" el cual se ubica en el centro del Ecuador. Su geografía es irregular; tiene valles subtropicales, páramos, depresiones inmensas por las que descienden pequeños pero torrentosos ríos. Cada una de sus nueve parroquias se caracteriza por sus rasgos culturales, sus fiestas y folcklor. Alausí tiene una población indígena descendiente, en su mayoría, de mitimáes Coyas de las riveras del Titicaca.

Este joven emprendedor ha cursado y completado su educación secundaria, pero al mismo tiempo ha trabajado con su familia en el campo. En la montaña su familia tiene extensiones de terreno las cuales son usadas principalmente en la siembra de trigo y lenteja. Actualmente para sustentar a su pequeña familia desea invertir en su propia siembra y para ello solicitó un crédito, el cual le permita comprar semilla y fertilizantes para de esta manera la cosecha sirva para comprar lo que su esposa e hijo necesitan para vivir. Actualmente trabaja 8 horas al día junto a su familia.

A pesar de ser su primera operación de crédito es considerado un cliente con bajo riesgo de incurrir en morosidad según su asesor crediticio. El es optimista ya que se considera "una persona con ganas de trabajar" y cree firmemente que con este crédito el mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos, 18, is a young man who was born and has lived his entire life in the countryside.  He’s married to María Mercedes with whom he has a son.  They live in Tixan Parish that belongs to Alausí Canton located in the center of Ecuador.  Its topography is irregular; it has subtropical valleys, moors and deep chasms through which small but torrential rivers flow.  Each of its nine cantons is characterized by cultural traits, festivals and folklore.  Alausí has a population descended from indigenous people, mostly from Mitimáes Coyas from the shores of Lake Titicaca.

This young man has attended and completed secondary education but has also worked in the fields with his family at the same time.  His family has fields up the mountain that are used primarily to grow wheat and lentils.  At present, to support his small family he wants to invest in his own crops which is why he’s requested a loan to be able to buy seeds and fertilizer so that his harvest will serve to buy what his wife and son need to live.  He currently works 8 hours per day alongside his family.

Despite this being his first credit transaction, he’s considered to be a client at low-risk for default by his credit assessor.  He’s optimistic because he considers himself to be “a person with the will to work” and he strongly believes that with this loan his quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya in her rural home area where she lives with her family of one child aged one. She has been in the farming business for 3 years and produces tea and bananas, which are sold within the local market. She gets additional income from her grocery retail business.

Nancy has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to build a zero-grazing unit and buy poultry birds.. She says this will diversify her farming income and improve her family living standards. She also plans to buy more acres of land to expand her banana plantation. 

Nancy says the high costs of farming inputs and labour are the greatest challenge in the farming business.

loans.use: to build a zero-grazing unit and buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a mother of three children. One attends school while two are working. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and electricity bills.

For the past three years, she has operated a farming business, selling farm produce of green vegetables to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also operates a grocery shop, which contributes another source of income. She dreams of expanding her business to hire more employees in the future. 

Caroline is requesting KES 20,000 to purchase manure and seedlings and to pay her employees. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase manure and seedlings and to pay her employees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius, age 23, is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya. He has been involved in mixed farming for five years, producing and selling maize and milk to the local market. 

Julius has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.This is his first loan request with Juhudi Kilimo and remains optimistic he will be able to grow his  family farming business and rank among the leading milk suppliers for the local market in the future.

Julius says the high cost of animal feed and rampant diseases have been his major challenges since he became an active farmer. He remains appreciative of Juhudi Kilimo's support of smaller-size farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Mwanaisha is a 48-year-old married woman. She has 5 children, and all are enrolled in school. Mwanaisha operates a fish selling business and sells her goods from her home. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge as seasonality, and her highest monthly expense is school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwanaisha will use the KES 10,000 loan to expand her business by purchasing cooking pans and cooking oil for frying fish for sale. Mwanaisha aspires to open a new retail shop in the future. She joined Yehu because of its good history.

loans.use: to purchase cooking pans and cooking oil for frying fish for sale.

loans.name: Parvaiz Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Parvaiz Bibi is a 36-year-old married woman with three children: two sons and one daughter. All of her children are getting an education from a nearby school. 

Parvaiz is a very cooperative lady. She handles her animal sales business. She raises her animals with great care and quality food. At the time of sales, she gets good profits, which gives a great boost to her business. 

Parvaiz’s husband is also a very hardworking person. He drives a rickshaw of his own. He transports his passengers and drops them off at their destinations. He has set the fares according to the destinations and the fares are quite affordable for the passengers. 

Parvaiz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her animal sales business. She will invest the loan in the purchase of animals (goats) for raising them for reselling. 

She is hopeful that the loan investment will give better financial results to her business.

Note: One of the members has a sewing business. That is why she is showing the sewing machine in this picture.

loans.use: to buy animals for reselling.

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Sitha’s business is in purchasing, raising, and selling cows. His wife, Sokhay, is a weaver. 

They live in a village along the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have three children, one son and two daughters. Two are attending school and another one is still young. 

Sitha is asking for a loan of $700 to help his capital in order to buy additional cows for sale.

loans.use: to buy additional cows for sale.

loans.name: Luis Ramon

texts.es:
Luis, enérgico y dinámico lo encontramos en pleno día ejerciendo su actividad como dueño de un taller de vulcanizacion y a la vez ayundandole a su esposa con el kiosco , nos cuenta que su primer prestamo el cual utilizo para surtir su kiosco el cual es atendido por su esposa, este credito ha sido  muy positivo y de mucha utilidad las ventas en verano fueron muy buenas,las frutas, el pan , los snacks, galletas , gaseosas y tambien invirtio en su taller de vulcanizacion. Esta muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado de Kiva y MiCredito.
En esta ocasion solicita el credito  Kiva para invertir solo en el kiosco y comprar gaseosa, jugos, frutas, productos de limpieza, cosméticos, avenas, cornflakes para surtir la venta de nuevos productos ya que se acercan las fiestas patronales del mes de mayo y la celebración del día de las madres  y  es una temporada excelente para vender. 
Luis dice que siempre seguirá luchando  para seguir mejorando y  ampliando  mas la pulpería y conseguir mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
We found energetic, dynamic Luis in the very middle of his work day carrying out his activity as the owner of a tire store and at the same time helping his wife with her kiosk.  He tells us that he used his first loan to stock his kiosk that his wife tends to; it was very positive and profits from summer sales or fruit, bread, snacks, cookies and soft-drinks were very good.  He is also able to invest his profits into his tire store. He’s very grateful for the support provided by Kiva and MiCredito.

On this occasion he is asking for a second Kiva loan to invest in the kiosk to buy soft-drinks, juice, fruit, cleaning supplies, cosmetics, oatmeal and corn flakes to stock up with new products because the May patron saint days are approaching as well as the  Mother’s Day celebration which are excellent seasons for selling.

Luis says that he will always continue to strive to improve and expand his grocery store more and to succeed in improving his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Luisa Emilia

texts.es: Luisa habitante de Estelí, casada, de 64 años de edad es de oficio comerciante en el negocio de pulpería desde hace 10 años, madre de 6 hijos de los cuales solo uno esta a su cargo. Inicio su actividad con dinero propio ya que anteriormente se dedica a la sastrería negocio del cual fue ahorrando hasta poner su propia pulpería donde recibe el apoyo de su esposo, ella se siente satisfecha con su negocio pues le ha generado mas ingresos ya que se encuentra en una zona muy transitada, no tiene competencia. Solicita el crédito para comprar aceite, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, jabón, gaseosa, etc, todo los productos que se necesitan para surtir el negocio el cual estima le ayudara ya que aumentaran sus ventas lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ganancias, sus planes futuros es ampliar la parte de su pulpería para aumentar su inventario y hacerle mejora a su casa, sus metas próximas es poner nuevamente su sastrería y comprar una buena maquina para mejor la calidad de su trabajo con el objetivo de salir adelante y vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Luisa is a resident of Estelí.  She is 64 years old, married, and the mother of six children, but only one is still under her care.  Luisa is a merchant and has managed a grocery business for 10 years.  She started this business with her own money.  Luisa previously owned a tailoring business and used her savings to open a grocery store, where she receives assistance from her husband.  She is satisfied with her business since it generates more income as a result of being located in a very busy area with no competition.  

Luisa is requesting a loan in order to buy oil, beans, rice, sugar, soap, sodas, and other products that are needed to restock her business.  This will help increase her sales and her profits.  Her future plans include expanding part of her store so that she can have more inventory and to make improvements to her house.  Luisa's next goals are to reopen her tailoring business and buy a new machine for improving the quality of her work with the intention of moving forward and living comfortably.

loans.use: to buy oil, beans, rice, sugar, soap, sodas, and other products.

loans.name: El Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “El Amanecer“ está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; costuras, banquetearía, venta de ropa usada, taller de electricidad mecánica, venta de ropa interior, comida rápida, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Elizabeth, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en la primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una polera de color negro y encima usa un chaleco de color gris, su pelo es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de las costuras, bordados y confección de ropa específicamente en buzos, polerones, se ocupa de este negocio desde hace 1 año, trabaja todos los días y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, ya que su hija es pequeña.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en la cuidad de Santiago por ser un lugar donde encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprara todo tipo de hilos, telas, botones, cierres para abastecer su taller de costuras.
Las metas en su negocio son tener la oportunidad  de tener un local independiente y agregar máquinas industriales como bordadoras y así ofrecer una mejor calidad en su trabajo de costuras y confección a su clientela.
Elizabeth vive junto a su hija de 8 años de edad, quien se encuentra estudiando y uno de sus sueños son dar una estabilidad económica a  su hija para que a futuro pueda estudiar en la universidad.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile,
como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “El Amanecer” (Dawn) and it has 18 entrepreneurs who carry out various lines of work among which we have:  sewing, catering, used clothes sales, electrician, underwear sales, fast-food and services, among others.  All are from the city of Chillán.

Elizabeth, communal bank President, appears in the photo standing in the first row, second from left to right, wearing a black shirt and gray vest; her hair is dark brown and she wears it loose.

She sews, embroiders and makes clothes specifically sweatshirts and t-shirts.  She’s been in this business for a year and works every day.  She manages her time according to availability because her daughter is little.

The merchandise she needs she buys in the city of Santiago because it’s a place where she can find merchandise at low cost so it’s convenient economically.

She will use the loan to buy all types of thread, fabric, buttons and zippers to stock her sewing workshop.  Her business goals are to have the opportunity to have an independent locale and to add industrial machines like embroiderers to offer better quality in the sewing and dressmaking work to her customers.

Elizabeth lives with her 8-year-old daughter who is studying and one of her dreams is to give economic stability to her daughter so that in the future she can attend the university.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza is giving her because it’s allowed her to invest in her business.  Also, she feels very comfortable in the company of the other entrepreneurs in the communal bank because they share different activities.

Chillán is a commune in the south-central part of Chile.  Its name means “Seat of the Sun” in Mapudungun, the language of our indigenous Mapuches.  Chillán is known as the “Cradle of the Fatherland” or “Land of Artists” because many outstanding figures in Chilean history were born in this city like, for example, the well-known pianist, Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Jesús Vive Group

texts.es:
El comité  Jesús Vive se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y activas que siempre se esfuerzan por poder ayudar a sus familias.
Leodegaria es una de las miembros del grupo, ella se dedica a las ventas, tiene una despensa bien surtida, donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad con lo que surte a su vecindario y les da todo lo que necesitan. Su meta es poder seguir abasteciendo su negocio y de esa forma seguir ayudando también a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, bebidas, lacteos, yerba azúcar y demás insumos con los que podrá surtir su negocio y de esa forma seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Jesús Vive” Committee was formed by various residents of the city of Santini.  They are hardworking active women who always try hard to help their families.

Leodegaria is one of the group’s members and sells groceries.  She has a well assorted store where she sells all sorts of primary needs products and she supplies her whole neighborhood with what they need.  Her goal is to be able to continue helping her family.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy meats, drinks, milk products, sugar, and other supplies to stock her business and in this way be able to continue offering good quality to her customers.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El presente comite se formo gracias a una de las miembros, quien invito a sus amigas y vecinas y de alli surgio el grupo. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer  ciclo del programa de comité,  y su deseo es poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
La Sra Aida tiene 37 años de edad, está casada con el Sr Calixto quien es Vendedor, juntos tienen 3 hijos. La Sra. Aida se dedica a la venta de planteras y también de abono, en lo que le va muy bien, pues ya tiene una buena clientela. Su deseo es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma algún día tener un gran negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de planteras, abonos, plantas y demás insumos para poder seguir en su negocio.
texts.en:
This committee was created thanks to one of the members who invited her friends and neighbors, and that's how the group came up. 
Currently they are in the first cycle of the committee's program, and their wish is to be able to reach the maximum level of the program. Aida is 37 years old, is married to Calixto, who is a salesman, and they have 3 children together. Aida sells planters and also fertilizer, she does very well at this, since she already has a good customer base. Her wish is to be able to continue growing and in that way get to have a big business someday. She requests a loan to purchase planters, fertilizers, plants and other supplies in order to be able to continue with her business.

loans.use: to purchase planters, fertilizer, plants and other supplies

loans.name: Adela Elsa

texts.es:
Adela es una mujer de 62 años, natural de la ciudad de Pisco, es madre soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, ya que por el terremoto ocurrido en agosto del 2007 lamentablemente su casa se derrumbo; ella siempre ha sido entusiasta y luchadora que ha sabido superar las adversidades sacando adelante a su familia. 
Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor Adela ha realizado diversos trabajos como empleada del hogar, luego como confeccionista de ropa por varios años, y actualmente desde hace más de 4 años se dedica a la venta de ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, ella cree que su negocio marcha bien ya que cuenta con buenos clientes que acuden a ella porque ofrece buenas prendas y precios, así como por su amabilidad, carisma y buena atención.
Adela se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mas mercadería, tales como: polos, blusas, pantalones jeans, ropa para niños, entre otros; de esta manera podrá aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres ya que son adultos mayores que necesitan de su cuidado.
texts.en:
Adela, 62, was born in the city of Pisco and is a single mother. She lives in her parents' home because, sadly, the August 2007 earthquake destroyed her house. She had always been enthusiastic and hardworking and has learned to overcome adversity and provide for her family. 

Thanks to her enterprising spirit, Adela has had a variety of jobs: household worker; then for several years, dressmaker; and for the past 4 years, vendor of men's, women's, and children's clothing. She believes her business is doing well and she has good customers because she offers good clothing, prices, and service and because she is friendly and charismatic.

Adela is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their help she will be able to buy more merchandise like polo shirts, blouses, pants, jeans, children's clothing, and other items.  She will be able to increase her sales and income. This will help her improve her parents' lives since they are older and need her care.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like polo shirts, blouses, pants, jeans, children's clothing, and other items.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: Roberto Carlos de 34 años de edad vive con su familia en zona rural y vive en casa humilde, es un  hombre emprendedor que cada mañana se levanta con nuevas ilusiones y ver la manera de salir adelante por él y su familia;  actualmente se dedica a la agricultura y así ha sido durante 20 años, cultivando pepino, maíz y frijol. Vende una parte de lo que cosecha y es así como solventa los gastos diarios que posee y lleva cada día el pan a su casa, pero además Roberto siendo un hombre emprendedor cuando no está cultivando trabaja como jornalero, prestando sus servicios a otros que están dedicados a la agricultura. Desea ampliar su producción y ver la manera de vender más productos, cultiva sus granos como son el maíz, frijol y pepinos en terreno propiedad de su mamá junto a quien vive. Desea comprar insumos agrícolas para poder cultivar mayor cantidad de maíz, necesita fertilizantes, herbicidas, herramientas como azadón y Cuma. Y dado que no cuenta con recursos propios solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para comprarlos, espera contar con éste importante apoyo y con el cual pretende realizar uno de sus más grandes sueños, que es ser un agricultor independiente y trabajar a tiempo completo sus tierras. Esta seguro que este año 2012 su cosecha será abundante y que podrá cancelar el crédito que solicita,  y que con ésta ayuda podrá mejorar las condiciones de su vida y de su familia.-
texts.en:
Roberto Carlos, age 34, lives with his family in a humble house in a rural area.  He is an enterprising man who gets up every morning with new expectations for seeing the way to get ahead for him and his family.

He currently devotes himself to farming, as he has done for 20 years.  He grows cucumbers, corn, and beans.  He sells part of his harvest, and that is how he covers the daily expenses he has, and he brings home the daily bread.
