Roberto, being an entrepreneur, works as a day worker when he is not cultivating his crops.  He lends his services to others who devote themselves to agriculture.  He wishes to increase his production and see the way to sell more products.

He grows crops like corn, beans, and cucumbers on his mother’s land, and he lives with her.  He wishes to buy agricultural supplies to be able to grow a greater quantity of corn.  He needs fertilizers, herbicides, and tools like hoes and machetes.

Given that he does not have his own resources, he requesting a loan from INTEGRAL.  He will use the loan to buy agricultural tools.  He hopes to have this important support, and with it he will try to fulfill one of his biggest dreams.  This is to be an independent farmer and to work full time on his land.

He is sure that this year, 2012, his harvest will be abundant, and he will be able to repay the loan he is requesting.  With this help, he will be able to improve his living conditions and those of his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to be able to grow more corn. He needs fertilizers, herbicides, and farming tools.

loans.name: Nestor Alcides

texts.es: Néstor se dedica a la venta de productos de bazar y papelería en un local que está ubicado en Libertad su domicilio. Tiene 50 años y está casado con Gina quien es ama de casa. Néstor nos cuenta que empezó su negocio por iniciativa de su esposa quien quería desempeñar una actividad. Reunió un poco de capital e instalo la papelería y juntos empezaron la atención al público el cual realizan de lunes a sábados. Hace 3 años tomo esta decisión la cual le ha dado muchos beneficios y le ha permitido mantener su forma de vida cuidando a su familia. En el local venden cuadernos, plumas, cartulina, peluches, copias, encuaderna. La variedad de los productos que ofrecen es lo que hace que tenga gran variedad de clientes. Con el préstamo piensa comprar una impresora y copiadora para brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Néstor makes a living selling stationery and shop products in a store located in his home town Libertad. He is 50 years old and is married to Gina who is a housewife. Néstor tells us that he started his business due to his wife's initiative, as she wanted to start a business activity. He collected a little capital and set up a stationery shop and together they started to serve customers from Monday to Saturday. 

Three years ago he made this decision and it has produced a lot of profit and has allowed him to maintain his lifestyle looking after his family. In his shop they sell notebooks, pens, card, soft toys, photocopying and binding services. The variety of products they offer is what brings a great variety of customers. With the loan he wants to buy a photocopier and printer in order to offer a better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, card, soft toys, a photocopier.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is taking out another Kiva loan in the amount of 40,000 KES in order to strengthen her tailoring business.  With this loan, she plans to purchase both a sewing machine and cloth for use in her business.  

Since taking out the previous loan, Juliet’s business has improved and she has been able to provide better living standards for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and cloth for use in her business.

loans.name: Los Avellanos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Los Avellanos” está conformado por 16 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, venta de leña y carbón, venta de ensaladas, venta de chocolates, venta de productos de belleza, feriantes, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna Padres las Casas ubicada en la ciudad de Temuco.
Elizabeth, secretaria del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentre de pie hacia el fondo de izquierda a derecha, viste un poleron color gris, su cabello es de  color negro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio en venta de provisiones, se ocupa de este negocio desde hace 1 año. Además tiene venta de leña y carbón y algunas veces venta de pan amasado.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en la ciudad de cholchol, y otras veces en distribuidoras y supermecados.
Con el crédito comprará harina, manteca, margarina, carbón y agregará otros insumos a su negocio.
Las metas de Elizabeth son tener una botillería dentro de su negocio, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Elizabeth vive con su marido y 4 hijos. Sus sueños son instalar su botillería para complementar su negocio y atender a su clientela de manera satisfactoria.
Elizabeth está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
Padre Las Casas es una comuna del sur de Chile, cercana a la ciudad de Temuco, región de la Araucanía.  Su nombre le fue dado en honor al sacerdote español Bartolomé de Las Casas, quien fue un defensor de los indígenas durante la conquista de América. Destaca una numerosa población mapuche en esta comuna. Basa su economía en la agroindustria y servicios comerciales.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Los Avellanos” (The Hazel Nut Trees) and it has 16 entrepreneurs who carry out various lines of work among which are found: clothing sales, firewood and charcoal sales, salad sales, chocolates sales, beauty products sales, street market merchants and services, among others.  All are from the Padres Las Casas Commune located in the city of Temuco.

Elizabeth, communal bank Secretary, appears in the photo standing in the rear from left to right wearing a gray shirt; she wears her black hair gathered up.

She is a grocery merchant; she’s been in this business for a year.  She also sells firewood and charcoal and sometimes baked bread.

Merchandise she needs she buys in the city of Cholcol and sometimes from suppliers and supermarkets.

She will use the loan to buy flour, lard, margarine and charcoal and will add other supplies to her business.  Elizabeth’s goal is to have an ice-cream shop inside her store thus opting for a better quality of life.

Elizabeth lives with her husband and four children.  Her dream is to open an ice-cream shop to add to her business and tend to her customers in a satisfactory way.

Elizabeth is very happy and grateful for the loans and services granted by Fondo Esperanza.  She also comments that she feels very comfortable with the meetings and with her communal bank group because generosity and unity exist.

Padre Las Casas is a commune in south Chile near the city of Temuco in the Araucanía Region.  It got its name in honor of the Spanish priest, Bartolomé de Las Casas, who was a defender of Indian rights during the conquest of America.  A numerous Mapuche population stands out in the commune.  Its economy is based on agribusiness and commercial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, lard, margarine, charcoal and other products to add to her store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is requesting another loan for 45,000 KES, which she will use to establish a cereals business. With the loan, she will purchase sacks of beans, maize, rice, and a weighing machine and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, maize, rice, and a weighing machine.

loans.name: Carla

texts.es:
Carla forma parte del Banco comunal “Samuel Francisco” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro de ventas de frutas y verduras, además venta de rotisería y artículos en general, se dedica a este rubro desde hace 10 años, trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las 8:30 hasta las 10:30, su negocio lo ubica en su propia casa.
Su mercadería la compra en abastecimientos de frutas y verduras, supermercados y distribuidoras de artículos en general, ya que encuentra sus productos a menor precio, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará frutas, verduras y artículos como pinches, juguetes peinetas accesorios varios.
Una de sus metas son tener la posibilidad de arreglar su negocio que sea más surtido y a la vez pintarlo, poner puertas nuevas, arreglar el piso y nueva iluminación.
Carla vive junto a sus 2 hijos de 9 y 6 años de edad, sus sueños a nivel personal son estar más tranquila con su negocio y administrar bien las ganancias para optar a una mejor calidad de vida junto a sus hijos.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio.
Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción.
Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en: Carla belongs to communal bank “Samuel Francisco”, in the city of Talca. She sells fruits and vegetables as well as spit-roasted meat and general articles. She has been doing so for 10 years. She works Monday to Sunday from 8:30 to 10:30; her business operates in her own home. She buys her products from fruit and vegetable distributors, in supermarkets and from general articles distributors, since those sell them at a lower price, which means it is the best thing to do from an economic standpoint. With the loan she will buy fruits, vegetables and general articles such as hairgrips, toys, hair accessories and other accessories. One of her goals is to be able to restore her retail space, to have more to offer and to repaint the walls, buy new doors, redo the floor and lighting. Carla lives with her two children, aged 9 and 6. Her personal goals are to be more at ease with her business and to manage the profits well in order to have a better quality of life with her children. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity afforded to her by field partner Fondo Esperanza, since it allowed her to invest in her business. She also feels very comfortable in the company of the other women entrepreneurs in her communal bank group, since they share various activities and interests, and the group provides a welcome distraction from everyday life. Thanks to the training imparted in group meetings, Carla learned to better manage her business. Talca belongs to the Maule region, located in the central part of the country. It is the administrative, economic and cultural centre of the region: it is the most important city of the Chilean central valley. A curious fact about Talca is the existence of a somewhat obscure phrase in Chile: "Talca, París y Londres" ("Talca, Paris, and London"). Several explanations of varying degrees of plausibility circulate about its origins. Some say that it derives from a comment uttered by an Englishman: "Talca parece Londres" (which, in Spanish, sounds almost identical to "Talca, París y Londres", and means "Talca resembles London"). Indeed, in the winter, an abundant fog often blankets the city, as happens in the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, and general articles to sell.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis forma parte del Banco Comunal “Samuel Francisco” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
El se dedica al rubro de venta de frutas y verduras, desde hace 8 años, trabaja junto a su esposa de lunes  a domingo y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye junto a su esposa ya que deben vela r por el cuidado de sus hijos pequeños. 
Su negocio lo ubica en su propio domicilio. El ofrece sus frutas y verduras a restaurantes y a la vez a su clientela que llegan directamente a su local a comprar.
Con el crédito comprará frutas, verduras frescas y arreglará su negocio que se encuentra establecido en su casa.
Una de sus metas es tener la posibilidad de adquirir un almacén, para poder vender otro tipo de artículos.
Luis vive junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 10 y 1 año de edad. 
Sus sueños son tener un almacén, para vender todo tipo de artículos que su clientela le ha solicitado, y a la vez brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
El está muy contento y agradecido de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente cómodo con el grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, lo cual lo motiva a seguir participando en la institución. Comenta además que las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones le han servido para invertir mejor en su negocio. 
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Luis belongs to the communal bank Samuel Francisco, which is in the city of Talca. 
He has been working selling fruits and vegetables for eight years. He works with his wife Monday through Sunday and they distribute the schedule among the two of them, since they must also take care of their young children. 
Their business is located in their home. He offers his fruits and vegetables to restaurants and also to his customers, who come to shop at his store directly.
He will use the loan to purchase fruit and fresh vegetables, and to fix up his business, which is located in his home.
One of his goals is to have the option of acquiring a warehouse, so that he can sell other types of items.
Luis lives with his wife and their two children, of ages ten and one. 
His dream is to have a warehouse so that he can sell all kinds of items which his customers have requested, and at the same time offer his family a better quality of life.
He is very happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, because it has allowed him to invest in his business. He also feels comfortable with the communal bank group he belongs to, which motivates him to continue participating in the institution. He also mentions that the trainings offered at the meetings have helped him to better invest in his business.
Talca belongs to the region of Maule, located in the middle of the country. It constitutes the region's administrative, economic, and cultural center, and it is the most important city in Chile's central valley. There is an interesting saying in Chile, which is "Talca, Paris, and London." Among the myths regarding this phrase, some say that it derives from something once said by an englishman - "Talca looks like London" (both phrases sound almost the same in Spanish) - because of the fog that often covers the city during the winter season, similar to that of the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and fresh vegetables, and fix up his business.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Luque, está integrado por 12 mujeres, todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, quienes se esfuerzan por poder ayudar a sus familias y darles lo mejor todos los días.
La Sra.Cecilia tiene una peluqueria esta casada con el señor Daniel, y tienen  4 hijos.  Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que siempre se esfuerza al maximo para poder cumplir sus metas y de esa forma poder  ayudar a su marido con los gastos que diariamente surgen en la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de productos de todo tipo para su peluquería, como ser acondicionador, tijera, gel, gomitas, shampoo y demás insumos. Cecilia tiene como meta ir agrandando su negocio y  brindando asi un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mujeres Unidas [United Women] is a group which is formed in the city of Luque; it consists of 12 women, all of whom are friends and neighbours of the same city, and who make an effort to help their families and give them the best every day.

Cecilia has a hair saloon. She is married to Daniel and they have four children. She is a very hard working and entrepreneurial person, who always gives her most in order to fulfil her objectives and in this way help her husband with the bills which appear every day in the house.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy all sorts of products for her hair saloon, such as conditioner, scissors, hair gel, hair bands, shampoo and other supplies. Cecilia aims to extend her business and in this way help improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy conditioner, scissors, hair gel, hair bands, shampoo and other supplies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 58 years old.  He is married and has five children.  

He runs a retail shop to earn a living and has been in the business for 12 years.  He employs one person in this business.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business because he has been able to participate in business management skills training.  He has requested a loan of 50, 000 KES in order to buy sugar, cooking fat, soap and maize flour.

In the future, John hopes to grow and transform his business into a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking fat, soap and maize flour.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea is 42, married, and has four children, two of whom attend school, one of whom has full-time employment, and one of whom is a garment worker.  Sothea is a rice farmer. Her husband is a fisherman and house constructor. The family lives in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sothea is requesting a loan for $1,500, which she will use to purchase a motorbike for her son, who is the garment worker, to drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Kumushay

texts.ru: Кумушай 52 года, мать 2 детей.    Кумушай в качестве основного  источника дохода для своей семьи,  с 1999 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начатый  с суммы 35,000 сом бизнес благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости  Кумушай, на сегодня приносит около 11,000 сом в месяц с продажи молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса,  Кумушай обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 85,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку бычков на откорм и перепродажу.  Доходы от кредита  Кумушай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Kumushay is a 52-year-old mother of two children. Since 1999, her main source of income has been farming and animal raising. Thanks to her hard work, Kumushay's business, started from a sum of 35,000 soms, now yields 11,000 soms a month in income. 

In order to expand her business, Kumushay approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" with a request for a loan of 85,000 soms. She will use it to purchase some bulls for fattening and resale. 
Kumushay plans to invest the profits from the loan back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Juan Diego

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 20 años de edad, está casado y su pareja está en la dulce espera de un bebe con lo cual Juan está muy feliz y sobre todo emocionado porque va ser padre por primera vez, vive en un pequeño cuarto, el cual se ubica en la ciudad de Chincha, la ciudad de chincha, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, asimismo es conocida porque es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano y sobre todo en esta ciudad habitan una gran población de origen afroperuano. Cuando Juan tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho salir con su esposa a caminar y en algunas ocasiones jugar futbol con  sus vecinos de su barrio, su platillo favorito es el riquísimo Ceviche y por ello siempre le pide a su esposa que lo prepare.

Con mucho entusiasmo Juan trabaja en una grande de Pollos, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día; él cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo honrado.

Juan está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá construir un pequeño cuarto para poder vivir de manera más cómoda con su esposa la cual está embarazada y darle un mejor lugar para su primer bebe, así el podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Juan is a young man who is 20 years of age. He is married and his wife is expecting a baby, so Juan is very happy and excited about becoming a father for the first time. He lives in a small cottage located in the city of Chincha, which is known for having a warm climate. Chincha is also known as the site of the greatest victories in Peruvian sports, but most of all, it is a city where a large number of the population are of Afro-Peruvian origin. When Juan has free time, he enjoys going for walks with his wife and occasionally playing a game of soccer with his neighbors from the area. His favorite dish is the flavorful "ceviche" (marinated seafood), so he always asks his wife to prepare it.

With great enthusiasm, Juan works approximately 10 hours a day at a poultry farm. He believes he is doing well in his job because he is very responsible and, most of all, trustworthy. He is grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, Juan will be able to build a small room so that his wife can be more comfortable since she is pregnant. This will also provide a better place for their first baby. Juan hopes to improve his quality of life and continues to strive toward fulfilling his greatest dream of having a house of his own.

loans.use: to build a room for his pregnant wife.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a food cart.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 28 years old and single. He has been working in the coffee and hookah business for seven years.

In 2006, Mahmoud opened his own espresso selling shop in the Palestinian Camp where he lives as it is hard to find employment. He is working on improving and expanding his shop as much as he can through a Youth Loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to add more tables and chairs for more customers and new sandwiches and beverages to his menu.

All of these improvements will reflect positively on both his social and financial situations. Mahmoud hopes that one day he will be financially capable of opening a big restaurant outside the camp to receive tourists and foreigners, in addition to his local loyal customers.

loans.use: to expand his business by introducing his customers to a new sandwiches menu.

loans.name: Victoria Maria

texts.es: Vitoria viven en el Suburbio zona sur urbana de Guayaquil. Su casa está ubicada en la Ferroviaria sector que cuenta con agua, luz, alcantarillado y camino pavimentado. Es uno de los pocos sectores que tiene esos servicios. Vive con su esposo Jaime quien es despachador en una gasolinera de la ciudad. Sus 4 hijos son mayores de edad y están casados. Desde muy joven empezó vendiendo productos por catálogos ya que le gustaba mucho el comercio. También lo hacía porque de esa manera tenia ingresos suficientes para sus gastos. En la actualidad tiene una despensa donde vende productos como confetis, snacks, yogur, etc. ella atiende el negocio de lunes a sábados y una de sus hijas le acompaña cuando tiene que realizar la compra de la mercadería. Le gusta su trabajo porque la mantiene activa y le distrae. Victoria nos cuenta que no ha tenido problemas con la delincuencia en su trabajo pero si en la referente a salud, un tiempo atrás estuvo con principios de bronquitis lo que la mantuvo preocupada y convaleciente ya se encuentra recuperada y esperando que no se vuelva a repetir. Su sueño es viajar para conocer varios sitios, también arreglar su casa mejorando su calidad de vida. Espera lograr todo eso con su negocio por eso solicita el crédito para comprar productos y ampliar sus ventas.
texts.en: Victoria lives in the southern urban suburbs of Guayaquil. Her house is located in the Ferroviaria sector, which has water, electricity, a sewer system, and paved roads. It is one of the few sectors to have basic utilities. She lives with her husband Jaime, who is a petrol station attendant in the city. Her 4 children are adults and married. Victoria started to sell products through catalogues at a young age, since she has always liked retail. She also did it in order to have enough income to meet her expenses. Nowadays, she has a small shop where she sells products such as sweets, snacks, yoghourt, etc. She minds the shop Monday to Saturday and one of her daughters accompanies her when she has to buy supplies. She likes her work because it keeps her active and provides a distraction. Victoria tells us that they have not had any problems with criminal activity but that she does face other challenges such as health problems, since she had an incipient bronchitis a while ago. It was a very worrisome episode and she was convalescent for a while: she has now recovered and hopes that it will not happen again. Her dream is to travel to know other places; she also hopes to restore her house and improve her quality of life. She hopes to be able to do all this thanks to her business and thus asks for a loan to buy and sell more products.

loans.use: to buy sweets, snacks, and yoghourt to sell.

loans.name: Judy Geomar

texts.es: Judy tiene 39 años de edad y vive en Libertad. La casa donde vive es de su propiedad construida de cemento y cuenta solo con los servicios de agua y luz. No es novedad que en su ciudad tengan solo este tipo de servicios ya que las autoridades se preocupan muy poco en mejorar sus condiciones de vida. A pesar de esto Judy tiene una tienda donde vende productos de bazar y realiza costuras a personas particulares. El negocio lo empezó a raíz de la separación de su conviviente ya que tenía que cuidar de sus hijos por lo que inicio con la costura. Hace 3 años pudo reunir el dinero suficiente y abrió el mini market. Ella nos comenta que atiende el negocio sola aunque a veces la ayudan sus hijos en los ratos libres, la atención es de 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Judy tiene muchas esperanzas de que su negocio aumente ya que es el medio de sustento para ella y sus hijos ya que su ex no le ayuda económicamente. Sus hijos tienen 11, 13 y 16 años y asisten a la escuela fiscal. Con el crédito tiene pensado comprar inventario para su tienda y con ese empuje a sus ventas espera mejorar su tienda, tambien apoyara a sus hijos hasta la etapa universitaria.
texts.en:
Judy is 39 years old and lives in Libertad. The house where she lives in her own and is built of cement. It only has water and electricity services. It is not strange in this city to only have this type of service as the authorities care very little about improving living conditions. Despite this Judy has a shop where she sells general products and offers a sewing service to individuals. She started this business due to her split with her partner as she had to care for her children and so started her sewing service.

Three years ago she was able to collect enough money to open a mini market. She tells us that she serves in the shop alone although sometimes her children help her in their free time. She opens from 8 in the morning until 9 at night. Judy has high hopes that her business will increase as it is her means of sustenance for her and her children, as her ex does not help her economically. Her children are 11, 13 and 16 years old and attend school. 

With this loan she has thought about buy stock for her shop and with this increase in sales improve her shop; she will also support her children until they attend university.

loans.use: to buy snacks, rice, household products.

loans.name: Junaydullo

texts.ru: Чунайдулло проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 59 лет. Он женат. У него 8 детей. Чунайдулло имеет высшее образование. По профессии он юрист. Сейчас Чунайдулло занимается скотоводством у себя дома. Он берет кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en:
Junaydullo lives in the Dangara region of Tajikistan. He's a 59-year-old married man with eight children. Junaydullo has a university level of education and is a lawyer by profession. 
Currently, he raises animals near his house. He's asking for a loan in order to purchase some bulls.

loans.use: to purchase some bulls.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 28 years old and single.  He sells shoes to earn a living and he has been in business for eight years.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business because he has received training on business management skills.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy shoes.

In the future, he hopes to grow his business and employ people.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Davlat

texts.ru: Давлат проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 37 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его дети маленькие. Давлат имеет среднее образование. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en:
Davlat lives in the Dangara region of Tajikistan. He's a 37-year-old married man with five small children. He has a high school level of education. 
Davlat has made a living for the past five years by breeding large-horned cattle. He's asking for a loan in order to purchase some calves.

loans.use: to purchase some calves.

loans.name: Ramón Alejandro

texts.es:
El joven Ramón Alejandro  es originario del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente se desempeña como Guarda de Seguridad donde tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este oficio, actividad que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y darle lo mejor que puede a su esposa e hija.
Uno de sus mayores deseos es preparar a su pequeña hija y darle todas las condiciones adecuadas en su hogar.
Como padre responsable desea darle lo mejor a su hija bajo sus condiciones, por tal motivo se acercó por primera vez a Ceprodel a solicitar su primer crédito para adquirir una computadora portátil para un mejor desarrollo educativo y actualizarla tecnológicamente para que lleve un mejor futuro.
Confía en Dios y espera que esta Institución le apoye con su solicitud donde le estará eternamente agradecido porque sin la ayuda de estos pequeños créditos no es posible llevar a cabo muchos sueños.
texts.en:
Ramón Alejandro is a young man who is originally from the town of El Sauce. He currently works as a security guard and has held this position for many years. This job enables him to sustain his household and provide the best for his wife and daughter.

One of his greatest wishes is to prepare his young daughter and provide her with adequate conditions at home. Like any responsible father, Ramón wants to give his daughter the best conditions. For this reason, he is applying for his first loan from CEPRODEL in order to acquire a laptop computer to improve her educational development and to get her acclimated technologically so that she can have a chance at a better future.

Ramón trusts in God and hopes that CEPRODEL will support his request. He will be eternally grateful because without the help of these small loans, it would not be possible for him to fulfill many of his dreams.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer for his daughter.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. The family owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She successfully repaid her previous loan which she used to buy charcoal to sell. Her business has done well, and she earns enough to provide her family with basic needs.

Now Rukia is taking out a 30,000 KES loan from Yehu to start business as a tailor. With the loan she will buy a sewing machine and material. Her ambition is to teach tailoring in the future.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and material.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos menores hijos de ocho años y siete meses de edad en el caserío Muy Finca, una de las grandes zonas rurales que constituyen el distrito agrícola de Mochumí. La comunidad está conformada por varios centros poblados reunidos en grupos de hasta 15 o 20 familias como máximo, el suyo se llama Punto Nueve. En su comunidad, todos subsisten gracias a su trabajo en labores agrícolas. Su vivienda está construida de material rústico. 

Se dedica a la crianza de animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y los negociantes que periódicamente visitan la zona en donde vive. Oscar cría aves de corral como pavos, patos, pollos, gallinas, etc. También cría ganado vacuno, ovino y porcino. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar económicamente los gastos de su familia. 

Actualmente Oscar desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más animales: por un lado desea adquirir una ternera con la finalidad de criarla y aprovechar  la leche que produzca en el futuro y por otro lado desea adquirir cinco lechones de engorde para luego venderlos. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. 

Oscar es una persona bastante trabajadora, responsable y entregada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una buena persona, que siempre está dispuesto a cooperar con el bienestar y desarrollo de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Oscar, 32, is a father living with his wife and two minor children who are 8 years and 7 months old in the Muy Finca settlement, one of the large rural zones in the agricultural Mochumí District.  The community is composed of several population centers with groups of a maximum of 15 to 20 families.  His is called Punto Nueve.  In his community everyone subsists from farming activities.  His dwelling is made from rustic materials.

He works raising small farm animals in his back yard.  When they reach a good level of development he offers them for sale at home to his neighbors and to merchants who periodically visit the zone where he lives.  Oscar raises barnyard fowl like turkeys, ducks, chicks, chickens, etc.  He also raises cattle, sheep and pigs.  Income earned from this activity is used to cover family expenses.

Currently, Oscar wants to expand his business with the purchase of more animals.  On the one hand he wants to buy a heifer to raise and take advantage of the milk she’ll produce in the future and on the other hand he wants to buy five piglets to fatten up and later sell.  This is why he’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan to help him reach his objective.

Oscar is quite a hardworking, responsible person who is devoted to his family.  People who know him consider him to be a good person who is always willing to contribute to his community’s wellbeing and development.

loans.use: to buy animals.

loans.name: Marcos Daniel

texts.es:
Marcos es un joven de 19 años, soltero, vive con su padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Chincha, a pesar de su corta edad es muy emprendedor y trabajador, en sus ratos libre le gusta  ingresar a internet para navegar en la web y en algunas ocasiones prepara uno de sus platos preferidos como es la riquísima “Carapulcra con Sopa Seca” para compartir el almuerzo con su familia; gracias al apoyo de sus padres Marcos puedo estudiar una carrera técnica de computación, pero sueña con algún día poder estudiar la carrera universitaria de Ingeniería de Sistemas.  
Gracias  a su empeño y ganas de salir adelante, desde hace 2 años Marcos trabaja en una empresa de su ciudad como Técnico en Computadoras, así también de manera independiente brinda servicios de instalaciones, reparaciones y mantenimiento de computadores, él dedica a su trabajo un aproximado de 10 horas diarias, se encuentra a gusto con la labor que realiza ya que tiene grandes habilidades y talento para el manejo de las computadoras.  
Marcos se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de un cuarto en el segundo piso de la casa de sus padres, el cual le servirá para su uso, ya que su casa no es muy grande y siempre ha tenido que compartir un cuarto pequeño con sus demás hermanos; de esta manera Marcos desea brindarles más comodidad a su familia y él podrá contar con un espacio personal que sirva para su mejor desarrollo personal, ya que desea poder seguir especializándose y creciendo como profesional, para así poder conseguir su gran sueño de poder estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería de Sistemas y en un futuro no muy lejano desea tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Marcos is a young single 19 year old who lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Chincha. Despite his young age he is very entrepreneurial and hard working. In his free time he likes to surf the internet and sometimes prepare one of his favourite dishes such as the tasty "Carapulcra con Sopa Seca", a typical Peruvian dish, to share his lunch with his family. Thanks to the support of his parents Marcos was able to study a career in technical computing, but he dreams of someday being able to study the university career of Systems Engineering.

Thanks to his effort and desire to get ahead, for the last two years Marcos has been working in a company in his city as a computer technician. He also works independently offering his services in installations, reparations and computer maintenance. He works around 10 hours a day and he is happy with the work he carries out as he has great ability and talent working with computers.

Marcos is very grateful for the Kiva loans as thanks to the help given he can build a room on the second floor of his parents house which he will make use of as his house is not very big and he has always had to share a small room with his other siblings. In this way Marcos hopes to provide more comfort for his family and he will be able to have a personal space which will serve for his personal development as he hopes to continue specializing and growing as a professional in order to be able to fulfil his greatest dream of studying Systems Engineering and in a not too distant future have his own house.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Klara

texts.ru: Кларе 43 года, живет  вместе с престарелыми родителями и заботится о них. Клара в качестве основного  источника дохода для своей семьи,  с 2009 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начатый  с суммы 30,000 сом бизнес благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости Клары, на сегодня насчитывает 3 коровы, 2 лошади, 20 голов мелкого рогатого скота и приносит около 3,000 сом в месяц с продажи молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса,  Клара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота на откорм и перепродажу.  Доходы от кредита  Клара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Klara is 43 years old. She lives with her elderly parents and takes care of them. Since 2009, her main source of income has come from farming and raising animals. Klara opened her business from a starting capital of 35,000 soms. Today, thanks to her hard work and dedication her business has grown to include 3 cows, 2 horses, 20 heads of small-horned cattle and it brings in around 3,000 soms a month from the sale of milk products. 

Hoping to expand her business further, Klara approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 90,000 in order to purchase cattle intended for fattening and resale. She plans to invest profits from the loan back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel es un hombre de 32 años casado con Rosa que es una mujer de 30 años; juntos tienen 4 hijos. Viven en la cabecera cantonal de "Alausí" la cual se ubica en el centro del Ecuador en la provincia de "Chimborazo". Su geografía es irregular; tiene valles subtropicales, páramos, depresiones inmensas por las que descienden pequeños pero torrentosos ríos. Cada una de sus nueve parroquias se caracteriza por sus rasgos culturales, sus fiestas y folcklor. Alausí tiene una población indígena descendiente, en su mayoría, de mitimáes Coyas de las riveras del Titicaca.

Angel trabaja como albañil o lo que en su medio es llamado "Albañil Contratista" que es una persona que realiza arreglos de casas e incluso obras completas de construcción pero lleva su propia maquinaria y todos los implementos de tal manera que quien lo contrata no deba preocuparse por ningún detalle. Trabaja durante 8 horas al día junto a su padre y también da trabajo a otros albañiles dependiendo de la obra. Actualmente la falta de capital ha hecho que se retrasen algunas obras, por esta razón él desea invertir en materiales para así dar un mejor servicio a su clientela y con ello atraer nueva. 

Durante su vida ha tenido algunos problemas de tipo familiar que considera pequeños, sin embargo el cree que a pesar de ello tiene una hermosa familia a quienes dará una mejor calidad de vida si puede crecer como empresario.
texts.en:
Angel is 32 years old and is married to Rosa, who is 30 years old. Together they have four children. 

They live in the canton capital of Alausí, which is located in central Ecuador, within the province of Chimborazo. Its geography is irregular: it has subtropical valleys, moors, and huge depressions where small but fast-flowing rivers descend. Each of its nine parishes is known for their cultural characteristics, festivities, and folklore. Alausí has an indigenous population which mostly descends from the Coya groups from the Titicaca river banks.

Angel works as a builder, or what is known in his area as a building contractor, which is someone who carries out large remodeling jobs for houses or even entire building brojects, but brings his own machinery and all the equipment and tools necessary, so that whoever hires him doesn't have to worry about any details. He works eight hours a day along with his father and also hires other builders, depending on the project. Currently, lack of capital has delayed some projects, which is why he wants to invest in materials, so that he can offer his customers better service and also attract new customers.

He has suffered some family problems in his life which he considers small. However, he believes that in spite of all he has a beautiful family who he will provide with a better quality of life if he manages to grow as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To convert her conventional coffee production to organic.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Sarom, 39, is married to Bunhak, who is 46 years old. They live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have a son and three daughters, one of whom is a garment worker while the others attend school. Sarom’s job is putting together fabric swatches. Her husband works in construction and raises cows.

Sarom is asking for a loan of 500 USD from MAXIMA to buy a calf for her husband. He will earn extra income by selling the cows when they are fully grown.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is requesting another loan for 50,000 KES, which she will use to boost her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase a blow dryer and hair chemicals to sell in her cosmetic shop. Since her first loan, her monthly income has increased. With the additional income she plans to establish another business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a blow dryer and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 54 years old and married.  Her husband is a truck driver. Salma has a small women's clothing sales business, which operates out of her home. She sells special types of dresses that she gets for a wholesale price. 

Salma is requesting a loan, which she will use to add another collection of ladies' clothes to what she sells to serve another age group.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' clothes.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Desde que dejo la escuela a los 15 años Víctor se ha dedicado a la producción de café. En un principio trabajaba con su padre y tiempo después, gracias a sus ahorros, pudo comprar un terreno para empezar a producir su propio café y ser independiente. El actualmente tiene 39 años y gracias a la experiencia adquirida ha logrado que sus fincas tengan una buena producción. Durante la última cosecha entregó un total de 24 toneladas a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” con la finalidad de que su café sea exportado. Él es un productor orgánico, es decir, no utiliza fertilizantes químicos lo cual a lo largo del tiempo le trae beneficios al medio ambiente. La meta de Víctor es que dentro de un periodo de 3 años sus tierras produzcan la cantidad de 50 toneladas, es decir, el doble de lo que obtiene actualmente y para ello necesita comprar planta de café, pues cuenta con el espacio suficiente para sembrarla y es por esta razón que el necesita de un crédito. Víctor también se dedica a la producción de caña de azúcar y a la cría de cerdos, actividades que le han sido de gran ayuda sobre todo en los años que el café ha tenido un precio bajo en el mercado. Debido a su enorme gusto por el café a Víctor le gustaría poner en un futuro una cafetería para poder vender allí parte de su producción y para que sus familiares y amigos puedan disfrutar cuando gusten de una rica taza de café.
texts.en:
Since he left school at 15, Víctor has been a coffee grower. At the beginning he worked with his father, and some time later, thanks to his savings, he was able to buy a piece of land to begin producing his own coffee and be independent. 

Now he is 39, and thanks to the experience he has acquired he has managed to secure good production from his plantations. During the last harvest, he delivered a total of 24 tons to the “Unión Regional de Huatusco” with the aim of having his coffee exported. 

He is an organic producer, that is to say, he does not use chemical fertilizers, which over time benefits the environment. Víctor's goal is, within a period of three years, to have his lands produce the amount of 50 tons; that is to say, double what he currently gets. For this reason, he needs to buy coffee seedlings, as he has enough space to plant them and this why he needs a loan. 

Víctor also produces sugar cane and raises pigs, activities that have helped him greatly, especially in the years that coffee has had a low market price. Due to his very great liking for coffee, Víctor would like to set up a coffee shop some day, in order to be able to sell part of his production there, and so that his family members and friends can enjoy a delicious cup of coffee whenever they like.

loans.use: To buy coffee seedlings for planting on his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing machines and employ tailors to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants in order to revitalize her farm.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is 49 years old, married and has seven sons. Because she is a conservative woman, she has asked her husband to take her place in this photo.

Both Salima and her husband (who is also a private sector retirement employee) help each other in their clothing sales business. Salima has applied for a 1,000 JOD loan from the National Microfinance Bank to buy clothes in bulk so as to decrease the per-piece cost and increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Tututepec San Pedro Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Tututepec San Pedro, esta  conformado por doce mujeres indígenas que hablan el idioma mixteco, originarias de un pequeño pueblo llamado Tututepec san Pedro donde una de sus costumbres son las mayordomías.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Alma Eva de treinta y cinco años de edad.
Doña Alma como mejor la conocen sus paisanos, dice que se dedica a la venta de masa y presta los servicios de su molino, desde hace dos años.
También se dedica a cortar cabello, hacer peinados en su domicilio, decido tener este negocio para tener un dinero extra para cualquier emergencia.
Dice que  empezó su negocio gracias a su esposo  Jorge quien antes de casarse, tenía una tienda de abarrotes y con las ganancias de la tienda  y la ayuda de fundacion pudo comprar  su molino para la venta de masa.
Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es atender con amabilidad a sus clientes y siempre estar activa ya que tiene que atender sus dos negocios y sobre todo atender a sus hijos Luís Antonio, Ajandra y Betzabe.
Una de sus mas grandes alegrías es contar con fundacion Realidad ya que con su apoyo va a poder comprar peines, shampoo, una maquina para cortar cabello y tijeras.
Le da las gracias a fundacion Realidad por ayudar a las mujeres trabajadoras.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son:

Cristina- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Claudina- se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Enma Margarita- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Alejandrina- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Francisca- se dedica a la venta mercancía de abarrotes.
Eva- se dedica a la venta de carnes frías.
Ciria- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Elia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Berta- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Jaqueline- se dedica a la venta de pescados.
Ana- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Le dan las gracias a fundacion Realidad por ayudarlas para que puedan alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
This group is called “Tututepec San Pedro” and it’s composed of twelve indigenous women who speak the Mixteco language.  They are from a small town called Tututepec San Pedro where one of the local customs is “Mayordomía” [folk festival where an individual or a couple take on the responsibility of organizing the community festivities].  One of the group members is Alma Eva, 35.

Doña Alma, as she’s better known by her neighbors, says that she’s worked selling "masa" [corn dough for making tortillas, tamales, etc.] and providing mill services for two years.  She also works cutting hair.  She styles hair at home.  She decided to have this business to earn extra money for emergencies.

She says that she started her business thanks to her husband, Jorge, who before they got married had a grocery store and used profits from the store and help from the Fundación to be able to buy her mill to sell masa.

What she likes best about her business is treating her customers with kindness and always being active because she has to tend to both businesses and above all also care for her children, Luís Antonio and Betzabé.

One of her greatest joys is being able to rely on Fundación Realidad because with its support she will be able to buy combs, shampoo, a hair clipper and scissors.

She thanks Fundación Realidad for helping working women.

The other group members are:

Cristina- sells Mexican fast-food snacks.
Claudina- sells groceries.
Enma Margarita- sells Mexican fast-food snacks.
Alejandrina- sells Mexican fast-food snacks.
Francisca- sells groceries.
Eva- sells cold cuts.
Ciria- sells Mexican fast-food snacks.
Elia- sells Mexican fast-food snacks.
Berta- sells Mexican fast-food snacks.
Jaqueline- sells fish.
Ana- sells Mexican fast-food snacks.

They thank Fundación Realidad for helping them be able to reach their dreams.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon supplies.

loans.name: Sereno Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Sereno del Socorro es originaria del municipio de El Sauce donde ha vivido toda su vida, es madre soltera la que ha luchado día a día con su pequeño salario por sacar adelante a sus hijos y hacerlos hombres de bien.
Uno de sus mayores sueños es preparar a sus hijos profesionalmente y ver totalmente construida su casita para tener un hogar digno donde vivir.
Por tal motivo está solicitando su séptimo crédito para la compra de zinc, ladrillos y pago de mano de obra con el fin de seguir ampliando dicha vivienda.
Gracias a estos créditos ha ido ampliando su vivienda porque con su pequeño salario no hubiera podido tenerla.
texts.en:
Sereno del Socorro is from the municipality of El Sauce, where she has lived all her life. She is a single mother who has struggled day after day with her small salary to help her children get ahead and make them into good men. 

One of her greatest dreams is to prepare her sons to be professionals and see the construction of her home finished, so that she has a dignified place to live. It is for this reason that she is requesting her seventh loan, to buy zinc, bricks and to pay for labor, so that she can make an addition to her home. Thanks to these loans she has been able to improve her home, because with her small salary it would not have been possible.

loans.use: to buy zinc, bricks and pay for labor.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla (pictured here) has full-time employment, while her husband, San is a motor taxi driver. They live about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four one son and three daughters-one is in second year of her Accounting University in Phnom Penh and also works as a cashier, two are in school and another one is still young.

Phalla had asked for a Kiva loan. She now is applying for her second loan in order to purchase a computer laptop for her daughter who is in second years of her Accounting University in Phnom Penh and also works as a cashier. She will also use a part of the loan to replace new motorbike because her husband because the old one breaks and does not work well.

loans.use: To purchase a computer laptop for her daughter and replace new motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis es un joven soltero de 24 años que vive con su hermana y abuelos Gladys y Luis de 55 y 63 años respectivamente. Residen en "San Miguel de Los Bancos" en la provincia de Pichincha, donde también se encuentra la capital del Ecuador. Uno de los principales recursos de San Miguel de Los Bancos es el hídrico, en su territorio originan un sin número de riachuelos y pequeñas vertientes que dan paso a ríos de considerable tamaño. San Miguel de Los Bancos, muestra las características comunes a varios de los pueblos ubicados entre la Sierra y la Costa: el movimiento comercial se desenvuelve en la calle principal, donde se encuentran hoteles, restaurantes y almacenes, sobre todo de productos agropecuarios, así como servicios veterinarios y tiendas para el consumo diario de la población. 

Hace un año Luis abrió un pequeño local de ropa casual frente a un restaurante concurrido. Atiende 9 horas al día a su clientela y es ayudado por su hermana. Esta actividad la aprendió de su familia que también se dedica a esto desde ya hace varios años. Luis ha empezado con poco capital y por esta razón tiene poca mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes y pese a ello se ha sabido mantener. Quiere realizar una inversión para ampliar su negocio, comprar más mercadería principalmente ropa de mujer que es la de mayor demanda. Con ello piensa incrementar su cartera de clientes y así mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.

Su sueño es poder tener un gran local y quizás abrir varios y así convertirse en un gran empresario.
texts.en:
Luis is a single young man of 24 years who lives with his sister and grandparents, Gladys and Luis, who are 55 and 63 years old, respectively. They live in "San Miguel de Los Bancos" in the province of Pichincha, where the capital of Ecuador is also found. One of the principal resources of San Miguel de Los Bancos is its water, as there are countless rivulets and small waterfalls that originate in this territory and give rise to rivers of considerable size. San Miguel de Los Bancos exhibits the characteristics common to several towns located between the Sierra and the Coast: commercial traffic unfolds along the main street where you can find hotels, restaurants, and department stores. Above all there are products from farming and livestock, as well as veterinary services and shops for the daily needs of the population.

One year ago Luis opened a small casual clothing store across from a busy restaurant. He waits on his customers 9 hours a day and is helped by his sister. He learned this work from his family, who have also been working in this type of business for several years. Luis started with little capital, and for this reason he has little merchandise to offer his customers, and despite this he has known how to persevere. He wants to make an investment to expand his business and buy more merchandise, mainly women's clothing, which has the greatest demand. With that he plans to increase his portfolio of customers and in this way improve his income and quality of life.

His dream is to be able to have a big store and open several of them, and in this way become a great businessman.

loans.use: to buy clothing for his store.

loans.name: La Huerta Group

texts.es:
El grupo "La Huerta" se encuentra ubicado detras de un mercado llamado la palma es un grupo que sus integrantes son de diferente lugar se reunene en una casa que aun no se termima per ahi hace sus reuniones cuendo le preguntamos al grupo porque se lalamaba la huerta, ellos riendo dijieron "Ya ni ha huerta llegamos, porque antes si nos reuniamos en una huerta grandisisma donde vabia muchos frutos, como manzanas, peras, higos,limones, etc. Pero ahora miren en donde estamos" Los integrantes del grupo estan muy agradecidos y contentos, con Visison Foun (Frac) y Kiva ya que ellos podran invertir en sus actividades  como Doña Reyna invertira en colchas y cobijas, Doña Silvia, Alma Jazmin invertiran en artesanias, Jose invertira en joyerias, Angela invertiara en pintado de servilletas y finalmente don Leonardo invertira en cinturones pero tambien en sus borregos que tiene
Doña Petra quien tambien es integrante del grupo nos cuenta que tiene 46 año de edad ya es una señora viuda con aun dos dependientes de los cuales es una niña y un niño la niña aun esta estudiando la secundaria y el niño ya no esta estudiando.
Doña Petra nos platica que ella se dedica hacer aresanias las cuales son fajs y servilletas doña Pëtra aprendio de su mama para hacer este tipo de artesanias nos cuenta que para hacer las fajas ella necesita estambron la compra todo el estambro lo dehila y luego vuelve a bordar pera ya par que quede la faja bordada, ademas de sus fajas tambien realiza servilletas.
Doña Petra nos cuenta que la unica dificulatad que tiene a veces es para poder comprar sus materialres es por eso que esta vez ha solicitado el credito para comparar estambron, tela cuadrille. el credito le beneficara mucho ya que podra surtirse para un buen tiempo, "lo que mas me gusta es elaborarlas y que mis clientes queden satisfechos con lo que yo hago" Doña Petra vende siempre a fuera de los portales pero le gustaria que mas adelante su negocio creciera poca a poco y ya no venir hasta San Felipe a vender.
Doña Petra esta muy agradecida por el credito ya que sus ganacias le serviran de mucho para solventar los gastos del hogar y de la eduacion de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “La Huerta” (The Orchard) group is located behind a market called “La Palma.”  It’s a group whose members come from different places and meets in a house that’s still not completely finished but that’s where they have their meetings.  When we asked the group why it was called La Huerta, they answered laughing: “We don’t even have an orchard anymore but we used to meet in a huge orchard where there was lots of fruit like apples, pears, figs, lemons, etc.  But now look where we are.”  The members of the group are very grateful and happy with VisionFund (FRAC) and with Kiva because they will be able to invest in their activities.  For example:  Doña Reyna will buy bedspreads and blankets, Doña Silvia and Alma Jazmín will buy crafts, José will buy jewelry, Ángela will invest in painting napkins and finally, Don Leonardo will buy belts but also will invest in his sheep.

Doña Petra who also belongs to the group tells us that she’s 46-years-old and a widow with two dependents still, a girl and  boy; the girl is still attending secondary school and the boy is no longer in school.

Doña Petra tells us that she works making crafts like sashes and napkins.  Petra learned how to make these crafts from her mother.  She tells us that in order to make the sashes she needs yarn.  She buys the entire skein and then unravels the individual threads and then embroiders again so that the sash will end up embroidered; in addition to the sashes she also does napkins.

Petra tells us that the only difficulty she has is being able to buy her supplies sometimes which is why she’s asking for this loan to buy yarn and embroidery fabric.  The loan will be very beneficial because she will be able to stock up for a good period of time.  Petra says that what she likes best is to make them so her customers will be satisfied with what she does.  Petra always sells outside the gates but would like it if her business grew gradually so as not to need to come all the way to San Felipe to sell any longer.

Petra is very grateful for the loan because her profits will be of much use to her to cover household expenses and her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy embroidery supplies.

loans.name: Dhorke

texts.en:
Dhorka is a hard-working woman in her early seventies with seven grown children and 24 grandchildren. Her oldest child is 53 years old and the youngest is 35. All of her children have lived with their families in Greece for the past decade or so while she has always lived in her home in a village near a major city in southeast Albania.

Dhorka has farmed for the past eighteen years. She owns around five dynyms (a little over an acre) of land and grows lots of vegetables, especially garlic, onions and leeks from seed. She loves farming.

Dhorka’s business is steady. She sells her crops in the local market and to wholesale buyers. With her profits she finances the education of her granddaughter, who was named after her grandmother.

Dhorka has an extremely responsible and appreciative character. She says, “I can’t sleep until I pay all what I owe. With the first money I make, I run to pay the monthly installments. Thanks to all the help from VFA, now I can help my granddaughter.” This is her third loan (this one for 80,000 ALL), and she is confident she’ll pay it all off on time.

loans.use: To buy garlic, leek and onion seeds.

loans.name: Nelida Victoria

texts.es:
Nelida es una mujer de 44 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos a quienes se dedica se dedica por completo para que no les falte nada, ella es una mujer muy luchadora que ha sabido superar las adversidades que le ha presentado la vida, todo por sacar adelante a sus hijos; en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo al deporte ya que le gusta mucho  jugar vóley y en algunas ocasiones prepara uno de sus platos favoritos como es el riquísimo “Puré con Pollo Frito”, con mucho esmero concluyó sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por falta de recursos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Enfermería. 
Con mucho empeño y con el deseo de salir adelante, Nelida trabaja en un fundo de la ciudad como obrera, donde realiza labores de cultivo y procesamiento de frutas y hortalizas, ella se encuentra contenta en su trabajo, ya que la consideran mucho por su eficiencia y buen desempeño.
Nelida se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá iniciar la construcción de su casa, comprando materiales necesarios, así también utilizará la ayuda para el pago de los encargados de la construcción; de esta manera Nelida podrá comenzar poco a poco a construir su hogar y en un futuro no muy lejano y gracias a los ingresos que recibe de su trabajo espera poder terminar la construcción total de su casa y así poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nélida, 44, lives in the city of Ica in Santiago District.  She’s a single mother.  She has two children who she’s completely dedicated to so that they lack nothing.  She is a very tenacious woman who has known how to overcome life’s adversities in order to move her children forward.  

In her free time she likes so dedicate a some time to sports because she likes playing volleyball very much.  Sometimes she prepares one of her favorite dishes, the very delicious “Puré con Pollo Frito.”  With much effort she completed secondary school but due to lack of resources was unable to study a university career but would have liked to have studied Nursing.

With much effort and drive to get ahead, Nélida works as a laborer processing fruit and greens in a large farm in the city.  She’s happy in her work because she’s much esteemed for her efficiency and good work.

Nélida is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided she will be able to start building her house buying the necessary supplies.  She will also use the help to pay labor costs of those who will be doing the construction.  In this way, Nélida will be able to gradually build her home and in a not too distant future thanks to the income she earns at work hopes to finish building the house completely to provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to start building her house.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a forty-nine-year-old widowed mother of two; twenty and eighteen year old. The oldest child is a university student and the youngest, a daughter, is graduating soon from high school. Livestock has been her business for the past twelve something years. She owns two cows from a very good breed that they both produce about sixty kilograms of milk a day. She then sells the calves to the locals and the milk to dairy farms for cheese and yogurt making. Her business has been doing well and she has established a strong clientele.  Never before she thought that she would need any loans until this past year when her husband suddenly passed away. At that time she had just paid for her son’s university and with the rest of the money, she covered the burial expenses. Until recently, her plans of repairing the stable remained just plans. 
She is a good taxpayer and a provider of her family. People who referred Flora to VFA said that she is the most reliable person that they have ever known. Flora thanks in advance all potential Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a damaged cow stable

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is a 50 year old woman married to a salesman.  They have two daughters and one son.
Salwa has a special way to deal with kids for that she has recently established a day care in a good safe area. She has applied to this loan so she can enhance the kids playground and prepare to open a Kindergarten class.

loans.use: enhance the kids playground and prepare to open a Kindergarten class.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann (in the photo) is a widow with one daughter who is a garment factory worker. She lives in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has one niece and one nephew living with her, and they assist in her rice farming business sometimes.

Ann is a rice farmer. She hopes to expand her farmland; therefore she is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy her neighboring land property.

loans.use: To expand her farmland by buying her neighboring land property.

loans.name: Bebebe

texts.en:
Bebebe is a resident of Kisauni, Kenya. He is a married father of one child, one of whom is in school. He sells electronics in the region. This has proved a viable business due to the rise in the number of people who uses electronics. Bebebe has been doing this business for over ten years. Besides this, Bebebe runs a pub business.
Bebebe is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase electronic spares and television circuit boards for sale. The challenge in his business has been competition from other electronic shop operators. 
Bebebe believes the additional income will help in meeting his family's needs and hopes to open a larger electronic shop.

loans.use: to purchase electronic spares and television circuit boards for sale.

loans.name: Chhoeurn

texts.en:
Chhoeurn (pictured here), age 59, is a motor taxi driver. His wife, Charb, age 55, is a rice farmer. They live in a village about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have three children-two sons and one daughter. Two are married and another has full-time employment. 

Besides his children, Chhoeurn also has one nephew who has full-time employment, and is living with him. Chhoeurn is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for his nephew to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his nephew to get to work.

loans.name: Sam On

texts.en:
Sam On is 39 years old and her husband, Narin is 44 (pictured together), they live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1990 and they have two sons and two daughters, who are all in school.   

Sam On and her husband are rice farmers. In addition, they also buy more rice from fellow rice farmers in their village for resale.

Sam On wants to expand her business by buying additional rice for sale. Hence, she decides to ask for her first Kiva loan in order to help her capital.

loans.use: To buy additional rice for resale.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya and has been in active farming for four years doing mainly maize, vegetables, fruits and poultry farming. He is aged twenty nine and married with four children aged between ten years and one year.

Caleb has requested a loan of 100,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him boost his poultry farming business. He is optimistic the business will continue to grow owing to good prospects for poultry markets in the region. He will buy more birds at 40,000 KES and expand the poultry housing unit at a cost of 60,000 KES. He reiterates the skills he has acquired will help him mitigate the challenge of poultry diseases. He hopes to expand his dairy farming as well in the near future. This is his third loan request with Juhudi Kilimo with the first two having been 41,600 KES and 40,000 KES for dairy and poultry businesses respectively.

He is glad farming has improved his provisions for family basic needs.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds and build a bigger poulty housing unit.

loans.name: Fetna

texts.en:
Taking her first loan has helped her reach for new markets therefore increase her profitability. For that success Fetna was able to repay her first loan early.

Now Fetna is applying for another loan with a higher amount to expand more and not only provide the market with her product, but to start also providing restaurant with the pickles she makes.

loans.use: To start making more pickles so she can provide restaurants with pickles

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María Elena es una joven Sauceña que estudia la carrera de contabilidad, luchadora por salir adelante como profesional y tener un mejor futuro.
Actualmente labora como Secretaria, labor que le sirve para ayudar a su humilde madre con los gastos del hogar y pagar sus estudios.
Es una joven responsable que le agradece a su madre por haberla educado de la mejor manera y hoy que es independiente quiere recompensarle con ayudarle en lo que puede como mejorarle la vivienda donde han vivido por muchos años de su vida.
Ha recibido 6 créditos de Ceprodel los que ha invertido en mejorarle el piso, las paredes a la casa y hoy está anexando una habitación con el fin de tener más espacio.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de ladrillos, cemento y puerta para llevar a cabo su objetivo.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a young resident of El Sauce who is earning a degree in accounting.  She is struggling to get ahead as a professional so that she can have a better future. 

She now works as a secretary, which allows her to help her humble mother with the household expenses and to pay for her education.

She is a responsible youth who is grateful to her mother for having educated her in the best way.  Now that she is independent, she wants to pay her back by helping her in ways that she can, such as improving the house where they have lived for most of the years of her life.

She has received 6 loans from Ceprodel, and has invested them in improvements to the floor and walls of the house.  Now she is adding a room so that they can have more space.

Maria Elena is requesting a loan to buy bricks, cement and an door to carry out her objective.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and a door

loans.name: Sam An

texts.en:
Sam An (in the photo), age 47, his business is in buying and selling recycling materials. His wife, Min, age 34, is a garment worker. They have been married for six years and they have three children-two sons and one daughter. One attends school and other two are still young. 

Sam An is applying for his first Kiva loan in order to dig a well for family use. Because he does not have his own well, he needs to use his neighbors’ well every day.

loans.use: To dig a well for family use.

loans.name: Am

texts.en:
Am, aged 61 years, is a widow with four children. Three are married and another one is a garment worker. She is a cook and lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Because her son does not have his own transportation, he needs to take a taxi to work. Therefore Am is applying for her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of 700 USD to buy a motorbike for him to drive to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is 31 years old and married. Richel works very hard to provide for them.

Richel runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

Richel has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Richel would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a single-mother of a two year old child.  She runs a cafeteria to earn a living.  She has been in the business for five years.  She also sells detergents to supplement her income.  She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained on business management skills.  
She hopes to grow her business in the future.  She has requested for 50, 000 Kenya shillings to renovate her business premise.

loans.use: To renovate her business premise

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila is 34 years old and married with 6 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Precila is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase more feed for her pigs.

Precila has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and hollow blocks making.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more feed for her pigs

loans.name: Rosanilla

texts.en:
Rosanilla works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Rosanilla requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy paint, fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Rosanilla would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy paint, fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Wito Group

texts.en:
Andrea, who is in his mid 30s is married with one child who goes to school.  He has been running a Retail Shop for six years now. He works from 6.00 am to 10.30 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to restock the missing items in the shop, household expenses and has paid back his loan successfully. He wants a loan to increase on the shop inventory. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Wito" which has a total of 15 members  who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase the shop inventory.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 38 year old married woman, her husband receives a military retirement salary and is now working as a security guard in one of the Jordanian Universities. They have 5 children to take care of.
To help her husband and the family with some of the household expenses, Samira started a small home products sale at her house, mainly selling kitchenware and tools.
Now Samira has applied to a loan to increase the quantity she has of home products so she can expand and distribute to nearby markets.

loans.use: to increase the quantity she has of home products

loans.name: Jocyline

texts.en:
Jocyline is 49 years old, married and blessed with three children. She runs a general merchandise business in Marigat town and this business has been in operation for the last 9 years where she gets an average monthly income of Kshs 50,000.

She has borrowed a third loan of Kshs 70,000 after successfully paying her previous loan. With this loan she intends to use Kshs 40,000 to purchase plastic containers for resale, Kshs 20,000 to purchase plastic bags and other items and she will use the remaining amount for transportation and other overhead costs she may incur while doing her business. She anticipates using the profits from the business to expand it and also save some amount of money for the future.

Her dream is to improve her living standard and she hopes to save enough money that would enable her to buy a plot and built a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase stock

loans.name: Las Flores Rosas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Flores Rosas, está conformado por trece personas trabajadoras y humildes con deseos de superarse y engrandecer sus negocios.
Son originarios de Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca las artesanías más representativas de la ciudad son la elaboración de juguetes y diversos artículos de madera, machetes y hamacas, bordados de lana y de algodón, máscaras de madera que simbolizan distintos animales pintados en brillantes colores y blusas bordadas con chaquira.
Una  de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Macedonia mejor conocida como doña Marce, de treinta y ocho años de edad, se caracteriza  por ser una  señora amable, trabajadora y humilde. Se dedica a la venta de  Tamales, chicharrones y bolis  desde hace diez años, comenta que es madre soltera, tiene cinco hijos  Araceli, Eduardo, Damaris, Yessenia y Beltsy, pero solamente Damaris y Eduardo depende ella sus otros hijos viven con ella pero ya están casados. Marce está muy contenta por que sus hijos le ayudan con su negocio, lo que más le gusta es elaborar sus tamales  y salir a las calles de su comunidad a vender.
