Argumenta que desde pequeña le ha gustado vender y administrar su tiempo y su dinero, pero ahora es diferente ya que trabaja para darles una mejor vida a sus hijos y sobre todo una mejor educación, siempre con deseos de que sus hijos estén orgullosos de ella. Pidió el crédito para la compra de más ingredientes para elaboración de tamales como chile verde, tomate, carne de pollo, carne marrano, hojas de plátano, manteca, sal, maiz  para la elaboración de masa.

Las otras integrantes de este grupo son:

Maria Micaela- se dedica a la venta de postres.
Leticia – se dedica a la venta de quesos.
Zuleima Sarahi- se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo.
Maria Soledad-se dedica a la venta de tacos.
Araceli- se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Patricia- se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Maria Isabel- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Reyna Yuliana- se dedica a la venta de bisutería.
Alicia Berenice- se dedica a la venta de catálogos.
Telesforo Luis- se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Fernando Salvador- se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Elizabeth- se dedica a la venta de calzado.

Le dan las gracias a fundación por ayudar a todas las madres solteras y por apoyarlas prestándoles el capital para que puedan engrandecer sus negocios y cambiar sus vidas.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Flores Rosas" [The Pink Flowers] and is made up  of 13 members who are hard working and humble people, with the desire to get ahead and grow their businesses. 

They are originally from Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca. The artisanal crafts that are most common from this area include toys and other items from wood, machetes, hammocks (made from wool and cotton), brightly painted wooden masks that represent different animals and blouses embroidered with beads.  

One of the group members is Macedonia, better known as Marce. She is 38 years old and is known for being a friendly, hard working and humble woman. She sells tamales (a traditional food made with corn dough, filled with meat and sauce and wrapped in a plantain leaf or corn husk), chicharrones (fried pig skin) and popsicles, which she has been doing for the past 10 years. She told us that she is a single mother and she has 5 children: Araceli, Eduardo, Damaris, Yessenia and Beltsy. Only Damaris and Eduardo are supported by her; her other children live with her but are already married. Marce is very happy because her children help her with her business. The thing she likes best is making tamales, and going out in the streets of her community to sell. She said that since she was young she has enjoyed selling things, managing her time and her money, but that now it is different because she is working to be able to give a better life to her children and above all to give them a better education. She hopes that her children will be proud of her. She has requested a loan to be able to buy more ingredients to make tamales, like green peppers, tomatoes, chicken, pork, plantain leaves, lard, salt, and corn to make the dough. 

The other group members are:

Maria Micaela - makes a living selling desserts.
Leticia - makes a living selling cheese. 
Zuleima Sarahi - makes a living selling shoes from catalogs.
Maria Soledad - makes a living selling tacos. 
Araceli - makes a living selling shoes.
Patricia - makes a living selling groceries.  
Maria Isabel - makes a living selling traditional Mexican snacks.
Reyna Yuliana - makes a living selling costume jewelry.
Alicia Berenice - makes a living from catalog sales. 
Telesforo Luis - makes a living selling clothing.
Fernando Salvador - makes a living selling perfume.
Elizabeth - makes a living selling shoes.

The group members thank the communal bank for helping all of the single mothers; for supporting them by offering loans so that they can grow their businesses and change their lives.

loans.use: compra de ingredientes para la elaboracion de tamales.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 36, is married with five children, the firstborn being twelve years old and the fifth only aged one month. He has been a farmer in the Kitale area for five years. He has one farmhand and produces milk, maize, beans and other vegetables that he sells in the local market. He also runs his own motorcycle transport business.

David has requested a loan of 104,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure two dairy cows. This is his second loan request with Juhudi Kilimo. His first was for 52,000 KES also used to buy a dairy cow. He emphasizes that he has resolved to primarily run his dairy, as it has proved to be more profitable than raising crops.

While David laments the high costs of feed especially during dry seasons, he remains optimistic he will be able to meet his family’s basic needs with ease. He is grateful that Juhudi Kilimo has empowered smallholder farmers such as himself.

loans.use: to buy and insure two dairy cows.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is a 42-year-old Palestinian married man, father of five children. He works and lives in a Palestinian Camp just like most of his citizens.
Thaer is a hard working man who puts so much effort to on improving his family's social and financial situations. Thaer owns a van which he works on to transport people from one place to another covering Beirut region since 2009, he also owns a power generator that provides the camp with the necessary electricity since they have lack of it.
Thaer works hard to support and expand both businesses, in a way that they reflect positively on his family's social and financial situations, he hopes to keep on providing them with the necessary living issues they might need.
Thaer applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to support his power generator business through buying big quantities of Diesel in special price that will surely increase his income.
He is already Al Majmoua borrower for two cycles, in which he invested them in improving business and home maintenance,with a good standing paying back history.
Thaer hopes to build his own house in the future which is a dream he is working hard to make it true.

loans.use: To support his power generators business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 58 widowed lady with four children.  She runs a retail shop selling agrochemicals to earn a living.  She has been in the business for two years.  She also does farming to supplement her income.  She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained on business management skills.  
She hopes to grow her business and employ people.  She has requested for 30, 000 Kenya shillings to buy agrochemicals for resale.

loans.use: To buy agro-chemicals

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en:
Consorcia is 59 years old and married with five children.

Consorcia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items for her sari-sari store to sell.

Consorcia has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Consorcia aspires to save to expand the business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items for her sari-sari store to sell.

loans.name: Kanthea

texts.en:
Kanthea (pictured above) is 30 years old and her husband, Bonak is 29 years old. They have been married 1993 and they just have one young son. The family lives 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
  
Kanthea and her husband are garment workers. She is asking for her first loan of $1,300 to buy a motorbike to get to work. Because she does not have her own transportation, she needs to take taxi and pays $6 per month.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to get to work.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 32-year-old Syrian married woman, mother of two children, who lives and works in Dahieh Palestinian camp, because it is hard for hard to afford living outside the camp.
A year ago, Rania opened her own Kids clothing sales shop to help her husband in making their living. She is proud of the level she reached in a year, and is working on expanding it more and more in the future.
Rania applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to support her newly established business, through buying new spring & summer collection with special prices.
She hopes to provide her children with the best education and healthy living, and to open a big branch outside the Camp in the future.

loans.use: To support her newly established business

loans.name: Peres

texts.en:
Peres is a farmer in Kitale area of Western Kenya where she lives with her family of seven children the last three of whom are still schooling. She has been in farming for twenty years and currently sells her produce of milk, maize, beans and vegetables to the local market.

Peres has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, a Kiva partner to expand her poultry farming business. She says she will buy more birds at 40,000 KES and build a better poultry housing unit too  at 40,000 KES for the increased number of her flock. She is optimistic she will be able to pay for the education the education of her children. 

She says poultry diseases remains the major challenge in farming but is glad with Juhudi Kilimo loan support to smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To buy poultry for farming and build a poultry housing unit

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a resident of Kisauni, Kenya and is a clothes shop owner. The shop has been running for 15 years. He is a married father of 2 children. He started the business from his savings.

On learning about Yehu from his friends, Charles joined the group members to access loans. He is therefore applying for a loan of 25,000 Kenya shillings to buy a new stock of clothes for resale. He believes the additional income from this loan will help him pay for his children’s school fees. His ambition is to be an established boutique owner in the region, despite the challenges of seasonal business climate and inflation.

loans.use: to buy a new stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ngumbao

texts.en: Ngumbao lives in the coastal town of Kisauni, Kenya, where he has earned a living for the last three years by running a food café. He is married and the father of five children. He started his business with his personal savings and has made it profitable, in part because he is in a good location with many residents who are attracted by low-cost housing. The main challenges he faces are fluctuating prices and the high cost of materials. He would like to increase the capacity of his cafe because that would maximize his income. He was introduced to Yehu by his friends and is applying for a loan for 15,000 Kenyan shillings to buy food stock of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar. His ambition is to turn his café into a world class hotel in the near future, and he believes that the additional income made possible by this loan will help him improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy food stock of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An and his wife, Pella, have been married since 1986, and they have one son and two daughters who are attending school. The family lives in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

An and his wife are farmers and make a living by growing vegetables and flowers. Besides farming, An also raises cows.

An is applying for a loan in the amount of $500 from MAXIMA. He will use a portion of this loan to add a kitchen to his house.

loans.use: to add a kitchen to his house.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Santa Lucía Group

texts.es:
Este banco mujer se conformó hace seis meses, en una comunidad sociomarginal,ubicada en la provincia de Cartago, cantón de Paraíso, con seis mujeres, que sus deseos de mejorar las condiciones de vida de ellas y sus familias, las lleva a buscar alternativas de apoyo económico y por referencia de una de sus integrantes, ellas buscan información en la fundación, acerca del  crédito grupal y deciden unirse para iniciar su proyecto ecnómico, o para fortalecer el que ya tienen.

Ya ellas recibieron  el proceso de capacitación, requisito primordial y  el primer crédito, que pagaron en forma puntual, ahora están solicitando el segundo crédito según la modalidad del banco mujer,por un monto de 250.000 colones cada una.

Por razones personales una de sus integrantes se retiró del grupo, por eso es que en la foto que se sube al perfil hay una señora  de más ,ya que es la foto que tenemos en nuestros registros.

Ellas esperan con gran entusiasmo este crédito, ya que les permitirá ampliar sus 
negocios, al poder comprar más mercadería para las que venden productos por catálogo y materias primas para las que producen manualidades y artesanías.
texts.en:
This communal bank was formed six months ago in a sociomarginal community located in the province of Cartago, Paraíso Canton. It consists of six women who want to improve their and their family's living conditions. This leads them to look for alternative forms of economic support. By reference of one of their members they looked for information in the foundation about group loans and decided to form a group to start their business project or to strengthen the one they already have. 

They have already received the primordial requirement of the capitalization process and the first loan, which they paid punctually. Now they are requesting a second loan according to the communal bank modality, for the amount of 250,000 each.

For personal reasons one of the members retired from the group, which is why in the photo there is one extra person, as this was the photo we had in our records.

They await this loan enthusiastically as it will allow them to extend their businesses by buying more stock to sell via catalogue and raw material to make crafts and artesanal objects.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothes, footwear, paints, brushes, wood.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married with three children; only two of her children go to school. She also takes care of two brothers. They live in a rented house in which they have access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

For the past ten years Christine has sold fruits and vegetables. Seasonality and perishability are her major challenges.

She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from SACCO to buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, cabbages, pineapples and oranges to sell. Her ambition is to grow her business so that she can start growing those fruits herself. She would also like to become a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land upon which to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 51 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco junto a su hija de 14 años, Martha es madre soltera, pese a las adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida ha podido salir adelante junto a su hija, ella siempre ha sido una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora; en sus ratos libres le gusta tejer chompas de lana para su hija y algunos familiares, y en algunas ocasiones prepara un riquísimo “Caucau”, plato preferido por ella y su hija; con empeño culminó sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera de Contabilidad.
Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor y al apoyo de sus hermanas, desde hace mas de 1 año Martha puso en marcha su negocio de venta de pollo broaster y el de venta de ropa, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 13 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender hasta 35 cliente, ella cree que su negocio va bien, debido a su buena sazón y talento para las ventas, así como por su trato amable y buena atención.
Martha se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como: polos, chompas, pantalones, blusas y otros; de esta manera podrá abastecer su negocio de venta de ropa e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, con los cuales mas adelante espera puedan servirles para realizar la compra de un carrito sanguchero que utilizará para seguir trabajando y lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia y  lograr que su hija sea una buena profesional y una mujer de bien.
texts.en: Martha is a 51 years old woman; she lives in the city of Pisco together with her 14 years old daughter. Martha is a single mother, in spite of the adversities that have come up in her life she has been able to get through, together with her daughter. She has always been a fighter and a hard working woman. In her spare time she likes to knit wool sweaters for her daughter and some family members, and in some occasions she prepares a delicious "caucau", her and her daughter's favorite dish. With a lot of hard work she finished her secondary education. Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources she wasn't able to go to the university, but she would have liked a lot to study Accounting. Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and the support of her sisters, over a year ago, Martha set up her business selling broaster chicken and selling clothes. She dedicates about 13 hours a day to her business, which allows her to service up to 35 customers. She believes her business is doing well, thanks to her cooking skills and talent for sales, as well as her kind disposition and good customer service. Martha is very thankful to Kiva lenders since thanks to the help provided by them she will be able to purchase merchandise such as: polo shirts, sweaters, pants and blouses among others. In this way she will be able to supply her clothes selling business and increase her financial income, which she hopes, further on in the future, will allow her to buy a sandwich cart she will use to continue working and accomplish her big dream of having a house of her own and help her daughter become a fine, professional woman.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as: polo shirts, sweaters, pants and blouses among others

loans.name: Yenny Yessica

texts.es:
Yenny es una mujer de 29 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor tiene 11 años y el pequeño tiene 2 añitos, ella se siente muy feliz por tener a sus dos pequeños ya que son su alegría y lo que más desea es poder sacarlos adelante; en su ratos libres le gusta ver televisión junto a sus hijos y en algunas ocasiones prepara uno de sus platos favoritos como es el delicioso “Arroz con Pato”; con mucho esmero Yenny culminó sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar la carrera de diseño gráfico que tanto quería.
Con mucho entusiasmo y por iniciativa propia, Yenny puso en marcha su negocio de venta de comida, así también brinda servicios de fotografía, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10 horas diarias, ella cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a su buena sazón, carisma y buen trato hacia sus clientes.  
Yenny se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el acondicionamiento de su triciclo, el cual le servirá para poder vender comida en el centro de la ciudad; de esta manera Yenny espera poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos  para poder instalar su negocio en el centro de la ciudad y con ello en un futuro no muy lejano espera tener su propio estudio fotográfico.
texts.en:
Yenny is a 29 year-old woman who lives in the city of Nazca.  She has 2 children: the oldest is 11 years old and the little one is 2 years old.  She is very happy to have her two little ones, because they are her joy, and what she most desires is to get them ahead.  In her spare time, she enjoys watching TV with her children, and at times she prepares one of their favorite dishes, such as "Arroz con Pato" (rice with duck).  With a lot of effort, Yenny completed her high school education.  But unfortunately, even though she really wanted to, she was unable to study graphic design because of a lack of financial resources.

On her own initiative, and with a lot of enthusiasm, Yenny started up her business selling food.  In addition, she provides photographic services.  She works in her business about 10 hours a day, and she believes that her business is going well thanks to her good cooking, her charm, and the good service she provides to her customers.

Yenny is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they are providing she will be able to recondition her tri-cycle vehicle, which she uses to sell her food in the center of the city.  In this way, Yenny hopes to be able to increase her income so that she can set up her business in the center of the city and thereby, in the near future, establish her own photographic studio.

loans.use: to recondition her tri-cycle catering vehicle

loans.name: Mar Azul Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Mar Azul” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; asesoras de hogar, minimarket, venta de ropa en general, venta de carteras, repostería, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Pamela, secretaria del grupo Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en la tercera fila ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una polera blanca con rayas de color gris, usa su pelo tomado y es de color negro.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y confección, comenta que la venta de ropa la realiza en la feria los sábados y domingos y la confección de cortinas en su casa los días de la semana trabajando a pedido. Se dedica a estos rubros desde hace 2 años.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en la ciudad de Santiago, y otras veces sus familiares le envían ropa para la venta de su negocio, ya que  le sirve para ahorrar.
Con el crédito comprará ropa para todas las edades y diferentes modelos, además telas, hilos para la confeccion de las cortinas.
Las metas en su negocio son instalar un taller para ofrecer sus insumos a su clientela.
Pamela vive sola con sus 4 hijos de 19, 13, 10 y 2 años de edad y uno de sus sueños es independizarse con su taller, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Pamela está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Mar Azul” (Blue Sea) and it has 17 entrepreneurs who carry out various lines of work among which we have:  domestic employees, minimarket, general clothing sales, purse sales, pastry shop and services, among others.  All are from the city of Chillán.

Pamela, communal bank Secretary, appears in the photo standing in the third row, second from left to right, wearing a white shirt with gray stripes; her black hair is gathered up.

She sews and sells clothes.  She comments that the clothes sales take place in the street markets on Saturdays and Sundays and she makes the curtains at home on weekdays; she works to order.  She’s been in these lines of work for two years.

Merchandise she needs she buys in the city of Santiago and sometimes her relatives ship her clothes for her to sell in her business which helps her save.

She will use the loan to buy different styles of clothes for all ages.  She will also buy fabric and thread to make curtains.  Her business goal is to set up a workshop to sell her supplies to her clientele.

Pamela lives alone with her four children who are 19, 13, 10 and 2 years of age and one of her dreams is to become independent with her workshop to generate higher income and with it be able to opt for a better quality of life.

Pamela is very happy and grateful for the loan and the services provided by Fondo Esperanza and she also feels very comfortable with the meetings and with her communal bank group because generosity and unity prevail.

Chillán is a commune in the south-central part of Chile.  Its name means “Seat of the Sun” in Mapudungun, the language of our indigenous Mapuches.  Chillán is known as the “Cradle of the Fatherland” or “Land of Artists” because many outstanding figures in Chilean history were born in this city like, for example, the well-known pianist, Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: Comprará ropa para todas las edades y diferentes modelos, además telas, hilos para la confeccion de las cortinas.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es: Vanessa de 35 años de edad, vive en Sabanagrande, un municipio a orillas del Rio Magdalena. Ella trabaja diariamente, porque su sueño es llegar a tener un almacén, que goce de mucho reconocimiento en el pueblo, por eso vende mercancías que trae de la Capital de Venezuela, donde vive su cónyuge y con ello ha logrado ahorrar e invertir en otro negocio, que le proporciona la oportunidad de generar un nuevo ingreso. Así fue como  comprando lavadoras, se dedicó a ofrecer el servicio de alquiler de estas máquinas, a amas de casa, para ayudarlas a disminuir la tarea de lavar manualmente y bajo el  candente sol de su municipio, mientras ella con este trabajo gana un dinero extra . Su falta de capital de trabajo ante los sueños de Vanessa, son su mayor desafío, por eso acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará calzado, ropa que son los pedidos que se han incrementado en esta temporada de vacaciones escolares. Su credikiva proyecta ser exitoso, porque lo hace bajo pedidos de su clientela y lo que compre rotará muy rápido, haciendo también mover rápidamente su capital de trabajo e incrementar su cartera de cuentas por cobrar, la cual escogiendo a buenos clientes aumentaría su recuperación y asì mismo  sus utilidades. .
texts.en:
35 year old Vanessa lives in Sabanagrande, a municipality on the edges of the Magdalena River. She works everyday because her dream is to have a store that is well-known in her town. In order to do this, she sells products brought from the capital of Venezuela where her spouse lives. With this, she has managed to save and invest in another business that has provided the opportunity to generate new income. Buying washing machines, she worked to offer a rental service of these machines to housewives in order to help them reduce the chore of having to manually wash clothing under the burning sun of their town. Meanwhile, Vanessa can earn extra money. 

The lack of working capital in the face of Vanessa’s dreams are her biggest challenge, this is why she has turned to Kiva credit, her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With her Kiva credit she will buy and sell clothing and footwear which are in high demand during this season of school vacation. Her loan should be successful because her sales are based on customer orders.  What she buys has a fast turnover, which causes her working capital to turn quickly and therefore increase her profits. Choosing good customers would increase the recovery of her capital and thereby her earnings.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothing and footwear

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with one child who is still too young for school. She is a resident of Kisauni, Kenya.

For the past two years Mariam has been selling cooked eggs to her neighbors and passersby. Her main business challenges are inflation and price fluctuations.

Mariam was introduced to Yehu by her friends. She is requesting a 20,000 KES loan from Yehu to buy additional eggs to sell. Mariam believes the income from her loan will help improve her family's living standards. Since she currently sells from home, her ambition is to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy additional eggs to sell.

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “las Rosas” está conformado por 20 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente artesanía, venta de ropa en general, alimentos, peluquería, vulcanización, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Coquimbo.
Maria Cecilia quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila y se ubica en el centro, vistiendo una falda con rayas color café, chaleco color verde y una bufanda, su pelo es de color negro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la confección, desde hace 20 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes, su taller lo tiene en su casa.
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de la serena, comenta que le gustaría viajar a la ciudad de Santiago a comprar ya que es más barato y tiene más variedad.
Con el crédito comprará una bordadora, hilos, telas.
Sus metas son establecerse con un taller más grande cerca de su casa, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Maria Cecilia vive junto a su hija quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus seños son tener un taller grande y  dar la oportunidad a gente trabajando con ella.
Maria Cecilia está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
Coquimbo es una ciudad-puerto y por otro lado comuna-balneario, capital de la provincia de Elqui, IV Región de Coquimbo, Chile. La economía de la zona se basa principalmente en la minería ya que posee grandes yacimientos de magnesio, oro, plata, cobre, hierro y plomo. También hay agricultura que se desarrolla gracias al intensivo uso de los valles de Elqui, Limarí y Choapa con cultivos de hortalizas y frutas favorecidos por las condiciones del clima
texts.en:
The name of this communal bank is Las Rosas. It comprises 20 entrepreneurs who work in commercial activities, specifically arts and crafts, clothing sales in general, food, hairdressing, vulcanization, and other services. They all belong to the city of Coquimbo.
Maria Cecilia, who is standing in the middle of the first row in the picture, is wearing a brown striped skirt, a green vest, and a scarf. Her hair is black and she is wearing it loose. 
She has been working in the dressmaking trade for 20 years. She works Monday through Friday and her workshop is in her home.
She purchases her merchandise in the city of La Serena. She says she would like to travel to the city of Santiago and make her purchases there, because it is cheaper and there is more variety. 
She will use the loan to purchase an embroidering machine.
Her goal is to set up a larger shop near her home, in order to generate more income, so that she can have access to a better quality of life.
Maria Cecilia lives with her daughter, who is going to school. Her dream is to have a large workshop and give people the opportunity to work with her.
Maria Cecilia is very grateful and happy with the loan and services offered by Fondo Esperanza. She also says that she feels very comfortable with the meetings and the communal bank group, because there is generosity and unity.
Coquimbo is a port city and, on the other hand, a beach resort. It is the capital of Elqui province, in Region IV of Coquimbo, Chile. The economy of this area is mainly based on mining, since it has large deposits of magnesium, gold, silver, copper, iron, and lead. There is also agriculture, which is developed thanks to intensive use of the Elqui, Limarí and Choapa valleys, where fruits and vegetables are grown under favorable weather conditions.

loans.use: Comprará una bordadora, hilos, telas.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es:
Isaac tiene 52  años de edad, es viudo y cuenta con dos hijos y un nieto a su cargo. Vive junto a ellos en el caserío Cascajal, una de las zonas rurales que conforman el distrito de Lambayeque, situado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo. La zona en donde vive alberga a unas 150 familias y recientemente cuenta con los servicios de electricidad y agua potable. 

Desde hace veinte años se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de ladrillos. Para el desarrollo de esta actividad cuenta con un horno artesanal cercano a la zona en donde reside. El aprendió el oficio de su padre y conoce su negocio a la perfección.  Adicionalmente cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto de la agricultura. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para solventar los gastos económicos de su familia. 

Isaac desea adquirir mas materiales para incrementar su producción de ladrillos ya que la demanda de la población en la zona está aumentando, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los que piensa lograr su objetivo. El es una persona bastante responsable y entregada a su familia. En la fotografía nos muestra el horno en donde prepara sus productos.
texts.en:
Isaac, 52, is a widower.  He, two of his children and a grandchild live in Cascajal, a rural area in Lambayeque district that is an hour or so from the city of Chiclayo.  There are about 150 families in Cascajal and they only got electricity and clean water services recently.

Isaac has operated a brick manufacturing business for twenty years.  He learned the business from his parents and knows it inside and out.  He supplements his earnings from brick manufacturing with a farming business.  The combined income is enough to support his family.

Isaac is applying for a loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs to increase his production of bricks.  He is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new soles loan so that he can meet a growing demand for bricks here.  Isaac is a responsible man who wants to provide for his family.  You can see him in the phone with the kiln that he uses to make his bricks.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his brick manufacturing business.

loans.name: Angeles Del Triunfo Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Ángeles del triunfo” está conformado por 16
emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de ropa, repostería, peluquería, venta de perfumes, joyas, lanas, Hilos, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de la Pintana ubicada al sur de la ciudad de Santiago.
Islevi, presidenta del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en tercera fila, ocupando el tercer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una chaqueta  color café, , su cabello es de color negro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de confecciones y también presta servicios en venta de pasteles y servicios de fotocopiadora. Se ocupa de estos servicios desde hace 8 meses, trabaja de lunes a viernes en confecciones de ropa y cortinas, los sábados se dedica a su fotocopiadora y venta de pasteles.
La mercadería que va necesitando para sus confecciones las compra en distribuidoras de telas en la ciudad de Santiago por lo económico, y los demás materiales en distribuidoras de papeles y supermercados para preparar sus pasteles. 
Con el crédito comprara papeles y tinta para su fotocopiadora, telas e hilos para sus confecciones de cortinas y ropa.
Las metas son tener un taller ya que le gusta mucho el rubro de la confección,  y así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Islevi vive junto a sus 5 hijos de 17, 12, 8, 6, 4 quienes se encuentran todos estudiando. Sus sueños son poder llegar a tener su taller en su casa y así ver el cuidado de sus hijos.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que participa, ya que son unidos y responsables.
La Pintana es una comuna ubicada al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile), en la región Metropolitana. Se caracteriza por ser una comuna con altos índices de pobreza, donde más de un 10 por ciento de los habitantes vive en situación de indigencia. Por lo anterior, la autoridad local (municipalidad) se ha preocupado de desarrollar variados programas sociales enfocados a aportar al  mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de sus habitantes.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Ángeles del Triunfo,” and is made up of 16 entrepreneurs who work in the retail sector. Specifically, in clothing sales, pastry shop, hair salon, selling perfume, jewelry, wool, thread, as well as in other services. All of them are from the Pintana commune, located south of the city of Santiago.

Islevi, chair of of the communal bank, is seen in the photo, standing in the third row, occupying the third place going from right to left. She is wearing a light brown jacket, and has black hair, which she wears pulled back.

She works as a dressmaker and also sell cakes and photocopier services. She has been involved in these services for eight months. She works from Monday to Friday making clothing and curtains. On Saturdays she works at her photocopier and selling cakes.

She buys the merchandise she needs for her sewing at fabric distributors in the city of Santiago, because it is less expensive. She buys the other materials at paper distributors, and at supermarkets for preparing her cakes. 

With the loan she will buy paper and ink for her photocopier, as well as fabric and thread for sewing curtains and clothing.

Her goals are to have a workshop, as she really likes the dressmaking trade, and this way strive for a better quality of life.

Islevi lives with her five children, ages 17, 12, 8, 6, and 4, who are all in school. Her dreams are to manage to have her workshop in her home and this way see to the care of her children.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has offered her for investing in her business. As well, she feels very comfortable with the group she participates in, as they are close-knit and responsible.

La Pintana is a commune located south of Santiago (Chile's capital), in the Santiago Metropolitana Area. It is noted for being a commune with high indices of poverty, where more than 10% of the inhabitants live are destitute. Because of this, the local municipal government has concerned itself with developing a variety of social programs aimed at contributing to the improvement of the inhabitants' quality of life.

loans.use: To buy paper and ink for her photocopier, as well as fabric and thread for making curtains and clothing.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret  is widowed with seven children, five of whom go to school. She also takes care of her brother’s children. For the last 10 years, Margaret has run a retail shop. Her business is her only source of income and she works seven days a week. Margaret's major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She lives in a rented house without electricity and running water and her monthly expenses include rent and school fees. 

Margaret is requesting a 8,000,000 UGX loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, bags of bread, and small jerycans of cooking oil. In the future, she hopes to open a fully stocked wholesale shop and to educate her remaining children through university. She also plans to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cartons of salt, soap, and cooking oil

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.ru: Зарифа трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина, она вдова и сама воспитывает четверых детей. Её муж умер в гражданской войне в 1992 года. Она осталась одна с детьми. Семью надо было кормить, и у неё не было денег на содержание семьи. Затем она обратилась в Ассоциацию Деловых Женщин Таджикистана и нашла поддержку со стороны ассоциации. Затем она получила займ 240 долларов США в группе от «ИМОН Интернешнл» и начала заниматься купле- продажей промтоваров. Она благополучно работала на рынке, бизнес развивался, постепенно расширила бизнес и увеличивала доходы. Теперь она  состоятельная и успешная женщина среди предпринимателей.  Она добавила в свой бизнес продажу детскую и мужскую одежду. Зарифа серьёзно относится к бизнесу и постоянно обновляет товарооборот, изучила маркетинг, потребность населения и сезонность рынка. Ей в бизнесе помогает дочка. Она хотела бы получить займ для покупки товара с целью пополнения оборотного капитала. Получив прибыль она мечтает построить свой магазин и создать хорошие условия проживания и построить свой дом как коттедж. Зарифа надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие, которая позволит ей достичь своей мечты.
texts.en: Zarifa is a hardworking and conscientious woman, who is a widow and raising four children on her own.  Her husband died during the civil war in 1992, and she was left alone with the children.  The family had to be provided for, but she had no money to support the family.  Then she went to the Association of Tajikistan Business Women and found support from the association.  Zarifa obtained a loan in the amount of $240 in the group from "IMON International" and increased her income.  Currently, she is an independent and successful woman among entrepreneurs.  She added sales of children's and men's clothing into her merchandise selection.  Zarifa treats the business seriously and constantly updates her goods turnover.  She learned marketing, people's demand and market seasonality.  Her daughter helps her with the business.  Zarifa wants to obtain this loan to buy merchandise in order to refill her working capital.  Having made a profit, she dreams of building her own store and providing good living conditions and building her own house as a cottage.  Zarifa relies on your help and mercy, which would allow her to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise

loans.name: Srey Srors

texts.en:
Srey Srors, pictured with her loom, is a 23-year-old weaver. Her husband, Kim Huot, is 27 and works as a musician for Ministry of Culture and Fine Arts. The couple lives in a village along the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one young daughter.  

Srey Srors is rqeuesting a 1,500 USD loan to purchase a motorbike for commuting and to build a restroom for family use.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting and to build a restroom for family use

loans.name: Los Carpinteros Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Los carpinteros, esta conformado por  cuatro personas, humildes e inteligentes originarias de la ciudad de Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca, una de las artesanías de la comunidad es la elaboración de mascaras de madera que representan distintos animales pintados en brillantes colores.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es el señor Dionicio Francisco  de sesenta y tres años de edad, quien se dedica a la elaboración de muebles por mayoreo y menudeo.
Don Nicho como mejor lo conocen sus paisanos y compañeros de grupo, nos dice que puedo adquirir su negocio, cuándo se vino a la ciudad de Pinotepa, ya que anteriormente vivía en pueblo llamado El Santo , con el dinero que tenia ahorrado  decidió poner un taller de carpintería , ya desde pequeño , le llamaba la atención elaborar muebles.
Una de las cosas que hace tan especial a don Nicho es la atención que le da a sus clientes, la sencillez, la creatividad, paciencia  y el talento para diseñar y darle ese toque especial a sus muebles.
Dice que con el apoyo de Vision Found  va a poder comprar mas maderas, dicel, lijas, cerullos y clavos de diferentes tamaños para la elaboración de muebles.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son
Raquel-quien se dedica a la venta y elaboración de muebles.
Santiago Alvaro- se dedica a la venta y elaboración de muebles.
Elías- se dedica a la venta y elaboración de muebles.
Le dan las gracias  a fundacion por ayudar  a las personas con talentos, pero que no tienen los recursos para engrandecerlo.
texts.en:
The four members of this group call themselves Los Carpinteros ("The Carpenters).  They are smart, regular people from the city of Pinotepa Nacional in Oaxaca.  The town is famous for the traditional wooden masks that are made here.  The masks, painted in brilliant colors, represent various animals.
One of the members, Sr. Dionicio Francisco, 63, operates a furniture-making business.  He makes some furniture to order and some for local wholesalers.
Don Nicho, as he's know to people here, tells us that he bought his business when he came to Pinotepa from a small town called El Santo.  He used his savings to buy a wood-working shop where he now makes furniture.
We were struck by the attention that Don Nicho pays his customers, his creativity, his patience and his talent for design.  
He says that support from Vision Fund will allow him to buy the materials--wood, chisels, sandpaper, nails, etc.--that he needs to make furniture.
The other members of the group are:
Raquel who operates a business making and selling furniture.
Santiago Alvaro who operates a business making and selling furniture.
Elias who operates a business making and selling furniture.
They are grateful to the foundation for helping them because they are confident in their abilities and only need a little help to grow.

loans.use: to buy materials for furniture-making business.

loans.name: Las Adas Del Centro Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Adas del Centro y está conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras originarias de Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca. Uno de los platillos típicos de esta ciudad es el caldo de iguana.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Antonia de cuarenta y siete años de edad, quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos como enchiladas verdes, tostadas, quesadillas, sopes y empanadas de pollo.
Doña Antonia nos dice que en las noches saca sus mesas y sillas para vender sus antojitos afuera de su casa, también cuenta con servicio a domicilio. Dice que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de bolis (paletas congeladas) y tamales en su casa y gracias a Dios obtenía buenas ganancias y con el paso del tiempo decidió vender antojitos mexicanos en la noche.
Una de las cosas mas lindas que le han pasado es seguir con su negocio y tener la ayuda de Vision Fund,ya que con su apoyo va a poder comprar más ingredientes: chile verde chile seco, tomate, cebolla, ajo, queso, quesillo y carne de pollo.

Las otras integrantes son:

Graciela- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Francisca-se dedica a la venta de manualidades.
Sonia- se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion Realidad por ayudarlas para que puedan engrandecer sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Las Adas del Centro communal bank is comprised of four hard-working women from Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca.  One of the typical dishes of this city is iguana soup.

Antonia, age 46, is one of the members of the group.  She sells typical Mexican snacks like enchiladas verdes, tostadas, quesadillas, “sopes” (thick tortillas with vegetable and meat toppings), and chicken empanadas.

Antonia tells us that at night she gets out her tables and chairs to sell her snacks outside of her house.  She also provides home service.  She says that she previously sold frozen pops and tamales at her house.  Thanks to God, she got good income, and with the passage of time she decided to sell Mexican snacks at night.,

One of the nicest things that has happened is continuing in her business and having help from Vision Fund.  With their support she will be able to buy more ingredients like green chili, dried chili, tomatoes, onions, garlic, cheese, “quesillo” (fresh, soft cheese), and chicken.

The other members are:
Graciela – Sells Mexican snacks
Francisca – Sells handicrafts
Sonia – Sells shoes by catalog

They give their thanks to the Fundación Realidad for helping them be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make Mexican snacks.

loans.name: Angela Rosa

texts.es:
Ángela Rosa es originaria del municipio de Achuapa, se desempeña como conserje donde ha desarrollado esta actividad por muchos años la que le ha permitido sacar adelante sola a sus hijos como madre soltera y hoy con la ayuda de ellos como independientes ha construido su propia vivienda la que poco a poco la está acondicionando.
Tiene cuatro años de trabajar con Cepodel donde le han otorgado cuatro créditos todos para su desarrollo económico porque han sido invertidos en su vivienda la que hoy tiene con  muchas mejoras y gracias a ello ya no tiene la necesidad de andar alquilando.
Este crédito lo solicita para la compra de ladrillos, cemento y zinc porque necesita construir una habitación para tener más espacio para su familia.
Confía en Dios poder salir adelante con este financiamiento y llegar a tener una larga duración con esta Institución para seguir obteniendo más financiamientos.
texts.en:
Angela Rosa is from Achuapa.  She works as a "conserje" (not sure: custodian, caretaker, cleaner), work that she's done for many years.  Though a single mother, her income was enough to support her children who are now old enough to help her.  Together they built a house that they are slowly improving.
Angela Rosa has been a Ceprodel client for four years and has received four loans that she has used to improve her house.  Thanks to the loans, she has been able to make many improvements to the house and save money that she would otherwise have had to spend on rent.  
Angela Rosa will use this new loan to buy bricks, cement and roofing materials that she will use to add a room to her house and provide more space for her family.  She trusts God's goodness and hopes to continue her long partnership with this Institution.

loans.use: to buy supplies for construction project.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали трудолюбивый и добросовестный, содержащей большую семью. На воспитании имеет шестерых детей. Его большая семья требует больших расходов, чтобы их кормить и обеспечить она начал заниматься выращиванием и продажей сельхозпродуктов. Также часть урожая идет на содержание семьи. Сафарали понравились условия займа  «ИМОН Интенешнл! и он хотел бы получить займ в размере 10000 сомони для покупки минеральных удобрений, семян и горюче-смазочных материалов. Сафарали надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Safarali is a hardworking and conscientious person, who supports a large family.  He is raising six children.  His large family demands high expenses, and, in order to support it and provide for it, he became involved in growing and selling agricultural crops.  Part of the harvest also goes toward supporting the family.  Safarali liked the loan conditions of "IMON International," and he wanted to obtain a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds and fuel.  Safarali relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is married and has three children. For the past four years, she has run a carpentry business to earn a living. Eunice has employed three people in her business and she also does farming to supplement her income. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has learned business management skills.  

Eunice is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy timber and nails. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and employ more people.

loans.use: to buy timber and nails

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en: Originally from Havana, Cuba, Marcia moved to the United States with her mother over 40 years ago and began working in the computer services industry. Marcia maintains an incredibly hard work ethic while balancing the demands of a single mother. Both her mother and her son rely on her for financial support. After 20 years in the industry, Marcia started her own company, Professional Systems Services, which provides computerized telecommunication management systems to a wide-variety of industries. Her clients include major universities, hospitals and companies. Being an entrepreneur has taught Marcia all the different facets of her business including sales, client-outreach and finances. Beyond her obvious interest in computers, Marcia is devoted to her clients and customer service is at the forefront of her business. To accommodate her clients’ increasing needs and to continue to grow her business, Marcia has been taking sales and marketing classes. This loan will help her continue to pay for these enrichment classes and ensure the continued success of her business at a time when many contracts are up for renewal. With a new marketing campaign, Marcia hopes to grow her business and continue to share her passion for the telecommunications industry with others.

loans.use: To finance marketing and sales classes and launch a new marketing plan

loans.name: Shirin

texts.ru: Ширин  62 года. Ширин в качестве основного  источника дохода для своей семьи,  25 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством. Начатый  с покупки 2 овец бизнес благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости  Ширин, на сегодня насчитывает 2 коровы и 10 голов мелкого рогатого скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса,  Ширин обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота на откорм и перепродажу.  Доходы от кредита  Ширин планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Shirin is 62 years old.  To provide a primary source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry 25 years ago.  Thanks to Shirin's hard works and persistence, the business, started with a purchase of two sheep, today contains two cows and ten heads of small livestock.  In order to further develop her business, Shirin requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 43-year-old married man who is a father of four children. For the past 33 years, he has worked as an auto mechanic. His experience was enough for him to open his own garage in 2000. Bilal is a hard worker with a very good reputation and he is well known in his region as having a special touch.

Bilal is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy used cars for their spare parts. He will divide and separate car parts to use when needed. His loan will bring in extra income and improve his business. In the future, Bilal hopes to expand his business, open a larger garage, and start selling used and new spare parts.

loans.use: to buy used cars for their spare parts

loans.name: Artemia Emperatriz

texts.es:
La señora Artemia Emperatriz, originaria de Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca donde una de las artesanías de la comunidad es la elaboración de pulseras y aretes de vidrio cortado.
Doña Artemia como mejor la conocen sus paisanos, recaracteriza por ser una persona creativa y muy alegre que le gusta mucho reírse de la vida y ver las cosas siempre positivamente.
Dice que se dedica a la venta de joyería como son pulseras, aretes, anillos y rosarios negocio lo empezó desde hace siete años y lo ha ido engrandeciendo con amor, dedicación y esfuerzo.
Doña Artemia dice una de las cosas mas lindas que mas le agradan de su negocio es salir a las colonias vecinas de su comunidad a ofrecerles su mercancía a todas las personas.
Una de las cosas maravillosas que le han pasado es contar con el apoyo de Vison Found , ya que va poder comprar más joyas para la venta para la venta por mayoreo y menudeo.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por apoyarla para que pueda continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Artemia Emperatriz is from Pinotepa Nacional in Oaxaca.  The town is know for its traditional earrings and bracelets made from cut glass.
Dona Artemia, as she is widely known here, is a creative woman, full of life and always smiling.  
She tells us that she has operated a business selling jewelry--bracelets, earrings, rings, rosaries--for seven years.  The business has grown over the years, a consequence of her love, dedication and hard work.  
She adds that one of her favorite things is to go to nearby neighborhoods, with her merchandise, of course, and sell all that she can.
Dona Artemia is very pleased to be a Vision Found client because she has been able to buy more jewelry to stock her business.
She tells us that she is grateful to the foundation for its support because its loans allow her to continue her business.

loans.use: to stock her retail jewelry business.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en: Marita has managed a jewelry business for five years. She procures silver jewelry from a jewelry shop in Cauayan and Bangkok and gold from one of her friends. She sells the jewelry directly to her friends and some customers in her village. Marita is requesting a loan amounting of PHP 13,000 from the KIVA lenders to have additional working capital for the expansion of her business. She hopes that it will be granted so that she can maintain her business, which will be very helpful in sending her children to school. Marita is appointed as treasurer in her village, and has been treasurer for two years already. She is married to Ruben and he works as a tricycle operator. They have four children, two of whom are still studying. She hopes that through her business and her husband’s transportation daily income, they will generate enough income to be send their children to school. She hopes that KIVA lenders will help her business grow and allow her to send her children to complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase different jewelry for her business.

loans.name: Octaviano Francisco

texts.es: En el municipio de Larreynaga Malpaisillo en un poblado del  departamento de león, El señor Octaviano se dedica arduamente  a laborar como Inspector de Higiene en un centro de salud , dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 22 años, es Casado con 1 Hijo a su cargo al que tiene que proporcionarles  las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrolle, Una de las necesidades que el señor Octaviano  atraviesa,  es de Mejorar sus condiciones de la vivienda, construyendo un sumidero, y a si hacer Honor a su cargo laboral en la Higiene misma entrando por casa, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le `permitió tomar la decisión de visitar a ceprodel, para solicitar un crédito para la compra de Materiales de construcción como: Zinc, Cemento, Arena, Bloques , Ladrillo Rojo y Mano de Obra para la construcción de un Sumidero, y de esa manera mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida familiar.
texts.en: Octaviano works hard as a hygiene inspector in a health center in a village in the municipality of Larreynaga/Malpaisillo in the León department of Nicaragua.  He has been working in this capacity for 22 years.  He is married with one son in his care for whom he must provide.  One of the things Octaviano needs is to improve his living conditions by building a sink, which would be a way to honor what he does at work within his own home.  He decided to visit Kiva partner CEPRODEL to ask for a loan to purchase building materials such as zinc, cement, sand, and red bricks as well as manual labor to build a sink, and thereby improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchasebuilding materials such as zinc, cement, sand, and red bricks as well as manual labor.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un hombre de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, distrito de Parcona, es separada y tiene una pequeña hija de 2 años; en sus ratos libres le justa jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos y en algunas ocasiones prepara uno de sus platos favoritos como es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”, con esmero culminó sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por falta de recursos no pudo cursar estudios universitarios, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Derecho.
Por iniciativa propia y muchos deseos de salir adelante, Daniel tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa, donde trabaja todas las mañanas; asimismo, todos los días en las tardes sale a caminar vendiendo canchita, habas, maní tostado y otros; el dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, en las cuales atiende buena cantidad de cliente, él cree que su negocio marcha bien, debido a que tiene buena acogida por sus vecinos quiénes son sus principales clientes, así como por su buena atención y carisma.
Daniel se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de cervezas, mesas y sillas los cuales le servirán para ser utilizados afuera de su bodega, ya que desea poder adicionar a su negocio la venta de cerveza pues tiene gran demanda, de esta manera Daniel espera poder incrementar sus ingresos y con ello poder abastecer y surtir mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Daniel is a 28-year-old man. He lives in the town of Ica, district of Parcona. He's separated and has a little 2-year-old daughter. In his free time he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and neighbors, and sometimes he cooks one of his favorite dishes, such as the delicious "arroz con pollo" (rice with chicken). With a lot of effort he finished high school. Unfortunately, due to lack of resources, he couldn't go to college, but he would have liked to have studied for a career in law.
On his own initiative, and with a lot of drive to get ahead, Daniel runs a small grocery shop from his home, where he works every morning. In addition, he goes out on foot every afternoon selling popcorn, beans, toasted corn and other things. He works on his business about 12 hours a day, and during this time he serves a good amount of customers. He believes that his business does well because it's well-received by his neighbors, who are his main customers, and also because of his good service and charisma.
Daniel is very thankful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to purchase beer, tables and chairs, which will be used outside of his store. He wishes to incorporate beer sales into his business, because there's great demand for it. That way Daniel hopes to be able to increase his profits and therefore better stock up his business.

loans.use: to purchase beer, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина уже два года как занимается шитьем. Она в основном шьет национальные платья. Ей 23 года. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Парвина берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки и покупки тканей.
texts.en: Parvina has been involved in sewing for two years.  She primarily sews national dresses.  She is 23 years old, married and has one child.  Parvina is requesting this loan to purchase a sewing machine and fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and fabrics

loans.name: Cecilia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Joven Cecilia del Socorro , trabaja como operaria, sus labores los realizan por turnos de ocho horas diarias y hace  este trabajo para el sustento de su familia.

Cabe mencionar que la Joven Cecilia, tiene la necesidad de construir su área  cocina  debido a esto se acerco a la oficina de Ceprodel a solicitar crédito para Compra de cemento, bloque, zinc, madera  esto le servirá para la construcción y tener un mejor nivel de vida ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Cecilia del Socorro is a young women who works as machine operator.  She works eight hour shifts and works to provide support for her family.

Cecilia will use her loan to build a kitchen area in her home.  Because of that she approached the Ceprodel office to ask for a loan to buy cement, blocks, zinc, wood in order to complete her construction project and to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, concrete block, corrugated iron and wood.

loans.name: Bunavsha

texts.ru: За последние годы Бунавша занимается купле- продажей скота. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Она трудолюбивая женщина и всегда хочет видеть улыбку на лице своих детей и мужа. Для достижения своих целей она работает усердно. Бунавша хочет увеличить поголовье скота и расширить свой бизнес, для этого она хотела бы получить займ для покупки скота для откорма. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Bunavsha has been involved in buying and selling livestock during the last few years.  She is married and raising three children.  She is a hardworking woman and always wants to see a smile on her children's and husband's faces.  She works hard in order to achieve her goals.  Bunavsha wants to increase her livestock headcount and expand her business, and wants to obtain a loan to buy livestock for fattening up.  She relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: El Cacique Group

texts.es: Nemesia tiene 32 años de edad y es parte del grupo El Cacique, dice que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo porque cerca de donde se juntan hay un cerro enorme que tiene ese nombre y es la representación de su población. Ella se dedica al cultivo y venta de aguacates ya que tiene una huerta de aproximadamente 80 árboles de aguacate, dice que emprendió ese negocio ya que tiene un terreno muy amplio y también para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Dice que en temporada de cosecha ella sale a vender a la central de abastos de su población, ella dice que ahorita le urge pedir un crédito de Vison Fund (FRAC) para comprar insumos para mejorar la producción de sus aguacates, ya que ahorita varios de sus árboles se les pego una plaga y por eso necesita el crédito para que no se le caiga el fruto que ya tienen los arboles por que en vez de ganar tendrá perdidas. Dice que comprara insecticidas, calidra, abonos orgánicos y unas 30 plantas de aguacate para sembrar, platica que su meta es hacer su huerto más grande y también empezar a sembrar durazno ya que también se le hace un buen negocio. Las otras 19 integrantes se llaman Isidra, María Cristina, Laura Cecilia, María Teresa, Alicia, Araceli, Yazmin, Belén, Elsa, Ma Guadalupe, Alberta, María Guadalupe, Rosalba, Jannet, Patricia, Tatiana, Mónica, María y María Guadalupe Eziquio, ellas invertirán sus créditos en insumos para cultivo de aguacate, diferentes frutas de temporada para vender por kilo, fruta para venderla en cocteles, alimento para vacas para obtener leche de mejor calidad, en compra de pollos y alimento para estos para venderlos, artículos para surtir tienda de abarrotes, surtir diferente variedad de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros para su venta.
texts.en:
Nemesia is 32 years old and a member of the El Cacique group.  She says that they picked this name because there is a mountain near the place where they meet and it has that name.  It’s also representative of its population.

She raises and sells avocados and that she began this business because she had a large parcel of land and also wanted to help her husband with the household expenses. She says that she goes out to sell in the local supply centers during the harvest season. She also says that she desperately needs to request a loan through Vision Fund (FRAC) in order to buy supplies to improve her avocado production, now that blight has his several of her trees.  She needs this loan so that the fruit doesn’t fall, otherwise she will have losses instead of gains.  She says that she will buy insecticides, organic fertilizers, and 30 more avocado plants to plant.  She talks about increasing the size of her orchard and begin planning peaches now that she is doing good business.  The other 19 members are Isidra, María Cristina, Laura Cecilia, María Teresa, Alicia, Araceli, Yazmin, Belén, Elsa, Ma Guadalupe, Alberta, María Guadalupe, Rosalba, Jannet, Patricia, Tatiana, Mónica, María and María Guadalupe Eziquio.  They will invest their loans into supplies for raising avocados, different seasonal fruits to sell by the kilo, cattle feed to get better quality milk, buying chickens and feed, items to stock grocery stores, different type of clothing for ladies, and gentlemen.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and plants.

loans.name: Nubia De Los Santos

texts.es:
La Señora Nubia de los Santos  se dedica a la  venta de agua y gaseosas en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, iniciando sus labores desde 6 am a ofertarle a todas las personas que viajan a los diferente departamento y finaliza a 5 pm, este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 13  años. 

La Señora solicita el crédito para comprar por mayor su productos como gaseosas, jugos, agua botella y cosa de horno  y así obtener más ganancia,  y  lograr a realizar mejora a su vivienda,  donde tendrá una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Nubia de los Santos works selling water and soda at one of the markets in the city of León.  She begins her work at 6 a.m., so as to offer her products for sale to all the people who travel to the different departments, and she finishes work at 5 p.m.  She has been doing this work for the last 13 years.

The Señora is requesting the loan to purchase her products at wholesale, such as sodas, juices, and bottled water in order to earn more profits.  She will be able to make improvements to her home, where she will have a better quality with life together with her family.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, juice, bottled water and baked items.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is from the village of Burgos. She is 30 years old. Marites is the group leader of a ten member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marites. Marites is married. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling mobile phone credit loads in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $200 a month from this activity. In 2010, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as snacks, drinks and spices for her store.

loans.name: Francisca Cleotilde

texts.es: La señora Francisca es originaria de una comunidad de larreynaga Malpaisillo, se dedica a impartir clases de primaria en el colegio de la misma localidad, es soltera con 2 hijos a los que tiene el deber de proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo, la señora francisca tiene en la actualidad una necesidad prioritaria en cuanto  a la construcción de una cocina. Por la necesidad misma se decidió visitar las oficinas de ceprodel para ser  beneficiada con un crédito y realizar  su objetivo que es el sueño de su vida, como es la construcción de la cocina, ya que los materiales que compraría son los siguientes: Zinc, Cemento, Arena, Ladrillo Bloques, Pilares, Soleras y Mano de Obra, y de esa manera mejorar sus condiciones  y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Francisca is from the community of Larreynaga, Malpaisillo.  She teaches classes at the local elementary school.  She’s single and has two children she must provide the necessary conditions for their development.

Francisca’s priority need right now is to build a kitchen.  Because of that need she decided to visit the Ceprodel offices to request a loan to reach that objective which is her life’s dream, to build the kitchen.  The materials she’ll buy are the following:  metal sheeting, cement, concrete blocks, pillars and crossbeams and will also pay labor costs thus improving her conditions and her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is 42 years old. She is married and has three adult children. Mildred has a pig that she will raise and sell when it is fully grown. She has been doing this type of business for five years. She is patiently doing this business for the welfare of her family. Mildred is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs. In the future, Mildred hopes that her business can expand to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs.

loans.name: Oportunidad Para Todos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Oportunidad para todos” está conformado por 15 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; feriantes, venta de calzado, venta de ropa, venta de pan amasado y empanadas, almacén, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes  a la comuna de Macul ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Eglae, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en el centro  sentada en primera fila, viste pantalón azul, polera negra que en el centro lleva un corazón de color rojo y encima lleva puesto una chaqueta de color café y una cartera, usa aros y su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa usada, se ocupa de este negocio desde hace 2 años. Su puesto lo ubica en ferias libres, los días martes a domingo. Su mercadería en ropa es diversa, ya que generalmente sus productos son para todas las edades y personas.
Su mercadería usualmente la compra en la ciudad de Santiago por ser mas económica y de gran variedad.
Con el crédito comprará chaquetas, zapatos, polerones, ya que este tipo de ropa le faltaba agregar a su negocio.
Sus metas son tener la posibilidad de adquirir en local o un puesto fijo en la feria, para atender a su clientela de forma más tranquila, y así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Eglae vive junto a su marido quien se encuentra trabajando de ayudante mecánico, y 3 hijos de 19, 17 y 9 quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños son obtener un local en buenas condiciones para la venta de ropa, y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Eglae está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
Es una comuna de Santiago que se encuentra ubicada en el sector centro-oriente, Es una zona eminentemente residencial e industrial, Dentro de la misma comuna, hay una gran variedad de estratos socioeconómicos. Hacia el sur, se encuentran los barrios más humildes, mientras que al norte, especialmente en los barrios limítrofes a la comuna de Ñuñoa, están los sectores con mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called "Oportunidad para Todos" (Opportunity for All) and consists of 15 entrepreneurs who engage in various trades including street vendors, shoe merchants, clothing merchants, bakers, store owners, service providers, and other occupations. All of them are from the community of Macul, which is located in the city of Santiago.

Eglae, the president of this Communal Bank, appears in the photo seated in the front row. She is wearing blue jeans and a black pullover shirt with a red heart in the middle. She is also wearing a coffee-colored jacket and holding a purse. Eglae is wearing earrings and has dark brown hair that she wears hanging down. She is a used clothing merchant and has been in this business for two years. Her vending post is located at the open fairs that are held Tuesday through Sunday. Her inventory of merchandise contains a diverse array of clothing, mostly garments for people of all ages. Eglae usually acquires her merchandise in the city of Santiago, where the goods are cheaper and offered in wider varieties. She will use her loan to buy jackets, shoes, and hoodies since these types of articles are lacking in her business. Her goals are to acquire a shop or a fixed post at the fair, to be able to attend to her customers in a more calmer setting, and to choose a better quality of life.

Eglae lives with her husband, who works as an assistant mechanic, and their three children (ages, 19, 17, and 9) who are studying. Her dreams are to acquire a shop with good conditions for selling clothes and to provide her family a better quality of life. She is very pleased and appreciative of the loans provided by Fondo Esperanza. In addition, she feels very comfortable at the meetings with her Communal Bank group, which has exhibited generosity and unity.

Macul is a community that is located in the central-western section of Santiago. It is primarily a residential and industrial area. Within the same community, there is a wide range of socioeconomic levels. To the south, there are very modest neighborhoods, while in the north there are sections with higher incomes, especially the neighborhoods bordering the community of Ñuñoa.

loans.use: to buy jackets, shoes, and hoodies.

loans.name: Fiorella Dora

texts.es:
Fiorella es una mujer de 20 años, soltera, vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Ica, distrito de Parcona, a pesar de su corta edad ella es una joven muy centrada con muchos deseos de superación; en sus ratos libres le gusta mucho bailar y en algunas ocasiones prepara un riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo” para compartir un delicioso almuerzo con su familia; con mucho esmero concluyó sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por falta de recursos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera de Enfermería.
Con mucho entusiasmo y gracias  a los ahorros que puedo conseguir trabajando en un fundo, puso en marcha su negocio de tener una pequeña bodega en su casa, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10 hora diarias, en las cuales puede atender hasta 30 clientes, ella cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a que ofrece bueno precios y atiende bien a sus clientes.
Fiorella se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de abarrotes, tales como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, etc., a fin de abastecer mejor su negocio y con ello ganar más clientes; de esta manera Fiorella podrá incrementar sus ingresos y poco a poco podrá ir creciendo su negocio y en el futuro espera poder tener un negocio más grande en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Fiorella is a 20-year-old woman living with her parents in the city of Ica, Parcona District.  Despite her young age, she’s a very well-centered young woman who very much wants to improve herself.  In her free times she enjoys dancing and sometimes prepares a very delicious “Arroz con Pollo” [Chicken with Rice] to share a delicious lunch with her family.  With much dedication she completed her secondary school but sadly for lack of resources was unable to study a university career but would have liked to have been able to study Nursing.

With mush enthusiasm and thanks to savings she was able to acquire working on a large agricultural spread; she started her home-based grocery store business.  She spends about 10 hours daily at work and can see up to 30 customers per day.  She believes that her business is running well because she offers good prices and takes care of her customers well.

Fiorella is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided she will be able to buy groceries like rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc. to better stock her store and win over more customers that way.  In this way Fiorella will increase income and gradually enlarge the business.  In the future she hopes to have a bigger store downtown.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene, 48, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Pol, her business partner. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college.
