Arlene operates a RTW, thermal paper and chlorine distribution business. She mainly offers RTW products with many designs to choose from. They also offer people the privilege to make their own design. Seasonal demands for clothing like basketball jerseys, costumes and such are available all year round. She also distributes chlorine and thermal paper to local customers in the community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of RTW, chlorine and thermal paper products needed for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Arlene dreams of beingable to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional products needed in her business.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
This is Eufemia, 47, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Robino, a paving inspector, and Eufemia is a mother of three children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eufemia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. She also does meat vending for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 550 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Eufemia hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Manuela Yolanda

texts.es:
Señora Manuela Yolanda  posee un pequeño negocio de venta de Agua, Gaseosa, refrescos Naturales en el departamento de León desde hace 25  años siendo este negocio el sustento de su familia.

Diariamente la Señora Manuela Yolanda se levanta y va al mercado a buscar frutas frescas posteriormente se traslada a su casa de habitación para la elaboración de los riquísimos refrescos Naturales los cuales ofrece a su clientela en uno de los mercados de la ciudad.  

Cabe mencionar que la demanda ha aumentado ,  y para aprovechar la venta  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  Frutas, Gaseosas,  jugos,  agua, cacao, semilla, payanas, azúcar. y así satisfacer la necesidad de su clientela.
texts.en:
Señora Manuela Yolanda has a small business selling water, sodas, and natural refreshments in the department of León.  For the last 25 years, this business has been her family's sustenance.

Señora Manuela Yolanda gets up daily and goes to the market to find fresh fruit, which she later transports to her home to make her delicious natural refreshments, which she sells to customers at one of the city's markets.

It is worth mentioning that her demand has increased, and to take advantage of the sales she is requesting a loan for the purchase of fruit, soda, water, cacao, seeds, payana and sugar to meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, cacao, seeds, payanas, and sugar

loans.name: Diana María

texts.es:
La Joven Diana María Actualmente desempeña el cargo de conserje, es una joven con espíritu de superación, siempre ha soñado con tener una vivienda digna, es por tal razón que se le dio la oportunidad de presentarse a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un Crédito para la construcción de su vivienda. 

Por esta razón,  se presentó a la institución  para que se le otorgue un financiamiento para la compra de Ladrillo y Cemento y así poder vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia, de igual manera Ceprodel siempre está en constante actividad en ayudar a este tipo de personas, debido a que la a motiva a seguir luchando y cumpliendo sus sueños.
texts.en:
Diana María is a young woman who is currently employed as a custodian.  She possesses a spirit for excellence and has always dreamed of having a decent home.  For this reason, she has taken the opportunity to visit CEPRODEL in order to request a home construction loan.  

This loan will provide financing for the purchase of bricks and cement.  As a result, her family will be able to live under better conditions.  CEPRODEL is always in the business of helping people who are motivated to strive toward the fulfillment of their dreams.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement.

loans.name: Las Perlas Group

texts.es:
La señora Abigail es otro de los miembros de este grupo ella tiene la edad de 44 años, estudio la universidad y esta casada con el señor Julian con el cual tiene 2 hijos los cuales asisten a  la escuela, Ella nos platica que con el apoyo de su esposo hace mas de 7 años abrió una pequeña farmacia en su comunidad con el propósito de brindar un servicio a su gente ya que como es una comunidad pequeña no se vendían medicamentos y se tenia que salir fuera a comprarlos, ademas de que quería ganar un dinero extra para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar, su negocio ha crecido en estos últimos años cada día esta mas surtido y a iniciado a vender cosméticos lo cual a ayudado a que gane mas clientes, ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de  variedad de medicamentos(paracetamol, neomelubrina, naproxeno, alcohol, gasas, agua oxigenada) y  cosméticos(perfumería, desodorantes, labiales, sombras, delineadores) para re surtir su negocio. 
Doña abigail esta muy contenta con su negocio ya que no solo le a ayudado a tener mejor calidad de vida sino que a podido contribuir con su comunidad brindando este servicio.

Doña abigail quiere en un futuro que sus hijos puedan estudiar una carrera profesional y a mediano plazo que su negocio continué creciendo y ganando mas clientes. 

los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Miriam venta de pan
Florinda venta de tacos 
Praxedis venta  de carne 
Juana venta de pollo 
Leticia venta de antojitos 
Diega venta de frutas y legumbres 
Dailen venta de bisuteria
Leticia venta de dulces
texts.en:
Abigail is another member of this group.  She’s 44-years-old and attended university.  She’s married to Julián and has two children who attend school.  She tells us that with her husband’s support she opened a small pharmacy in her community more than seven years ago with the purpose of providing a service to her people because since the community is small medicines were not sold there and one had to go outside of it to buy them.  In addition, she wanted to earn extra money to help her husband with household expenses.  

Her business has grown in the last few years and every day it’s better stocked; she’s started to sell cosmetics which has won over more customers.  She will use this loan to buy a variety of medicine (acetaminophen, sodium metamizol, naproxen, alcohol, gauze and hydrogen peroxide) and cosmetics (perfumery, deodorants, lipsticks, eye shadows and eye liners) to stock her business.

Abigail is very happy with her business because not only has it helped her have a better quality of life but she’s been able to contribute to her community by providing this service.

Abigail wants her children to study professional careers in the future and in the medium run that her business continues growing and winning over more customers.

The other group members are:

Miriam – sells bread
Florinda – sells tacos 
Praxedis - sells meat 
Juana – sells chicken
Leticia – sells fast-food 
Diega – sells fruit and vegetables 
Dailen – sells costume jewelry
Leticia – sells candy

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El señor Jose Luis  y su esposa dicidieron establecer su propio negocio de abarrotes para poder lidiar con los gastos basico de la casa asi como los recivos de luz, agua, gas entre otras cosas del hogar y lo mas importante sacar adelante a su hijo de edad escolar.

Con la idea de crecer su micronegocio, se estan enfrentando ante un obstaculo muy grande, el cual es no tener como hacer crecer su negocio, el tiene la esperanza de ver a su esposa feliz con su negocio bien establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose Luis and his wife decided to establish their own grocery business so that they could cope with basic household expenses such as electricity, water, gas, and other needs.  However, the most important need is to help their school-aged son get ahead.  

Jose Luis wants to grow his small business, but he is facing a very large obstacle.  He does not have what is needed to grow his business, but he hopes to see his wife happy and his business well-established.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to restock his store.

loans.name: La Guadalupana Group

texts.es:
La Guadalupana es un grupo integrdo por 8 mujeres emprenderoras: Adela vende antojitos; Nicolasa, carne; Elvira se dedica a la cría de cerdos; Rosa Elvira, a la venta de antojitos; Bernarda, a la venta de abarrotes; Rodolfa, a la venta de manualidades; Yessenia, a la venta de ropa y Maclovia, a la venta de antojitos. Este grupo está ubicado en una región productora de azúcar.

La señora Nicolasa tiene la edad de 43 años, estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria; está casada con el señor Amado quien es músico. La pareja tiene 3 hijos los cuales asisten a la escuela. Ella nos comenta que desde hace 3 años decidió iniciar a trabajar para porder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Inició vendiendo carne enchilada y longniza hace un poco más de 10 años y cosméticos hace cuatro años, sus ventas las realiza casa por casa ofreciendo su carne y mostrando su catálagos para levantar pedidos. Ella nos dice que aunque es un trabajo donde se debe caminar mucho, le gusta, ya que tiene la oportunidad de conocer más personas y hacer más clientes. Ella necesita este crédito para la compra de catálogos, lápiz labial, perfumes, desodorantes, delineador, maquillaje líquido, esmalte, carne y variedad de chiles. Doña Nicolasa espera que con esta inversión su negocio pospere pues desea darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
“La Guadalupana” is a group composed of 8 enterprising women.  Adela sells fast-food, Nicolasa meat, Elvira raises pigs, Rosa Elvira sells fast-food, Bernarda sells groceries, Rodolfa sells crafts, Yessenia sells clothes and Maclovia sells fast-food.  This group is located in a sugar producing region.

Nicolasa, 43, studied up to third year of secondary school.  She’s married to Amado who is a musician.  The couple has three children who attend school.  She tells us that three years ago she decided to start working to help her husband with household expenses.

She started out selling chili-seasoned meat and longaniza [sausage] a little more than ten years ago and cosmetics four years ago.  She sells house to house offering her meat and showing her catalogues to take orders.  She tells us that even though it is work that requires a lot of walking, she likes it because she gets to meet more people and acquire more customers.

She needs the loan to buy catalogues, lipstick, perfume, deodorant, eye liner, liquid make-up, nail polish, meat and a variety of chilies.  Nicolasa hopes that with this investment her business will prosper because she wants to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, meat and chilies.

loans.name: El Progreso (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El progreso es un gro integrado por 7 personas, ellos decidieron ponerle este nombre a su grupo ya que esperan que con este crédito sus negocios y la calidad de vida que ofrecen a sus familias progresen, el grupo esta ubicado en la comunidad de Vicente en la cual esta el ingenio La Margarita uno de los principales productores de azúcar de la región. Los integrantes del grupo son Maria de los Angeles club de nutrición, Patricia venta de abarrotes, Donaciano cría de Cerdos, Maria Elena venta de ropa, Genero cría de ganado, Herminia club de nutrición y Dora Luz venta de comida.

Patricia tiene la edad de 30 años, estudio la preparatoria y es soltera, ella platica que desde que dejo sus estudios a tenido que trabajar para poder ayudar con los gastos de su hogar pero hace un año con el apoyo de su familia decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes para tener un ingreso extra, su negocio esta ubicado en un pequeño local a orilla de la calle  en su casa, Ella dijo "inicie con los abarrotes porque es un negocio donde todos los días se vende y a pesar de que no se le gana mucho, va cayendo un poco de dinero para lo que haga falta y lo que mas se vende son los refrescos mas en este tiempo de calor "
Patricia utilizara su credito para comprar de Arroz, frijol, sopa, aceite, sal, azúcar, cloro, jabón, dulces, refrescos, papel higiénico y productos enlatados y resurtir su negocio.

Sus planes a futuro son seguir invirtiendo a su negocio para que día a día cresca mas y las ganancias aumenten.
texts.en:
"El progreso" ("The progress") is a communal bank comprised of seven people. They have decided to use this name for their group because they hope that with this loan there will be progress in their businesses and in their families' living conditions. The communal bank is located in the community of Vicente, where there's the La Margarita sugar mill, one of the main producers of sugar in the region. The group members are Maria de los Angeles, who runs a nutrition club, Patricia, who sells groceries, Donaciano, who raises pigs, Maria Elena, who sells clothing, Genero, who raises cattle, Herminia, who runs a nutrition club, and Dora Luz, who sells food.
Patricia is 30 years old and single. She finished high school and reports that ever since she stopped studying, she has had to work in order to help with her home expenses. A year ago, with support from her family, she decided to start her own business selling groceries in order to get an extra income. Her business is located in a small store on a street corner in her home. She says, "I started selling groceries because it's a business where you sell every day, and although you don't profit much, you get a little money for the things you need. What sells the most are refreshments, especially in this hot weather".
Patricia will use the loan to purchase rice, beans, soup, olive oil, salt, sugar, bleach, soap, candy, refreshments, toilet paper and canned goods, and to stock up her business.
Her future plan is to keep on investing in her business, so that it grows and gets higher profits every day.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, soup, olive oil, salt, sugar, bleach, soap, candy, refreshments, toilet paper and canned goods.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa es una mujer increíble, ha trabajado toda su vida para sacar adelante a su familia. Habita junto a su esposo en casa de su propiedad. Sus hijos emigraron a Estados Unidos en busca de una mejor calidad de vida, ya que sus  condiciones son muy sencillas y humildes. Junto a su esposo cultiva la tierra, año con año. Trabaja muy duro para poder cumplir las tareas del hogar y las tareas de la agricultura. Gracias a su trabajo y al ingreso que recibe de sus hijos, logra llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Es una mujer muy activa, trabajadora, responsable y generosa. Tiene buenas referencias en la zona donde habita ya que gracias a su carisma y buen desempeño en su trabajo ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchas personas. Debido a que la temporada para la siembra ya comenzó, y es necesario dar inicio a la siembra de los cereales que es su principal fuente de alimentación, solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para comenzar la siembra de maíz, dicha tarea implica comenzar a preparar la tierra e invertir en los insumos agrícolas necesarios (semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc.). Espera poder tener una cosecha 2012 abundante, que le permita cancelar la deuda y continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
María Teresa is an incredible woman who has worked her entire life to move her family forward. She and her husband live in their own home. Her children emigrated to the United States in search of a better quality of life since they came from very modest and humble conditions. María and her husband cultivate the land year after year. She works very hard to complete all of the household tasks and the farming chores. Thanks to her work and the remittances sent by her children, she is able to provide for the daily household needs. María is a very active, hardworking, responsible, and generous woman. She has good references from the area thanks to her charisma and the way she conducts her work. As a result, she has gained the trust of many people.

Since the planting season has started, María needs to begin sowing grains since they are her main source of food. She is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can begin planting corn. The task of preparing the land requires an investment in needed farming supplies (seeds, compost, insecticides, and other items). María hopes to have an abundant harvest in 2012 so that she can repay her debt and continue sustaining her household.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, insecticides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Flor De Campo Group

texts.es:
Doña Tomasa es uno de los integrantes del grupo Flor de campo, ella tiene la edad de 67  años, solo estudio hasta el tercer grado de primaria ya que sus padres pensaban que los hombres deberían de estudiar y las mujeres aprender hacer los trabajos del hogar, ella está casada con Federico. Doña Tomasa siempre ha buscado la manera de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar pero fue hasta hace 4 años que abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en un local que tiene en su casa, poco a poco su negocio ha crecido y ahora vende pollo por kilos  y ollas de barro, Doña Tomasa está contenta con su negocio ya que además de las ganancias que le deja le gusta estar en contacto con sus clientes, ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de jabón, cloro, sopa, frijol, arroz, pollos, productos enlatados, dulces y refrescos para resurtir su negocio. 
Ella desea a futuro que su tienda crezca y este mas surtida para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que buscan y sus ganancias aumenten.  

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Maria Blanca venta de abarrotes 
Alejandro venta de zapatos
Juana venta de pan 
Esteban venta de pan 
Rosa Antonia venta de lencería 
Leticia venta de zapatos
Paula venta de plantas
texts.en:
Tomasa is one of the members of the “Flor del Campo” (Flower of the Field) group.  She’s 67-years-old and only studied up to third grade in elementary school because her parents believed that boys should study and girls should learn how to do housework.  She’s married to Federico.  

Tomasa has always sought ways to help her husband with household expenses but it wasn’t until four years ago that she opened a small grocery store in a space she has at home.  Her business has gradually grown and now she sells chicken by the pound and clay pots.  

Tomasa is happy with her business because in addition to the profits it produces she likes to be in contact with her customers.  She will use this loan to buy soap, chlorine bleach, soup, beans, rice, chickens, canned goods, candy and soft-drinks to restock her store.

She hopes her store will grow in the future and will be better stocked so that her customers will always find what they are looking for and her profits will increase.

The other group members are:

María Blanca – sells groceries 
Alejandro – sells shoes
Juana – sells bread 
Esteban – sells bread
Rosa Antonia – sells lingerie 
Leticia – sells shoes
Paula – sells plants

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, salt, sugar, drinks, sweets, soap and canned foods

loans.name: Quetzal Group

texts.es: Pueblito tiene 28 años de edad es originaria de una comunidad llamada de Pueblo Nuevo y pertenece al grupo Quetzal y dice que a uno de sus compañeros del grupo se le ocurrió ese nombre ya que es una ave muy bonita y por eso le pusieron así. Platica que su nombre no es muy común y dice que le pusieron ese nombre por una virgen que es venerada en su comunidad llamada la virgen del pueblito. Ella es madre soltera y tiene dos niños los cuales estudian la primaria y tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace  mas de 3 años, dice que puso su tienda para sacar adelante a sus  hijos y a su mama ya que dependen de ella. Dice que ella surte los artículos que vende en su tienda en diferentes tiendas de una población cercana a su localidad. Dice que está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de aceite, cerillos, jabón, leche, huevo, azúcar, sal, harina, refrescos, dulces, sopas instantáneas, café, focos, rastrillos, frijoles, papel de baño, servilletas etc. Dice que el crédito le servirá de mucho ya que podrá tener bien surtida su tienda de abarrotes y así podrá tener más clientela, la meta que tiene Pueblito es ampliar su local para seguir metiendo mas producto a su tienda para así obtener más ganancias. Los otros nueve integrantes del grupo se llaman Anastasia, Nancy, Alejandra, Gonzalo, Maribel, Noheli Alejandra, José Luis, Maricela y Virginia ellos invertirán en insumos para hacer antojitos mexicanos que venden por las noches, en ropa para dama, caballero para venderla, también se invertirán en zapatos por catalogo, en insumos para hacer pan, en artículos para surtir tienda de abarrotes, en bisutería para venta, en helados para vender y material para hacer bordados artesanales para su venta.
texts.en:
Pueblito is 28 years old.  She is from a community called Pueblo Nuevo and belongs to the Quetzal group.  She says that one of her fellow group members decided to name the group after the quetzal because it is a very beautiful bird.  Pueblito says that her name isn't very common and that she was given the name in honor of a virgin who is worshiped in her community (La virgen del pueblito). 

Pueblito is a single mother.  She has two children who are in elementary school and a grocery store which she has been running for more than three years.  She says that she set up the store in order to provide for her children and her mom as they are dependent on her.  She says that she stocks up with the products that she sells in her store in different stores in a nearby town.  She is requesting a loan to buy oil, matches, soap, milk, eggs, sugar, salt, flour, soft drinks, sweet treats, instant soups, coffee, light bulbs, razors, beans, toilet paper, napkins etc.  She says that the loan will be very useful because she will be able to have more products available in her store and thereby make more profits.

The other nine members of this group are called Anastasia, Nancy, Alejandra, Gonzalo, Maribel, Noheli Alejandra, José Luis, Maricela and Virginia.  They will invest in buying supplies for making Mexican snack food which they sell in the evenings, men's and women's clothing, shoes from a catalog, supplies for making bread, items to stock a grocery store, costume jewelry, iced treats and material for making embroidered items to sell.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store with products such as oil, matches, soap, milk, eggs, sugar, salt, flour, soft drinks, sweet treats, instant soups, coffee, light bulbs, razors, beans, toilet paper, napkins, etc.

loans.name: J Manuel

texts.es:
EL sr. Manuel es muy entusiasta y emprendedor  se dedica al negocio de la panaderia, pasteleria, venta de nieves y por si eso fuera poco tambien se ejerce como contador en servicios particulares. El explota su potencial a favor de su familia ya que daria toda su fuerza  por el bienestar de los que lo quieren, invierte mucho tiempo en sus negocios, pero se ha dado cuenta que le falta cosas a sus negocios necesita esa ayuda para dar el bienestar que su familia merece. 
Actualmente esta separado pero sostiene economicamnete a sus dos hijos de edad escolar.
texts.en:
Sr. Manuel is enthusiastic and enterprising.  He manages a bakery, a pastry shop, and a snow cone business.  On top of that, he also offers his services as a freelance accountant.  He makes good use of his potential in favor of his family and puts forth all of his effort so that they will have what they need to maintain their well-being.  For this reason, Manuel invests a lot of his time into his businesses.  However, his businesses lack a few necessary items that are required for him to provide his family with what they deserve.  

Manuel is currently separated from his wife, but he provides financial support for his two school-age children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his bakery, pastry shop, and snow cone businesses.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Don Miguel tiene 76 años de edad y desde que tenía 10 años sus hermanos le enseñaron todo lo relacionado con el cultivo del café por lo que tiene mucha experiencia. A pesar de su edad goza de buena salud y se encarga él mismo de realizar la mayor parte de actividades en su finca, aunque también lo ayudan sus hijos y durante la época de cosecha que hay más trabajo contrata personal para poder darse abasto. Actualmente está produciendo un total de 28 toneladas, las cuales entrega a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” para que sea procesado y exportado. Don Miguel necesita comprar abono orgánico para sus plantas, pues no utiliza fertilizantes ni productos químicos ya que dañan el medio ambiente y esta solicitando un crédito. Una de las metas a futuro que tiene Don Miguel es comprar otro terreno para poder aumentar su producción y de esta manera mejorar su nivel de vida, además que en un futuro podrá dejarle algo a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miguel is 76-years-old and when he was ten-years-old his brothers taught him everything related to growing coffee so he has much experience.  Despite his age, he enjoys good health and he does most of the work in his farm himself although his children help him too and during harvest time when there is more work to do he hires day laborers to be able to handle it all.

He’s currently producing a total of 28 tons that he delivers to “Unión Regional de Huatusco” [coffee cooperative] to be processed and exported.  Miguel needs to buy organic manure for his plants because he does not use fertilizers or other chemical products because they damage the environment so he’s asking for a loan.

One of Miguel’s future goals is to buy another parcel of land to increase production and improve his standard of living this way in addition to being able to leave something to his children in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his coffee plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his coffee.

loans.name: Solidarios Group

texts.es:
Edhit cuenta con 36 años de edad, está casada con el eñor Narciso quien es comerciante y se  ayudan entre si en el mismo negocio tienen cuatro  hijos la más grande se llama Nayeli tiene 10 años  cursa el 5° de primaria, Michelle tiene 8 años y cursa3° de primaria, Estefania tiene6 años y cursa 1° de prmaria y el más chiquito cursa el 1° de preescolar, tiene 3 años.
Edhit es comerciante y se dedica al comercio lo cual junto con sdu esposo tienen un negocio de productos naturistas comoson ls pastilllas para desimflamar, vitaminas, calcio entre otras cosas, con él tienen un poco más de cinco años y pues cuentan que cada quince dias tienen que surtir su negocio, y piensan invertir su préstamo en más productos ya que necesitan sacar a delante a sus cuatro hijos a concluir con sus estudios, ella nos cuenta que este préstamo le benefia n mucho como se menciona anteriormente el maximo apoyo es l que necesitan lo niños de susu padres y mientras tanto Edhit quiere hacer más grande su negocio.
Edhit es una de las integrantes del grupo “SOLIDARIO” que esta integrado por 9 mujeres y 2 hombres trabajadores que etan dispuestos a sacar adelante a sus familias a continuacion se mencionaran cada unos de los integrantes y la variedad de actividades a las qe se dedican  y ellos son: Saul tiene un taxi local, Luz Maria vende frutas y verduras, Edhit vende productos naturistas, MA de los angeles vende productos de abarrotes, Honoria tiene una carpinteria, Leticia vende Jugos de frutas naturales, Eugenio vende productos de abarrotes, Mercedes vende productos de abarrotes, Emilia vende perfumes, Ana vende comida, y Margarita también vende comida.
texts.en:
Edhit is 36 years old. She's married to Narciso, who's in retail, and they support each other in the same business. They have four children - the oldest is 10-year-old Nayeli, who's in the 5th year of primary school; 8-year-old Michelle is in the 3rd year of primary school; 6-year-old Estefania is in the first year of primary school; and the youngest one is 3 years old and in the first year of preschool.
Edhit is in the retail business. Along with her husband she owns a business selling natural products such as anti-inflammatory tablets, vitamins, calcium, among other items. They have been in this business for a little over five years and they report that they need to stock up every 15 days. They intend to use the loan for more merchandise, since they need to get their four children ahead and have them finish their studies. She tells us that this loan will benefit her a lot, and as previously stated, what the children need from their parents is the greatest support possible. Meanwhile, Edhit wants to expand her business. 
Edhit is one of the member of the "Solidario" ("Supportive") communal bank, which is comprised of nine women and two men, all hardworking people willing to get their families ahead. What follows is each of the members and the various businesses they're in: Saul drives a local taxi; Luz Maria selles fruits and vegetables; Edhit sells natural products; MA de los Angeles sells groceries; Honoria owns a carpenter shop; Leticia sells natural fruit juices; Eugenio sells groceries; Mercedes sells groceries; Emilia sells perfumes; Ana sells food; and Margarita also sells food.

loans.use: to purchase natural products, such as vitamins and other healing medicine.

loans.name: Las Turquesas Group

texts.es:
El grupo  se llama Las Turquesas y se integra de cinco personas: cuatro mujeres y un hombre; todos ellos viven en un pueblo llamado Tecpatan en donde celebran la fiesta de San Marcos el  25 de abril.

Mirsa Nayhelli quien es soltera  y vive con sus padres, ella estudia el sexto semestre de bachillerato por las tardes; está muy contenta porque está por entrar a la universidad.

Ella solicito el préstamo  para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para elaborar tamales, arroz con leche y café en donde lleva trabajando cinco años y comenta que le va bien ya que estudia por las tardes y por las mañanas apoya a su mamá con el negocio. Inició con esta actividad para poyar a su mamá, pero también para tener sus propios ingresos y así poder pagar los gastos que se generan en su educación y no sea solo su mamá quien lleve esos gastos. Lo que desea para el futuro es que con esta pequeña actividad y el préstamo pueda seguir trabajando ahora que salga de la escuela, estudiar los fines de semana mientras trabaja los demás días mientras siga ganando sus ingresos para poder pagar los útiles que le pidan.

Quienes integran en el grupo son: Vila quien invertirá en la compra y venta de telas para la elaboración de ropas, don Javier Inocencio invertirá en la compra de bonetería y mercería, Jessica Yaneth invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para elaborar comidas y, finalmente, la señora Yolanda quien invertirá en la compra y venta de marranos.
texts.en:
The group "Las Turquesas" is made up of four women and one man.  They all live in a village called Tecpatan, where the festival of San Marcos is celebrated on the 25th of April.

Mirsa Nayhelli is single and lives with her parents.  She is in the sixth semester of high school, which she attends in the afternoons.  She is very happy because she is about to start her university studies.

She is seeking this loan to purchase ingredients to make tamales, rice pudding, and coffee.  She has been selling these items for five years and says that it is working out well.  In the afternoons she studies, and in the mornings she works in her business to support her mother.  She started this activity to support her mother, and also to be able to make her own income to pay for her educational expenses so that her mother would not have to bare these expenses on her own.  What she wants for the future is to be able to continue working now that she is graduating from high school, and to study on the weekends while she is working during the week.  This way she will keep making her own income to be able to pay her university fees.

The remaining members of the group are Vila, who will purchase cloth to make clothing; don Javier Inocencio, who will invest in men's accessories for resale; Jessica Yaneth who will buy ingredients to make food, and finally, Yolanda, who will use her portion of the loan proceeds in her business buying and selling pigs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales and other items.

loans.name: Erenia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Erenia es una mujer emprendedora en su comunidad, se dedica al negocio diversos , del que tiene más de 6 años de ejercerlos, es casada vive con su familia solo tiene un hijo a su cargo el que tiene que darles las condiciones necesaria para su desarrollo, su esposo también labora en una empresa de la misma comunidad lo que le favorece en las ventas de sus productos,  actualmente la señora Erenia tiene una necesidad urgente de cerrar con tapia su casa ya que en este tiempo lluvioso, se le ha inundado del terreno vecino que es un poco más alto, dicho financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de materiales de construcción como: Piedra Cantera, Cemento, Arena, Varilla de Hierro Corrugado, Varilla Lisa y Mano de Obra Para mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de Vida.
texts.en:
Erenia is an enterprising woman in her community; she carries out a variety of businesses that she’s been in for more than six years.  She’s married and lives with her family; she only has one son still in her care that she needs to give the conditions necessary for his development to.  Her husband also works for a firm in the same community which is favorable for the sales of her products.

Erenia currently has the urgent need to close off her house with walls because during the rains the adjacent property floods because it’s a bit higher.  She needs the loan to buy building materials and supplies like: paving stones, cement, sand, rebar, corrugated and smooth rebar and to pay labor costs to improve her conditions and her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Gabriel Arcangel

texts.es:
Gabriel tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres y un hermano. Desde muy pequeño su papá le enseño a trabajar ya que son pobres y no pueden continuar sus estudios y deben dedicarse al trabajo. Él se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. ha ordeñar unas dos vacas que tiene su papá, luego se toma una taza de café, posteriormente se dirige a dejar las vacas y quedarse trabajando en el terreno; pues a él le gusta llegar muy temprano para aprovechar el tiempo y luego se regresa a la 1:00 p.m. a descansar un momento para alimentar su vacas después.

Para comprar los insumos Gabriel debe caminar durante treinta y cinco minutos para abordar un autobús que lo conduce a la ciudad, el autobús tarda cincuenta minutos en llegar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar una bolsa de semilla, dos sacos de fertilizantes, un litro de herbicida. De esta forma él podrá sembrar ya que el invierno ya llego y si hay siembra hay esperanza de tener maíz para su comida y la de sus pollos. 

Él desea trabajar muy fuerte y ahorrar, pues él comenta que desea sembrar más cantidad de tierra, casarse para formar su propia familia, tener su casa ya que vive con sus padres.
texts.en:
Gabriel, 23, is single living with his parents and a brother.  Since he was little his father taught him how to work because they are poor and can’t continue with their studies but must start working.  

He rises at 4:30am to milk two cows his father has and then he drinks a cup of coffee.  Later the heads out to leave the cows and he stays to work the field because he likes to get there early to use his time efficiently and then he returns at 1pm to rest a little and then go out to feed the cows. To buy supplies, Gabriel must walk for thirty-five minutes to catch the bus that takes him to the city and the bus takes fifty minutes to arrive.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy a bag of seeds, two bags of fertilizer and a liter of herbicide.  In this way he will be able to plant because winter has arrived and if there are crops, there is hope of having corn to eat and to feed his chickens.

He wants to work hard and to save because he comments that he wants to plant more land to get married and form his own family and to have a house of his own since he lives with his parents.

loans.use: to buy a bag of seeds, two bags of fertilizer and a liter of herbicide.

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero. Él inicio a trabajar en la agricultura desde la edad de los siete años, debido a que sus padres eran muy pobres, por lo que tenían que enseñarles a sus hijos a trabajar. Actualmente vive son sus padres, Edwin se levanta muy temprano a ordeñar las vacas, luego se toma una taza de café, para ir a dejar sus vacas al terreno que esta a treinta minutos de su casa a pie y aprovecha quedarse trabajando ahí durante siete horas. A la 1:00 p.m. regresa a la casa a descansar un momento, luego debe regresar a traer las vacas al terreno. Él manifiesta que su deseo es trabajar para que no falte nada en el hogar.

Para comprar los insumos que necesita, Edwin debe abordar un autobús que lo conduce a la ciudad teniendo que bajar una colina y tarda unos veinticinco minutos, para luego abordar el autobús que lo conduce al pueblo, el autobús tarda unos cincuenta minutos para llegar y luego de regreso.

El préstamo que esta solicitando Edwin a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar una bolsa de semilla, dos sacos de fertilizantes, un litro de herbicidas y la otra parte para pago de mano de obra y de tractor. De esta forma él podrá sembrar ya que logro reunir el dinero para pagar el alquiler de la tierra, pero no le alcanza para comprar los insumos por eso solicito el crédito y esta muy agradecido con la Fundación por el apoyo, ya que sin el dinero no puede sembrar y sino siembra no tendrá para el sustento de su familia mucho menos para vender. 

Edwin desea trabajar muy fuerte y ahorrar, pues sueña encontrar una esposa y tener su propia familia, además desea construir su casa, debido a que vive con sus padres.
texts.en:
Edwin is 31 years old and single.  He started working in agriculture when he was seven years old as his parents were very poor and so had to teach their children to work.  Edwin currently lives with his parents.  He gets up very early each morning in order to milk his cows.  He has a cup of coffee and then takes the cows to a plot of land which is a 30 minute walk from his home.  He makes the most of this trip and works there for seven hours.  At 1.00pm, he returns home to rest a while, then goes back to bring his cows home.  He says that wants to work so that the members of his household don't want for anything.

In order to buy the supplies he needs, Edwin must take a bus to the city.  He has to walk downhill for 25 minutes then catch the bus that will take him to the city.  The bus journey takes 50 minutes each way.

Edwin is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy a bag of seed, two sacks of fertilizer and one liter of herbicides.  He will use the rest to pay for laborers and use of a tractor.  This will enable him to sow his crops as he managed to put together the money he needed to pay for the rental of his land but didn't have enough left to buy supplies.  This is why he requested the loan.  He is very grateful to Fundación Campo for their support because without the money he couldn't sow his crops.  If he couldn't sow his crops, he wouldn't be have enough food to feed his family, let alone enough to sell.

Edwin would like to work very hard and save because he dreams of finding a wife and starting his own family.  He would also like to build his own home as he currently lives with his parents.

loans.use: to buy a bag of seed, two sacks of fertilizer and one liter of herbicides.  He will also pay for laborers and a tractor to prepare his land

loans.name: Luis Tovias

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 50 años casado con María de 46 años. A pesar de tener 4 hijos únicamente viven con uno de ellos ya que los otros tres ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Reside en "San Miguel de Los Bancos" que es que es un cantón rural de la Provincia de Pichincha, donde se encuentra la capital del Ecuador. Uno de los principales recursos "Los Bancos" es el hídrico ya que  en su territorio se originan un sin número de riachuelos y pequeñas vertientes que dan paso a ríos de considerable tamaño. Este cantón tiene un gran movimiento comercial que se desenvuelve en la calle principal, donde se encuentran hoteles, restaurantes y almacenes, sobre todo de productos agropecuarios, así como servicios veterinarios y tiendas para el consumo diario de la población.

Mientras su esposa es ama de casa, Luis trabaja criando pollos para luego venderlos y de esta manera sustenta su hogar. Trabaja aproximadamente 12 horas al día y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es transportar los pollos cuando estos ya van a ser vendidos. Luis desea invertir en la compra de pollos bebé, quiere hacer una buena inversión que incremente sus ingresos y así mejorar su estilo de vida. La ampliación de este negocio es un paso más para cumplir sus anhelos de tener a su familia en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Luis, 50 years old, is married to María who is 46 years old. Despite having 4 children only one lives with them, the other 3 are adults and independent. He lives in San Miguel de los Bancos which is a rural canton in the province of Pichincha, where the capital of Ecuador can be found. One of the main resources of los Bancos is the water which originates in its territory including a large number of brooks and little springs that lead to rivers of considerable size. This canton has a a large, buoyant commercial movement in the main street, where the hotels, restaurants and stores can be found, especially agricultural and veterinary services and stores for the daily needs of the residents.

While his wife takes care of the house, Luis works raising chickens in order to sell them later and this is how he supports the household. He works approximately 12 hours a day and what he considers the most difficult part of his work is transporting the chickens when they are going to be sold. Luis wants to invest in the purchase of baby chickens, he wants to make a good investment to increase his income and thus improve his lifestyle. The expansion of this business is a step towards fulfilling his longing to improve conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus tres hermanos varones de 18, 15 y 12 años de edad respectivamente, ya que su mamá falleció hace siete meses y él es el responsable de ellos por ser el mayor. Pues su padrastro ha los cuatro meses de fallecida la señora se volvió ha casar. Por lo que Edwin manifiesta que es su obligación sacar adelante a sus hermanos. Él comenta que su sueño es trabajar y ver crecer a sus hermanos. Desde los ocho años de edad él empezó a trabajar con su padrastro en la agricultura, hoy que ha quedado solo agradece a su padrastro por haberle enseñado el trabajo. Edwin se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. ha preparar la comida de sus hermanos, luego se dirige al lugar donde trabaja durante siete horas para luego regresar a su casa. 

Para comprar los insumos que necesita, Edwin debe caminar durante diez minutos para abordar un autobús que lo conduce a la ciudad, el autobús tarda cuarenta y cinco minutos en llegar. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando Edwin a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar una bolsa de semilla, dos sacos de fertilizantes, un litro de herbicidas para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de tierra. De esta forma él podrá sembrar ya que el invierno ya llego y la tierra esta lista para la siembra. Así habrá maíz para su comida y también para los pollos que tiene.  

Edwin desea trabajar muy fuerte y ahorrar, pues él comenta que en los próximos años si Dios le da vida planea sembrar más de lo que hace hoy en día. Además, desea casarse y formar su propia familia, construir su casa.
texts.en:
Edwin, 20, is single living with his three brothers who are 18, 15 and 12 years old respectively since his mother died seven months ago and he’s responsible for them because he’s the oldest and his step-father remarried four months after his mother died which is why Edwin states that it’s his obligation to move his brothers forward.  He comments that his dream is to work and to see his brothers grow.  

He started working in agriculture with his step-father at the age of 8 and now that he’s been left alone he’s grateful to his step-father for having taught him the work.  Edwin rises at 4:30am to prepare food for his brothers and then heads out to the place where he works for seven hours to then return home.  To buy the supplies he needs, Edwin has to make a ten-minute walk to catch a bus that takes him to the city; the bus takes forty-five minutes to arrive.

The loan that Edwin is asking Fundación Campo for is to buy a bag of seeds, two bags of fertilizer and a liter of herbicide to plant 7,000 square meters of land.  In this way he will be able to plant since winter has arrived and the soil is ready to be planted.  In this way there will be corn for his food and also for the chickens he has.

Edwin wants to work very hard and to save because he comments that in the next few years if God grants him life he plans to plant more than he does at present.  Besides, he’d like to get married and form his own family and to build his house.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Doña Blanca tiene 34 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de mariscos, ella aprendió junto con su esposo ya que él se dedica a la pesca artesanal. Su esposo es el que pesca los mariscos y ella lo esta esperando en la laguna, deposita los mariscos en huacales y después se traslada a distintos lugares para venderlos ella lo hace a pie y luego se traslada en autobús hacia otro lugar más lejano. 

Ella esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar una lancha y un motor para aumentar la pesca artesanal por parte de su esposo. De esta manera podrán cubrir las necesidades alimenticias de su familia, brindarles la educación a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca is 34 years old. She has a live-in partner and three children. For the past 12 years she has been selling shellfish. She learned it from her husband, who's an artisan fisherman. Her husband does the fishing and she waits for him by the lagoon. She puts the shellfish in crates and then travels to various places in order to sell them. She travels on foot and then takes the bus to a more distant place.
She requests the loan from Fundación Campo so that she can purchase a motorboat and a motor in order to increase her husband's artisan fishing. That way they will be able to pay for their family's food, provide education for their children and improve their home.

loans.use: to purchase a motorboat and a motor in order to increase her husband's artisan fishing.

loans.name: Alfredo Jose

texts.es: Alfredo José  de 37 años de edad. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general.  el tiene mucha experiencia  en esta actividad. Inicio por la necesidad de tener una herramienta de trabajo y por apoyar a su padre en el negocio que ya no podía seguir en el negocio, en la actualidad ha demostrado ser responsable, trabajador, con solvencia de pago, el está solicitando el financiamiento para la compra de mercadería para ofrecerle a sus clientes, y aprovecha la temporada de la celebración del día de las madres en nuestro país  lo cual ha tenido mucha demanda de su clientela los productos son:   calzado, perfumes, cosméticos, cremas faciales , ropa de hombre y mujer
texts.en: Alfredo José is 37 years old. His financial activity is the sale of general merchandise. He has a lot of experience in this activity. He began through the necessity of having a working tool and to support his father in the business as he could no longer continue in the business. Currently he has shown himself to be responsible, hardworking, and creditworthy. He is asking for a loan in order to buy merchandise in order to sell to his customers, and to take advantage of the Mother’s Day celebration season in our country which has had a large demand from his clients for products such as: shoes, perfume, cosmetics, facial creams, and clothing for men and women.

loans.use: to buy shoes, perfume, cosmetics, facial creams, and clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Marjorie Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Marjorie es una señora emprendedora de una comarca de larreynaga malpaisillo, su actividad principal es el alquiler de mesas, sillas plásticas, manteles y Bandejas, también convina la venta  de cosméticos, su núcleo familiar está conformado por sus 2 niños los que estudian en el colegio de la comunidad a los que tiene el derecho de mantener y proporcionarles las condiciones para su desarrollo, una de las necesidades importante de crecimiento de su negocio en cuanto a la demanda que la señora Marjorie tiene es el incremento de mesas plásticas.
Por tal razón tomo la decisión de visitar las oficinas de ceprodel, con el objetivo de ser beneficiada con un financiamiento y de esa manera lograr su objetivo de su negocio para mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida para su familia.
Ya que dicho financiamiento lo invertiría en compra de mesas plásticas y manteles y a si incrementar  los niveles de venta.
texts.en:
Marjorie is an enterprising woman from Larreynaga, Malpaisillo.  Her main activity is renting tables, plastic chairs, tablecloths and trays.  She also combines selling cosmetics.  Her nuclear family is composed of her two children who attend school in the community and who she has the right to support and provide with growth conditions.   One of the important needs her business has in order to grow is an increase in the number of plastic tables.

Because of this she’s decided to visit the Ceprodel offices with the goal of being benefited with a loan that will allow her to reach her business goal to improve her conditions and her family’s standard of living because said loan will be invested in the purchase of plastic tables and tablecloths to thus increase her sales levels.

loans.use: to buy plastic tables and tablecloths for her rental business.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
El trabajo de educación requiere de mucho sacrificio y seguimiento en la enseñanza aprendizaje. Consciente de esto,  la señora Martha se dedica a laborar como maestra de Primaria en un colegio del  municipio de Telica atendiendo niños de varias edades y cuya preocupación principal es la educación en estas personas ya que son el futuro de la nación.

Ella acude a Ceprodel porque requiere solicitar un crédito para el mejoramiento de su humilde vivienda y Reparación de su Dentadura, para ello comprará Bloques, Cemento, Perlin Y puerta. Esto con el fin de iniciar el mejoramiento de su vivienda que tanto lo requiere para beneficio propio y familiar.
texts.en:
Working in education requires much sacrifice and follow-up with teaching/learning.  Conscious of this, Martha works as an elementary school teacher in a school in Telica teaching children of various ages.  Her main concern is the education of these people who are the nation’s future.

She calls on Ceprodel because she needs to request a loan to do some improvements to her humble abode and to repair her teeth.  To do so, she will buy concrete blocks, cement, purlins and a door hoping to start improving her dwelling that she so needs for her and her family’s benefit.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothes and to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Las Nuevas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Nuevas conformada por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María de los Ángeles de 34 años, casada y tiene una pequeña de un año de edad. Ella  tiene una fritanga y vende refresco negocio que inicio hace 15 años realizando tajadas con queso poco a poco fue aumentándolo comprando mesas y sillas. Con el crédito anterior logro comprar dos cocinas que necesitaba y unas mesas.
Ella invertirá el crédito en productos para el negocio y con las ganancias desea mejorar su vivienda.
Las otras integrantes son María Teresa quien vende recargas, perfumes, cosméticos y ropa desde hace 4 años y María Ivania quien tiene una joyería desde hace 30 años.
texts.en:
The “Las Nuevas” (The New Ones) is composed of three hardworking, enterprising people.  One of them is María de los Ángeles, 34.  She’s married and has a little one-year-old daughter.  She sells fried fast-food and soft-drinks, a business she started 15 years ago selling fried plantain with cheese.  She gradually increased it buying tables and chairs.  With the previous loan she managed to buy two stoves that she needed and some tables.  She will use this loan to buy products for the business and wants to use profits to do some home improvements.

The other group members are María Teresa who has sold mobile phone recharges, perfume, cosmetics and clothes for four years and María Ivania who has had a jewelry store for 30 years.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: La Rutina Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Rutina lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras la coordinadora es Elizabeth, casada y tiene tres hijos de 12, 8 y 6 años de edad. Ella tiene una pulpería desde hace 4 años la cual inicio con ayuda de su marido.
Los otros integrantes son Jahiro quien vende productos variados desde cosméticos, productos de baños, gafas, gorras y bisutería desde hace 3 años, Juan de 57 años tiene un taller de mecánica, enderezado y pintura y Jesica quien tiene una pulpería hace 2 años.
texts.en: The group, "La Rutina" is made up of four hard-working and enterprising people.  Their coordinator is Elizabeth, who is married and has three children, who are 12, 8, and 6.  She has had a small grocery store for 4 years, which she started with the help of her husband.  The other members are Jahiro, who has sold various products such as cosmetics, toiletries, sunglasses, hats, and costume jewelry for 3 years; Juan, who is 57 and has a mechanics, body, and paint shop; and Jesica, who has had a grocery store for 2 years.

loans.use: to buy staple grains and snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, tiene la edad  de 52 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo e hija  actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar  una maquina de limpiar café y algunas fumigaciones  y ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella tiene pensado comprar  esta  máquina para limpiar el monte del café para que se mantenga en excelentes condiciones y hacerlo de una forma más ágil y rápida  y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Lidia is 52 years old, married and currently lives with her husband and daughter. She intends to use the loan to buy a machine to clean her coffee fields, pay for some fumigation and for labor costs.

She plans to buy this machine that will weed her coffee in a more agile and quicker manner, thereby maintaining it in excellent condition, so that she can generate more profits and obtain a better quality of life and economic stability.  This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans before from state banks. Instead FUDECOSUR easily provided her with this loan and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to clean her coffee fields.

loans.name: Santa Catarina Group

texts.es: La señora Fulgencia tiene 35 años de edad y vive en unión libre el elabora y vende obleas, ella tiene 4 hijos 3 mujeres y un varón mayor de edad ya trabaja, dos de sus hijas están estudiando una la normal y otra la secundaria,  ella vende obleas, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar obleas, ella las recorta en diferentes tamaños, ella inicio su negocio hace 15 años por necesidad ya que no había trabajo en el campo, ella aprendió viendo como trabajaban sus vecinos, su negocio es importante porque de ahí saca para comer y para los gastos de la casa y de la escuela de sus hijas, a ella le gusta este negocio  y se siente orgullosa que gracias a su negocio no le falta nada, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan a trabajar en su negocio. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que siga creciendo el negocio y que no falte para los gastos de sus estudios de sus hijos y que logren sus sueños. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y Visión Fund “les agradecemos mucho sus préstamos, pues es una ayuda muy necesaria que nos ayuda a crecer los negocios”.
texts.en:
Fulgencia, 35, lives in a common law relationship and she makes and sells wafers.  She has four children, three girls and one boy who is an adult and is already working.  Two of her daughters are studying, one in normal school and one in secondary school.

She sells wafers and asked for the loan to buy wafers.  She cuts them into various sizes and started the business 15 years ago because of need since there was no field work available.  She learned by watching how her neighbors worked.  Her business is important because it produces income so she can eat and cover household expenses and her daughters’ schooling costs.  She likes this business because she feels proud that thanks to her business they lack nothing; her children and her husband help her work in her business.

Her dreams and hopes are that the business continues to grow and that she won’t lack money to pay for her children’s schooling and that they reach their dreams.  She wants to say to Kiva and to Visión Fund: “we are very grateful to you for our loans because it’s a much needed help that helps us grow in our businesses.”

loans.use: to buy wafers.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 36 años de edad y pertenece a un grupo llamado "Las Divinas". El nombre lo eligieron porque las integrantes se consideran muy buenas personas y agradables. 

Victoria se dedica a la venta de colchas, sábanas, toallas por catalogo, edredones, cobertores y cortinas; dice que tiene con este negocio hace mas de 5 años y lo emprendió para poder mantener a su hijo ya que es madre soltera. A diario, ella sale a las calles de su población y de otras poblaciones a vender sus colchas por catálogo pero más que nada le vende a personas que sabe son pagadoras ya que sus colchas las vende en pagos para que no se le haga pesado a sus clientas. Victoria compre lo que le piden sus clientas en una tienda de México DF y a veces también en la ciudad de Moroleón ya que ahí le dan precios mas bajos. Victoria está pidiendo un crédito para surtirse de colchas y sábanas que es lo que más vende en temporada de calor, aunque también quisiera vender más adelante ropa para dama ya que es uno de sus sueños y dice que pronto lo logrará. 

Las otras tres integrantes del grupo se llaman Rosalinda, María Guadalupe y Dora Elia. Ellas invertirán sus créditos en la compra de material para hacer bordados artesanales, en productos naturistas y en cosméticos de catalogo.
texts.en:
Victoria is 36 years old and belongs to a group called "The Divines". The name was chosen because the members are considered very good people and nice.

Victoria sells quilts, sheets, towels, bedspreads and curtains by catalog. She said she has had the business for over 5 years and undertook it to support her child as a single mother. Every day she takes to the streets in the community, and other nearby townships, to sell her quilts by catalog. She mainly sells to people whom she knows and will pay because her quilts are sold on payment plans, so that the cost is not so pressing on her clients. Victoria buys what her clients ask for at a store in Mexico city and sometimes also in the city of Moroleón, as there are lower prices. Victoria is requesting a loan to stock up on blankets and sheets, as they are the top sellers in the warmer weather.  In the future she would like to sell women’s clothing as well, as it is one of her dreams, and she said she soon will achieve it. 

The other three team members are called Rosalinda, Maria Guadalupe and Dora Elia. They invest their loans in the purchase of material for embroidery crafts, natural products and cosmetics catalog.

loans.use: purchase of blankets, sheets, towels, curtains etc for resale.

loans.name: Noche Mexicana Group

texts.es: Las integrantes del grupo siguen en la actividad que vienen desarrollando. La señora Alicia tiene 40 años de edad, ella estudio hasta la secundaria, ella es mama soltera, ella tiene 3 hijos 1 niña pequeña y 2 varones que estudian la primaria. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Visión Fund “gracias por ayudarnos a salir adelante y que sigan ayudando a las personas que más lo necesitan”. Ella tiene un taller de costura, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar telas, hilos, cierres para surtir su taller y tener todo lo necesario para confeccionar los uniformes de policía, ella inicio su negocio hace 15 años, por necesidad su hermana le enseño a confeccionar los uniformes,  ella fue ahorrando y compro 2 maquinas rectas y una ovar, su negocio es importante porque de ahí saca a sus hijos adelante, ella se siente orgullosa cuando ve su producción terminada y ve que los uniformes y trajes de bailables le quedaron bonitos y sus clientes quedan satisfechos con su trabajo, ella utiliza las ganancias para la comida, para vestir a sus hijos y para alimento para sus cerdos,  ella está planeando comprar una maquina bordadora de logotipos y lo piensa lograr ahorrando y con prestamos. Sus sueños y esperanzas son tener un taller grande y darles trabajo a otras mujeres de su comunidad, que sus hijos estudien y logren una carrera.
texts.en: The members of this group continue with their work that they are developing.  Señora Alicia is 40 and studied until secondary school.  She is a single mother with three children:  one small girl and two boys who are in elementary school.  The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Visión Fund, "thanks for helping us get ahead and keep supporing the people who need it most."  She has a sewing shop.  She requested her loan to buy fabric, thread, and zippers to supply her shop and have everything necessary to make police uniforms.  She started this business 15 years ago out of need.  Her sister showed her how to make the uniforms.  She went along saving money and bought three sewing machines.  Her business is important because this is how she takes good care of her children.  She feels proud when she sees her finished products, that the uniforms and dance outfits turned out nicely, and that her customers are satisfied with her work.  She uses her profits to buy food, clothing for her children, and feed for her pigs.  She is planning to buy an embroidery machine to make logotypes, which she will buy with her savings and with loans.  Her hopes and dreams are to have a large shop, to give jobs to other women in her community, and that her children study and have careers.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and zippers for her clothing shop.

loans.name: Yari

texts.es:
Yari es una joven de 18 años, soltera, vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Chincha, a pesar de su corta edad ella es una joven emprendedora con muchos deseos de superación; en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones prepara un riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa con Wantan Frito” para compartir un delicioso almuerzo con su familia; con enero culminó sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero sueña con poder hacerlo en el futuro. 
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su familia, Yari se dedica a trabajar en su negocio de venta de comida y golosinas en 2 centros educativos de su ciudad, ella cuenta con un kiosko en el cual realiza sus ventas, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 8 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender hasta 120 clientes entre estudiantes y profesores; ella cree que su negocio marcha bien, debido a su rica sazón y buena atención.
Yari se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una exhibidora y un horno eléctrico, los cuales le servirán de mucha ayuda en su negocio; de esta manera Yari espera poder incrementar sus ingresos, los cuales le servirán para poder iniciar sus estudios superiores, ya que sueña con poder hacerlo muy pronto.
texts.en:
Yari is an 18 year old, single young woman.  She lives with her parents in the city of Chincha.  In spite of her young age, she is an enterprising young woman with a great desire for self-improvement.  In her free times she likes to listen to a little music.  Sometimes she makes the delicious “Arroz Chaufa con Wantan Frito” (a dish similar to fried rice) in order to share a delicious lunch with her family.  In January she completed high school.  Sadly, due to lack of financial resources, she could not attend the university.  However, she dreams of being able to do so in the future.

With great determination, enthusiasm, and thanks to the support of her family, Yari works in her business of selling food and candy at two educational centers in her city.  She says that she has a kiosk where she makes her sales.  She devotes approximately eight hours a day to her business.  During that time she is able to wait on 120 customers between students and teachers.  She believes that her business is going well due to her delicious seasoning and good service. 

Yari is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to their help she will be able to buy a display case and an electric oven.  This will be a big help in her business.  This is the way that Yari hopes to be able to increase her income.  With the income she will be able to begin her university education.  She dreams of being able to do so very soon.

loans.use: to buy a display case and an electric oven.

loans.name: Las Almendritas (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama "Las Almendritas" y se integra de tres señores, cada una se dedica a una diferente actividad, todas viven en una comunidad llamada Ángel Albino Corzo.

Quien se le tomo  la entrevista se llama Sebastián quien es casado con la señora Martha Nayhelli y con quien procreo  una hija que tiene nueve meses.

   El solicitó el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  pinturas para igualarlo y  así vender los colores que sus clientes buscan  y desean comprar, en esta actividad lleva trabajando  dos  años y comenta que le va bien en sus ingresos.

   Inicio  con esta actividad para a poyar a su  familia con los ingresos de la casa  y su esposa  no se sienta limitada con los gastos que se generan en su hogar.

   Lo que desea es que con el préstamo  el pueda seguir incrementado  su actividad  en donde  siga comprando mas pinturas de meo calidad.

Quienes integran el grupo  son: la señora Mirene quien invertirá en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio de abarrotes y la señora Margarita quien invertirá en la compra de pinturas para reparación de autos.
texts.en:
The group"Las Almendritas" is made up of three individuals, each one with a different business. They all live in a community called Ángel Albino Corzo. The gentleman who was interviewed for this loan is named Sebastián.  He is married to Martha Nayhelli, and they have a nine-month-old daughter. He is seeking this loan to invest in paints that his customers wish to buy.  He has been in this business for two years and says he has made good income in this activity.

He started this business in order to support his wife and family in taking care of their household expenses.  With this loan he wants to be able to continue to grow his business and to buy high-quality paints. The other two members of the group are Mirene, who will buy merchandise for her grocery business, and Margarita, who will invest in automotive paints.

loans.use: to buy paints for resale.

loans.name: Las Morenitas Group

texts.es: La señora Paula tiene 25 años de edad, ella vive en unión libre, ella tiene 2 niñas pequeñas una está en preescolar, ella se dedica a la compra venta de borregos, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar pastura zacate molido para sus borregos, ella inicio la compra de borregos con unos ahorros que tenia, su negocio es importante porque vende los borregos y ya tiene ingresos, a ella le gusta cuando nacen y ver como van creciendo y va aumentando el negocio, también compra borregos para engordar, ella utiliza las ganancias para comprar borregos, pastura y alimento para los borregos, ella está planeando comprar cerditos para crianza y luego venderlos y lo pienza logar con las ganancias, su negocio le ha ayudado a su familia a estar mejor economicamente, ella está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir le ayuda a crecer el negocio. Sus sueños y esperanzas son comprar un terreno para construir su casa y poderles dar estudios a sus hijos. La integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Visión Fund muchas gracias por sus préstamos gracias por su confianza, por ayudarnos a crecer los negocios”.
texts.en:
Paula is 25 years old, and is in a civil union with two daughters, one of whom is in preschool. Paula makes a living selling sheep, and is requesting this loan in order to buy ground up grass to feed her sheep. She started her sheep sales business with a small amount of money that she had, and her business is very important to her, since it allows her to generate some income. She loves watching sheep be born, and then grow over time. Consequentially, as her sheep grow, her business has also grown. She raises sheep and fattens them up, and she uses the money she earns from sales to purchase more sheep, as well as grass and feed for her animals. 

She is planning to buy pigs for raising and eventual resale in hopes of generating income and profits. Her business has helped her family with their financial situation, and she is happy that this loan will help her to continue to grow her business. Her dreams and hopes are to purchase her own land to build a house on, and to provide her daughters with a good education. The members of the group would like to thank Kiva and Vision Fund for the loans, their confidence in the group, and for helping the group members grow their respective businesses.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and ground grass.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: Alfonso es una persona que   siempre  se  a  preocupado  por  el patrimonio de su  familia   en esta  ocasión  requiere  de nuestro  apoyo  ya  que  desea  pintar  las  paredes exteriores  de  su vivienda,  ve  en  el crédito la posibilidad  de  que  su  casa  tenga una  mejor  imagen  por lo que  se  encuentra  muy   contentos  de   habernos  encontrado  y  de  la  facilidad brindada  para  realizar  sus  pagos.
texts.en: Alfonso is someone who has always cared for his family estate. This time he requires our support because he wants to paint the exterior walls of his home. In this loan he sees the possibility of his house having a better image, which is why he is very happy to have found us and with the easy payments offered.

loans.use: to paint the exterior walls of his home.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana Julia, sigue comercializando su comercio de ropa de segunda, el cual lleva varios años, apoyando  a su familia, cuenta con el apoyo economico de su esposo, quien trabaja como guada de seguridad, alquila un cuarto, y el garaje de su casa, ayudandose mas con los ingresos para pago de sus gastos.
 Asi mismo con los financiamiento que ha logrado hacer, ha comprado variedad de pacas para ofertar mas  productos a sus clientes. Con este nuevo prestamo invertira en la compra de dos pacas una suprema y otra paca de sabanas, siendo de venta rapida.
texts.en:
Ana Julia continues with her business of selling second-hand clothes.  She has been doing this for several years, supporting her family.  She does have financial support from her husband, who works as a security guard.  She rents a room and the garage of her house.  This helps even more with the income in order to pay for their expenses.

With the loans that she has gotten she has purchased a variety of pallets of clothes in order to offer more products to her customers.  She will use this new loan to buy two pallets, one of clothing of supreme quality second-hand clothing and the other of sheets.  They sell rapidly.

loans.use: to buy two pallets of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en: Yusufu is a thirty-one-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children. He has been farming for the last six years despite hardships of inadequate capital to purchase improved seeds. However, he has a vision of venturing into mechanized agriculture. Yusufu needs a loan to harvest his tomato garden.

loans.use: to harvest his tomato garden.

loans.name: Sinai Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Sinai" esta conformado por hombre y mujeres que son muy trabajadores y respobasbles siempre han vivido en la misma comunidad, comentan que se conecen desde niños siempre ha sido un grupo muy unido y cabe mencionar que en sus horarios sosn muy estrictos ya que a la persona que se le ocurra llegar despues  tendra que pagar alguna multa como invitar alguna botana para todo el grupo, el nombre del grupo no saben que significa tampoco saben porque se llama asi ya pero les gusta mucho.
El grupo sinai esta muy contento y agradecido yaq ue le han otorgado el credito y les ayudara de mucho para invertir en sus activiades como Petronilas y Maria De la Luz tienda de aboarrotes, Matilde en ropa de bebe, Jose en ropa de dama y caballero, Antonio, Sofia,tomas y Loe en Fantasia, Jesus electrodomesticos,Abelina en papeleria, Angelica en articulos para el hogar.
Doña martha tambien forma parte del grupo sinai nos cuenta que tiene 49 años de edad esta casada con el señor Alfonso desde hace 30 años ya no tienen dependientes ya odos sus hijos se casaron y estan viviendo fuera.
Nos cuenta que desde hace 10 años, ella vende productos de paltico es por esa razon que ha solicitado el credito para compara productos de palticos como, cucharas, vasos, paltos etc.
nos cuentaq ue la unica dificultad que presentaba erra que tenia que ranchar ya si se cansaba mucho pero ahora ya tiene un puesto estable y no teine que batallar, en caminar.
Doña Martha nos platica que mas adelante le gustaria que sus negocio creciera y sus ganacias aumentaran cada vez mas, para que la calidad de vida y su hijos tambien le gustaria mejorar sus vivienda ya que siempre ha deseado tener una casa muy bonita.
texts.en:
The group Sinai is made up of men and women who are hardworking and responsible. They have always lived in the same community. They commented that they have known one another since childhood and they have always been a very united group and also mention that they are very strict with their time schedules and the person that arrives late has to pay some kind of penalty such as inviting the entire group for a snack. They don’t know what the name of their group means either, or why they named it thus, but now they like it very much.

The Sinai group is very happy and grateful to have been granted the loan and it will help  them very much to invest in their activities such as Petronila’s and Maria de la Luz’s grocery store, Matilde’s baby clothing, Jose’s clothing for women and men, Antonio, Sofia, Tomas and Leo in jewelry, Jesus in household appliances, Abelina in her stationery store, and Angelica in household items. 

Martha is also a part of the Sinai group. She tells us that she is 49 years old, married to Alfonso for 30 years, and has no dependent children as they are already married adults outside her household.

We note that for 10 years she has been selling plastic products such as spoons, glasses, dishes, etc. She tells us that the only difficulty that she has had was when she had to roam about as she was tired a lot, but now that she has a stable location she does not have to battle the road.

Martha tells us that in the future she would like her business to expand and her earnings to increase more and more, for the quality of life for her and the children too, and she would like to improve her housing and she always has wanted to have a pretty house.

loans.use: to buy plastic spoons, glasses and dishes

loans.name: Albores Guillen Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama albores guillen y se íntegra de seis  personas  que viven  en un pueblo llamado Bochil, un lugar muy bonito.

   Quien se le tomo  la entrevista se llama María Margarita  quien es casada con el señor  José y con quien procreo tres hijos  que aun están a su responsabilidad.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales en donde lleva trabajando unos años en la que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello  a estado y le va bien con sus  ingresos.
 
   Inicio  con esta actividad para poyara su esposo  con lo ingresos  de  la casa y así  poder darle lo más necesario a su familia que es lo mas importante para ella.
  
    Lo que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella siga trabajando  y seguir adelante con su actividad.
