Lo que se integran en el grupo son: Hilario quien se dedica a la venta de tacos y empanadas fritas, Carlos, invertirá en su negocio de abarrotes, Aliandro invertirá en la compra de mercancía para su negocio de abarrotes, Madalena en su negocio de ropas  y la señora Martina invertirá en comida.
texts.en:
The group is called Albores Guillen and has six people, who are living in a village called Bochil, a very beautiful place. 

Who did the interview is called Maria Margarita who is married to Jose, whom she has three children who are still under their responsibility. 

She requested the loan to buy the ingredients needed to prepare and sell “tamales”. In this business, she has worked a few years ago. She says that she is doing well because makes a good profit. 

She started with this activity to help her husband with the income of the house and as a result be able to give what is most needed to her family, which is the most important thing for her. 

What she hopes is to continue working in her business and be able to get ahead.
 
The members of the group are: Hilary who makes a living selling tacos and fried empanadas, Carlos, will invest in his business, grocery store, Aliandro will buy merchandise for his business, grocery stores, Madalena will invest in her clothing business and Mrs. Martina will invest in food.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients needed to prepare and sell “tamales”.

loans.name: San Agustin Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama san Agustín y se integra de seis señoras quienes vive en un pueblo llamado coapilla, en la  que celebran la fiesta de la santísima virgen de candelaria, que es la patrona del pueblo.

     Quien se le tomo al entrevista se llama Emilia ella es casada con el señor  máximo  con quien procreo tres hijos quienes ya están casados.

    Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  bisutería de uso personal como son: cadenas, pulsos, entre otros en donde lleva  trabajando  dos  años cuatro meses en la que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello a estado obteniendo ingresos en  su hogar.
 
    Inicio con esta actividad para a poyar a su  esposo con los ingresos de  la casa ya que el trabaja en el campo y asi no se van  limitados con los gastos generados en su hogar.

     Lo que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella pueda seguir  adelante hasta que dios ele preste vida.
 
    Quienes integra en el grupo son: consuelo invertirá  en la compra de útiles para su papelería,  julia invertirá en la compra de maíz y frijol para venderlo por quilo, Esperanza invertirá en la compra de pollos de rancho para venderlo destazado, María del Carmen invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes, María Antonia  invertirá en la compra de  frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The San Agustín communal bank is comprised of six women who live in a town called Coapilla.  In this town they celebrate the Fiesta of the Blessed Virgen of Candelaria, the patron saint of the town.

Emily was interviewed.  She is married to Máximo, and they have three married children.

She is requesting the loan to buy jewelry for her customers’ personal use.  She will buy things like necklaces and bracelets, among others.  She has been working for two years and four months.   She says that it is going well for her because, through her business, she has been getting income for her household.

She started this business activity in order to support her husband with the household income.  He works in the field, and with her support they are not limited by the expenses their household generates.   What she wishes is that with her small business activity she will ge able to continue getting ahead as long as God grants her life.

The members of the group are:
Consuelo, who will buy supplies for her stationery business.
Julia, who will buy corn and rice in order to sell it by the kilo.
Esperanza, who will buy farm-raised chickens to butcher and sell.
María del Carmen, who will buy the ingredients to make bread.
María Antonio, who will buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en: Ibtisam is a 38-year-old hardworking mother, and her husband works for the public security directorate.  They have seven daughters.  Ibtisam is a school teacher in a girls’ school. Recently, she bought a sewing machine and has started doing some basic tailoring services, such as shortening clothing pieces.  She has applied for this loan in order to buy more raw material of fabric and thread so she can start doing advanced tailoring work and also start making different hand puppets to sell at kid's toy stores.

loans.use: to buy more raw material of fabric and thread.

loans.name: Divicion Hanrrora Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Divicion Hanrrora” está ubicado en una comunidad llamada San Isidro Boxipe una comunidad muy tranquila, el día que vistamos al grupo estaba festejando la fiesta más grande de su pueblo que es el santo San Isidro, algunas integrantes del grupo participan en la danza de la comunidad.
El nombre del grupo lo eligieron ya que estaban en un grupo grande de 41 integrantes que tuvieron que dividir en dos por eso el nombre de División y Hanrrora por el lugar donde viven, una parte se quedo con el nombre de Hanrrora y este grupo se quedo con el nombre de División Hanrrora.
Doña Catalina una integrante del grupo nos cuenta que ella tiene mucho tiempo trabajando con la institución, ella tiene 66 años ya es una señora viuda  hace poco vivía sola pero enfermo y uno de sus hijos se vino a vivir con ella para cuidarla, Doña Catalina se dedica a la cría y engorda de borregos desde hace 30 años la idea de iniciar la actividad le nació sola ya que en la comunidad la mayoría se dedica a la cría de borregos nos cuenta que los cuida mucho, les da de comer para que crezcan grandes y gordas para que a la hora de vender puedan pagárselos a un buen precio.
Una de las dificultades mas grandes es cuando sus borregos enferman y mueren nos cuenta que hace poco murieron 5 borregos estaba muy triste ya que fue una gran pérdida perder 5 borregos al mismo tiempo no es nada fácil, sin embargo comenta que hace poco le trato de arreglar el corral donde los tenia poniéndoles un alambrón que los resguarda mejor.
La meta que tiene Doña Catalina es llegar  a tener  masa barreritas es por eso que esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar 5 borregos y un poco de alimento para sus borregos, siempre ha querido ver su corral lleno de borregos entre grandes y pequeños.
Nos comenta que sus ganancias le ayudan para seguir comprando mas borregos pero también ayudan  mejorar su calidad de vida para comprarse cosas que necesita como zapateos, ropa, alimentación, también invierte una parte para sacer adelante sus terrenos que tiene que sembrar maíz. Y de los pagos con la institución le ayudan sus hijos que ya trabajan. 
El grupo está conformado por otras nueve mujeres que son Austreberta, Irma, Teresa, Juliana y María Eva son señoras que invertirán su crédito comprando borregos para cría y engorda. Mientras que las señoras Eloisa, Aurora, Eva compraran alimento para sus borregos entre pastura, zacate, maíz y alimento para sus borregos. Finamente la señora Lucia comprara pollos, guajolotes y borregos para cría y engorda. En fin todas las integrantes invertirán en sus actividades pero todas están muy agradecidas con el crédito ya que siempre han sido de gran beneficio.
texts.en:
The group “Hanrrora Division” is located in the tranquil San Isidro Boxipe community. The day we visited the group their town was celebrating their biggest holiday for Saint Isidor. Some of the members of the group participated in the dance.
They chose the name of the group because there were already 41 members and a division was necessary and they chose to name it after their town. One portion was named Hanrrora and this group was named Hanrrora Division.
Mrs. Catalina is a member of the group and she tells us she has been working with the institution for lots of time now. She is 66 years old, widowed, and until recently lived alone since she got sick and one of her sons comes to look after her. Mrs. Catalina raises sheep for 30 years now. She decided to start the business alone since it is a common business in the community. She takes care of them, fattens them up so they grow a certain size, and sells them at a reasonable price.
One of the biggest difficulties is when her sheep get sick and die. She tells us that recently 5 have died and she is very sad since it is a hard hit loosing 5 at once. Recently she has fixed the corral she keeps them in to protect them better. 
Mrs. Catalina’s goal is to have more sheep and is requesting the loan to buy 5 more and feed. She has always wanted to see her corral filled with both large and small sheep. 
She comments that her income helps her buy more sheep and improve her life quality like buying things she needs such as shoes, clothes, food, and maintain the corn crops she has on the side. Her sons will help her pay back the loan since they work.
The group is formed by new members: Austreberta, Irma, Teresa, Juliana y María Eva. They will use the loan to buy sheep to raise and sell. Mrs. Eloisa, Aurora, Eva will buy feed, grass, and corn. Finally, Mrs. Lucia will buy chickens, turkeys, and sheep to raise. In the end, the members will invest in their businesses and they are all thankful with the loans since they are always a great help.

loans.use: buy sheep

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru: Дамире 56 лет. Дамира в качестве основного  источника дохода для своей семьи,  12 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством. Начатый  с суммы 50,000 сом бизнес благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости  Дамиры, на сегодня насчитывает 4 коровы, 1 лошадь и 10 голов мелкого рогатого скота и приносит доход около 15,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса,  Дамира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота на откорм и перепродажу.  Доходы от кредита  Дамира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса за счет земледелия – посадки чеснока и картофеля.
texts.en: Damira is 56 years old.  12 years ago Damira began raising livestock as a primary source of income for her family. Thanks to Damira's hard work and persistence, the business that she started with and initial sum of 50,000 som currently includes 4 cows, one horse and 10 heads of sheep and goats and brings an income of about 15,000 som per month. To further develop her business, Damira has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock for fattening and resale. She plans to invest profits from this loan into further expansion of her business into agriculture - planting garlic and potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sixta  Del Rosario

texts.es:
En el municipio de Larreynaga Malpaisillo en un poblado del  departamento de león, la señora Sixta se dedica arduamente  a la  laborar como Enfermera Profesional, actualmente esta desempeñándose con el cargo antes mencionado, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 22 años, es soltera no tiene a nadie  a su cargo, 
Una de las necesidades que la señora Sixta atraviesa hoy en día es de Mejorar su vivienda, la que se encuentra en mal estado, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le `permitió tomar la decisión de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de Materiales de construcción como: Laminas de Zinc y Mano de Obra para la construcción de Techo ya que esta en mal estado y en estos tiempos de lluvias que es cuando se siente más la necesidad.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Larreynaga Malpaisillo, in a town in the department of Leon, Sixta has worked hard as a professional nurse for 22 years.  She is single and has no dependants.

One of Sixta's current needs is to improve her house, which is in poor condition.  Because of this need she made the decision to visit CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy construction materials such as: sheet metal and labor to build a roof.  Her roof is in poor condition and it is in this, the rainy season, that she feels the greatest need for this work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as: sheet metal and labor to build a roof.

loans.name: Jazmin Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Jazmin" lleva adopta nuevas integrantes 5 integrantes mas forman porte del grupo personas que tambien son trabajadoras y muy responsables estan muy contentas porque su grupo ha crecido mucho yaq ue empezaron siendo muy pocas. Las integrates decidieron el nombre ya que en la casa donde se reunen esta un cuadro hermosos de jazmines pero tambien comentan que porque la casa donde se reunen la señora tiene una hija que se llama Jazmin que tambien esta dentro del grupo, Las integrantes del grupo estan muy agradeciada con las personas que se interasan en sus historia y que les prestan el dinero en este caso es Vision Found (FRAC) y KIVA ya que gracias al credito ellas podran invertir en sus actividades.
Maribel quien invertiara en colchas y sabanas, Margarita invertira en su costureria, Maria Alicia invertiara en materiales para costruccion, Lizbeth y Jazmin compraran pollos para en cria para despues vender, Maura invertira en Leceria por catalogos,  mientras que las señoaras Rosalia, Lizbeht y Maria Elena, comparar borregos para engorda y venta, finalmente Beatriz y Mirna compraran ropa para su venta.Doña Flor como le dicen de cariño tambien forma parte del grupo Jazmin nos palitaca  que tiene 54 años de edad ya es una señora viuda pero aun tiene una hija que depende de ella, Doña Petra esta muy contenta porque pronto ira a la preaparaotoria nos paltica que hace poco hizo examen para entar a la preparatoria su hija se llama Dalila Jazmin, Doña Flor ha solicitado el credito para comprar maiz y gas ya que desde hace 7 años tiene una tortilleria cuando le preguntamos si tenia algun nombre su negocio sonriendo nos dijo "No nunca le puse nombre ni letreros solo llegaron mis clientes ya que ella nunca pense iniciar un negocio pero conocia  auna maestra que tenia un local desocupado y ella fue la que motivo para inicair la tortillaria yaq ue era un buen negocio, porque yo sabia hacer tortillas que aprendi de mi mama"
nos platica que la unica dificultad a la que se enfrenta es el precio tan alto de maiz y gas pero con el credito le ayudara de mucho ya que podra comprar todo lo que le hacve falta. Doña nos cuenta " A mi me gustaria apoyar mucho ami hija para que estudie una carrera y algundia ella llegue a ser una profesinal tambien me gsutaria arreglara mi casa ya que esta muy desarregala le hace falta el azulego del piso, y el aplanado de afuera".
cuandole preguntamos si le gustaria dejar un mensaje para la institucion o nuestros inversinistas "Yo en lo personal estoy muy agradecida por el prestamo otorgado ya que de ahi he sacado muchas ganacias y pude comprar mi molino para mi tortilleria, tambien pude comprra un carro que aun estoy pagando poco a poco y me sirve de mucho ya que puedo trasportar todo lo que necesito para mi tortilleria."
texts.en:
The group “Jazmin” added 5 new members. They are also very hard-working and responsible women. They are very happy since the group has grown since the beginning. The members decided to name the group after Jazmins located a block from where they meet and the daughter of one of the members. They are very thankful that people are interested in their stories and are lending them money through Vision Found (FRAC) and KIVA to invest in their businesses.
Maribel will invest in bedspreads and bed sheets, Margarita will invest in her sewing business, Maria Alicia will buy materials for construction work, Lizbeth and Jazmin will invest in chicken livestock, Maura will invest in her Lenceria catalog business, while Mrs. Rosalia, Lizbeth and Maria Elena will buy sheep livestock, and Beatriz and Mirna will buy clothes to sell. Mrs. Flor as she is nicknamed is also a member of the Jazmin group. She is 54 years old, widowed, and has a daughter under her care. Mrs. Petra is very happy because she will have a daughter attending high school. Her daughter just took the test and will be enrolling soon. Her name is Dalila Jazmin. Mrs. Flor requested the loan to buy corn and gas for her tortilla business she has had for 7 years. When we asked her if her business has a name smiling she responded, “No, I never named it nor put signs up. Clients simply showed up. I never thought I would start a business but I knew a teacher that had an unoccupied locale and she motivated me to start the tortilla business since my mother taught me how to make them.”
She tells us that the only obstacle are the high prices of corn and gas but with the loan she will be able to purchase all that she needs. Dona tells us, “ I would really like to support my daughter so she can attend a university and get a job. I would also like to fix my house since it is incomplete. The floors still need tile and the outside still needs to be flattened. When we asked her if she would like to leave a message for the institution or our lenders she responded, “ Personally, I am very thankful for the offered loan since I will be able to increase profits, will be able to buy a grinder for tortillas, and will be able to transport everything I need to my tortilla shop.

loans.use: buy a ton and a half of corn and gas

loans.name: Estrellita Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Estrellita, cual estas conformado por ocho personas indígenas originarias de un pueblo llamado Tetepec, Oaxaca  donde la mayoría de las personas  hablan el idioma mixteco y visten de naguas y mandil.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Socorro de treinta y cinco años de edad, quien se caracteriza por ser una persona amable, responsable y trabajadora.
Doña Soco como mejor la conocen sus paisanos nos dice que se dedica a la venta y elaboración de antojitos mexicanos como son enchiladas, entomatadas, quesadillas, sopes, , empanadas y tostadas.
Dice que inicio su negocio gracias al apoyo de su esposo Amadeo quien le apoya en lo que necesita y le ayuda atender a  los clientes y sobre todo en cuestiones económicas siempre cuenta con su apoyo.
Una de las cosas que mas le gustan de su negocio es preparar la tinga de pollo, para las tostadas y sobre todo tener sus pedidos a tiempo para que sus clientes no se molesten.
Dice que una de las características que debe tener una persona para elaborar su trabajo es ser higiénica, activa ya que hay que levantarse temprano para preparar los platillos y hacer las tortillas.
Una de las cosas mas linda que ha tenido respecto a su negocio es contar con la ayuda de Vision Found, ya que con su apoyo va ha poder comprar mas ingredientes para la elaboración de antojitos mexicanos.
Las otras  integrantes son
Emma- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Lidia- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Teodora Eufracia- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Eduardo- se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Susana Alejandra- se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo.
Hermenegildo- se dedica a la venta de ganado.
Natalia- se dedica a la  venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Le dan las gracias a Vision Found por ayudar a todas las familias mujeres  trabajadoras.
texts.en:
This group I called Small Star, which is composed of 8 indigenous people originating from a town called Tetepec, Oaxaca. Here, the majority of the people speak mixteco and dress in petticoats and Oaxacan dresses.
One of the members of this group is Socorro who is 35 years old, and characterizes herself as being friendly, responsible, and hard-working.
Mrs. Soco, as she is known by the townspeople, prepares and sells Mexican dishes such as enchiladas, tomato enchiladas, quesadillas, thick tortillas with toppings, pastry turnovers with fillings, and fried tortillas with toppings.
She started her business with her husband, Amadeo’s, support. He helps her with necessities, attending clients, and financial support.
One of her favorite things she likes to do is prepare chicken tinga (chicken simmered in chipotle and onions), to top the fried tortillas, and most of all having her orders made on time to satisfy clients.
She says that one of the characteristics a person should have for this type of job is good hygiene and be energetic since waking up early is necessary to prepare the dishes and make tortillas. 
One of the nicest things about her business is being able to count on Vision Found because with their support she will be able to buy more materials to prepare more Mexican meals.
The other members are:
Emma- sells Mexican dishes
Lidia- sells Mexican dishes
Teodora Eufracia- Sells meals
Eduardo- sells groceries

Susana Alejandra- sells shoes through a catalog
Hermenegildo- sells livestock
Natalia- sells Mexican dishes
They are thankful for Vision Found helping out families and female workers.

loans.use: buy materials to prepare Mexican dishes

loans.name: El Arenal Group

texts.es:
El grupo "El arenal es esta conformado por 8 mejeres que pertenecen al mismo grpo y a la misma localiadad San Agustin Mextepec, nos cuentan que se conocen desde pequeñas siempre han vivido junats Ellas  mismas eligieron el nombre y lo eligieron porque por donde viven hay una arenal donde la arena es muy suevecita.
las integrantes del grupo han solicitado el credito para invertir en sus negocios como Zenaida en fantasia, Isabel en Coladeras y jergas, Maria Gloria en Vasos de licuadora, Alicia Flores en tienda, Rosa Ma. jarceria, Rosa en jarceria.
veronica es parte del grupo El arenal nos cuenta que tiene 25 años de edad esta casada con el señor Librado, donde han formado una famialia con tres hijos que ya van ala escuela, Vero nos cuenta que se dedica  a la veta de bolsas y novedades en un local de San Felipe apenas lo inicio, es por eso que esta vez ha solicitado el credito para comprra mas bolsas que estan a la moda para quue se le venda mejor.
Nos cuentaq ue la dificultad que presenta es la falta de recusos para compara mas mercancia pero el credito le ayudara para adquirir mercancia y vender mas.
Vero nos comenta que le gustaria que sus negocio creciera paraq ue obtuviera mas ganacias yaq ue le ayudan de mucho para mejorar sus caliada de vida de ella y de su famila ya que le preocupa los gastos que se bienen debido a que sus hijos ya asisten a la escuela.
Pero Vero y el grupo estan muy contentos y agradecidos con el credito otorgado ya que podran invertir en sus ganacias.
texts.en:
The “Arenal” (Sands) group is composed of eight women who are from the same locality, San Agustin Mextepec. They tell us they have known each other since they were very young and have always lived near one another. They chose their name themselves and chose “Arenal” because they live where there is a sandy area and the sand is very satiny.

The members of the group have requested funding to invest in their businesses: Zenaida in novelty items, Isabel in strainers and floor cloths, Maria Gloria in blenders, Alicia Flores in a store, Rosa Ma in cleaning products and Rosa in cleaning products.

Veronica is part of the group. Arenal tells us that she is 25 years old and married to Sr. Librado with whom she has formed a family of three children, who are now attending school. Vero tells us that she sells bags and novelty items at a shop in San Felipe. She is just starting her business and is requesting a loan at this time to purchase more bags that are in style and that will sell better. She notes that a difficulty is the lack of resources to buy more merchandise, however a loan will help her acquire inventory and sell more.

Vero says that she would like her business to grow so that she can earn more income, which would greatly help improve her quality of life and that of her family because she is worried about the upcoming expenses of sending her children to school.

Vero and the group are very happy and grateful for the funding provided since they will be able to invest in their earnings.

loans.use: to purchase novelty items and bags.

loans.name: Laguna Verde Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Laguna Verde y se integra de siete personas quien cada una se dedica a su actividad y viven en un pueblo  llamado Coapilla en donde celebran la fiesta de la Virgen de Candelaria el 2 de febrero.

La señora Yureni es quien se le tomo la entrevistas, es casada con el señor Roger con quien procreo  un hijo que a un está a su responsabilidad. Ella solicitó el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de pollos por reja para luego venderlo por kilo en donde lleva trabajando cuatro años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha estado trabajando muy bien desde que inició con esta pequeña actividad. Se dedica a esta actividad para a poyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa ya que aunque su familia es pequeña, desea darle lo más necesario a su hijo. Lo que más desea es que con el préstamo, su actividad siga trabajando para así tener un local más amplio en donde vender los pollos destazados, para darles una mejor atención a su clientes.

Quienes integran en el grupo son las señoras: Manuela de Jesús (invertirá el préstamo en la compra y venta de frutas y legumbres), la señora Amelia (invertirá en la compra y venta de marranos para engordarlos  y posteriormente venderlos), María Rosario (invertirá en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio de abarrotes), María del Carmen (invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de longaniza),  Dominga de Jesús (invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes) y por último la señora María Erendida (invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de pan).
texts.en:
The group is called “Laguna Verde”, Green Lake, and consists of seven people who each one is dedicated to is own activity and are living in a town called Coapilla, where they celebrate Virgin of Candelaria holiday on February 2.

Who did the interview is Yureni. She is married to Roger and has a son who is still under their responsibility. She requested the loan to buy chicken and then later sell them by kilo. She has been doing this for four years. She says that since she started she has been doing well. 

She does this to help her husband with the income of their house and she wants to give her son what he needs. She hopes that with this loan her business will grow and as a result have a larger store and offer better service to her clients. 

The members of the group are: Manuela de Jesus, who will buy fruits and vegetables to sell.  Amelia, who will buy pigs to fatten and subsequently sell. Maria Rosario, who will buy supplies to stock her grocery store. María del Carmen, who will buy the ingredients needed for the elaboration of “longaniza” a type of spicy cold pork sausage. Domenica of Jesus, who will buy the ingredients needed to make bread and finally the Mary Erendida, who will buy the ingredients needed to make bread.

loans.use: to buy chicken and then later sell them by kilo.

loans.name: Mariana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mariana lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Karen  quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 8 años la cual inicio con dinero propio y con ayuda de su hermano. El crédito lo invertirá en granos básicos.
Las otras integrantes son Nubia quien vende ropa y cosméticos desde hace 8 años y Rosa tiene una pequeña venta desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The group Mariana is formed of 3 hard-working and driven women. One of them is Karen who has had a grocery store for 8 years which she started with her own money and brother's help. She will use the loan to buy basic grains.
The other members are Nubia who sells clothes and cosmetics for 8 years now and Rosa who has a small shop for 3 years now.

loans.use: buy as many basic grains as possible for her grocery store

loans.name: Kalbubu

texts.ru: Калбубу 46 лет. Калбубу в качестве основного  источника дохода для своей семьи,  18 лет назад начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Начатый  с суммы 10,000 сом бизнес благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости  Калбубу, на сегодня насчитывает 2 коровы, 1 телку и 1 бычка и приносит доход около 10,000 сом в месяц. Также, Калбубу возделывает 3,0га земли, где выращивает эспарцет и пшеницу.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса,  Калбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку семян эспарцета и оплату ГСМ.  Доходы от кредита  Калбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса за счет постройки большого сарая.
texts.en: Kalbubu is 46 years old.  18 years ago Kalbubu started farming and raising livestock as the main source of income for her family. Thanks to Kalbubu's hard work and persistence, the business that she has started with the initial sum of 10,000 som currently includes 2 cows, 1 heifer and 1 calf and brings in an income of around 10,000 som per month. In addition, Kalbubu cultivates 3 hectares of land where she grows sainfoin and wheat. To further develop her business, Kalbubu has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to buy sainfoin seeds and pay for fuel. She plans to invest profits from this loan into building a large barn to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fuel

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 37 años, es madre soltera, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus 2 hijos, a quien se dedica por completo para sacarlos adelante, ella siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora, con esmero concluyó sus estudios universitarios, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no puedo estudiar la carrera de Gastronomía, pero sueña con poder hacerlo algún día; en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión junto a sus hijos y en algunas ocasiones engríe a su familia preparando un riquísimo “Cau Cau”.
Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor y con el deseo de salir adelante, Rosa tiene un negocio de cultivo de tuna y venta de cochinilla, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 9 horas diarias; asimismo, en las tardes se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de comida, ella se siente muy a gusto con sus negocios ya que siempre le ha gustado el campo y el trabajo que se realiza en el.     
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de cosecha de su cultivo de tuna, como nutrientes y abono; así también podrá realizar la infesta de cochinilla a todo su cultivo; de esta manera su cultivo estará adecuadamente preparado para las siguientes cosechas y podrá incrementar sus ingresos por las ventas realizadas y así poco a poco Rosa espera ahorrar lo suficiente para poder comprarse un terreno propio donde pueda tener su restaurant.
texts.en: Rosa is a 37-year-old single mother who lives in the city of Nazca with her two children, and is completely dedicated to raising them.  She has always been a very hard-working woman.  With great effort she completed her university studies.  Unfortunately due to a lack of resources she was unable to study gastronomy, but she dreams of being able to do so one day.  In her free time she likes to watch television with her children and occasionally spoil her family by preparing a delicious "Cau Cau".  Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and her desire to get ahead, she has a business growing prickly pear and selling cochineal.  She works at her business for about 9 hours a day, and also works doing mobile food sales in the afternoons.  She is very happy with her  businesses as she has always liked the countryside and the work that is done in it.  Rosa is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because due to the help they provide she can cover the cost of harvesting her prickly pear crop, such as nutrients and fertilizer, and also be able to have her crop infested with cochineal. Her crop will then be adequately prepared for subsequent harvests and she will be able to increase her income as a result of her sales.  Little by little Rosa hopes to save enough money to buy her own property where she can own a restaurant.

loans.use: to cover the cost of harvesting her prickly pear crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the construction materials such as: concrete, blocks, sand and iron to add a room to her house

loans.name: Ilse Maria

texts.es: La Señora Ilse es originaria de un pueblo del departamento de León, como la enseñanza de la educación es un don que enorgullece a los que la practican en este sector existen personas como la profesora ilse,  esta actividad de impartir el pan del saber desde hace 17 años trasmitiéndole a los niños que son los preferidos en este caso,  llena de satisfacción tener el contacto directo con los pequeños de sus aulas por generaciones, es casada con 2 hijos a los que apoya en sus estudios tanto secundarios como universitarios, actualmente la señora Ilse tiene una necesidad principal como es de mejorar su vivienda como es la construcción del piso ya que lo tiene en mal estado. Por eso tomo la decisión  de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para lograr el objetivo deseado atravez del mismo y de esa manera brindarles mejores condiciones y nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ilse is originally from a village in the district of Leon.  The teaching of education is a gift that brings pride to those who practice it, and in this endeavour there are people like the teacher Ilse.  She has engaged in the [profession] of giving knowledge for 17 years.  In her particular case, passing on [intelligence] to children is the most preferred.  She is filled with satisfaction to have direct contact with the generations of small children [that enter] her classrooms.  

Ilse is married with two children, to whom she supports in their studies in both secondary school and the university.  Currently, Ilse has a primary need to improve her home, [with improvements] like the construction of a floor since the one she has is in very bad condition.  For this reason, she made the decision to visit CEPRODEL to request funding in order to achieve her desired objective through the organization.  And that way, she will [be able] to offer better conditions and standard of living to her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials including ceramics, cement, sand, gravel and labor.

loans.name: Flor De Nardo Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama flor de nardo y se integra de tres señoras quienes son unas señoras muy trabajadoras y viven en un pueblo bonito en donde hay una laguna muy grande.

  Quien se le tomo le entrevista se llama Vitalina, ella es casada con el señor José con quien procreo seis hijos quienes ya todos están casados tiene setenta y siete años  de edad y aun trabaja para ganar  sus ingresos.

    Solicito el préstamo en la compra de café y maíz ´para venderlo por kilo en donde lleva trabajando   once años y dos meses en la que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello  ha estado obteniendo ingresos para su hogar.
Inicio con esta actividad  para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y así juntos seguir adelante.

   Lo que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella pueda seguir trabajando y darle lo más necesario a su  esposo  que está un poco mas de salud.

    Quienes integran en el grupo son:
  Ernestina invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de panes y la señora candelaria y invertirá en la compra de zapatos por cátalo de la marca Andrea.
texts.en:
The group is named "Flor de Nardo" and it is made up of three women who are very hardworking women and live in a pretty town where there is a very large lagoon.    

The one who was interviewed is named Vitalina. She is married to José and they have six children together, all of whom are now married. She is seventy-seven years old and still works to earn her income.

She asked for this loan in order to buy coffee and corn to sell by the kilogram at the place where she has worked for eleven years and two months. She says that it is going well for her, since this is how she has been getting an income for her home.

She began this type of work to support her husband with the household income, in order to continue moving ahead together.

What she desires is to be able to continue working in this small way and give her husband what is most needed as he is a little unwell.

The women who make up the group are: Ernestina, who will invest in buying ingredients for baking bread, and Candelaria, who will invest in buying Andrea-brand shoes from a catalog.

loans.use: to pay for the buying and selling of corn and beans.

loans.name: Donia

texts.en:
Donia is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. Donia is a hard worker. She opened her own business in 2010 to help her husband in making their living.

Donia is well known in the region for her good reputation and enthusiasm. She is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a pickup necessary for her business. It will help a lot in transporting the fruits and vegetables in a suitable and easy way.

Donia has been an Al Majmoua borrower for four cycles. All of her previous loans were invested in business improvement. Today she is requesting a loan for the same purpose, which she believes will reflect positively on both her social and financial situations.

Donia hopes to expand her business more and more in the future through starting wholesale trade.

loans.use: to buy a pickup necessary for her business.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 40-year-old married woman. Her husband works as a driver, but that is not enough to care for three sons and a daughter. Because of that, Hiyam started a small clothing sales business in order to participate in paying for household bills.

Hiyam has now applied for this loan to increase the quantity of clothes for different ages, and to get a new summer collection.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of clothes for different ages.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 37-years-old businessman, married to Caroline, and blessed with 6 children. He has been running a retail shop in Kabarnet town for the last two years and he gets a monthly average income of Kshs 15,000.

Richard has borrowed Kshs 35,000 and he intends to use Kshs 18,000 to purchase sugar, salt, maize flour, wheat flour, tea leaves, and washing powder among other items; he will use the remaining amount of Kshs 17,000 to pay school fees for his children.

Richard intends to use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for his children as well as use it to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase stock

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is married and has four children. He runs a posho mill (a grinding machine that crushes maize into maize flour) to earn a living. He also does farming to supplement his income.  

He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.  

He hopes to grow his business and employ people. He has requested 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy maize.

loans.use: to buy maize.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Sarom (in the photo), age 29, is a widow with one son who is attending school. She lives with her mother and niece in a village about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sarom is a garment worker. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy a motorbike to get to work because she commutes to work by bicycle which is tiring and untimely.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to get to work.

loans.name: El Arroyito Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama el arroyito  y se integra de tres señoras quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades y  viven en un  pueblo  llamado  chicoasen.

  Quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama Elisabeth quien es casada con el señor  julio con quien procreo  cinco hijos quienes ya todos están casados  y vive en diferentes lugares.

   Solito el préstamo para invertirlo en a compra de  frutas  y verduras en donde lleva  trabajando   dos años y cinco  meses en la que comenta que le va bien  ya   que con ello a esto obteniendo ingresos para s u familia.
 
  Inicio con esta actividad para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa a un que también el se encarga de ir a comprar la verduras para salir a venderlo en la comunidades cercanas de su  pueblo.

    Lo que desea es que con esta  pequeña actividad y el préstamo  ella pueda seguir trabajando  y seguir adelante hasta que dios le preste vida.

  Quiénes integrarán en el grupo son:

  Lorma quien invertirá en la compra de  cosméticos de la marca fuller y la señora Carolina  invertirá el préstamo  en la compra  de ingredientes  para la elaboración de tamales.
texts.en:
The group is called “El Arroyito” [The Little Canyon] and it's composed of 3 women who are dedicated to different activities and live in a town called Chicoasen. The woman interviewed is Elisabeth who is married to Julio with whom she had 5 children, all now married and living in different locations.

Elisabeth is soliciting her loan to buy fruit and vegetables, which she has been selling for 2 years and 5 months. She says the business is going well and she is supporting her family with the earnings. Elisabeth began the business to help her husband with household income. He takes charge of going to purchase the vegetables and, also, going out to sell them in communities near their town. What she desires is that with this small activity and the loan, she can continue working and getting ahead as long as God gives her life.

The other 2 members of the group are: Lorma, who will invest in purchasing Fuller brand cosmetics to sell, and Carolina, who will invest her loan in purchasing ingredients for making tamales.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Para Vivir Mejor Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Para Vivir Mejor” está conformado por  2 hombres y 6 mujeres son personas muy responsables y trabajadoras esta vez que las vistamos estaban muy contentos porque el crédito se les autorizo  ya que todos podrán invertir comprando sus animales los integrantes  del grupo son los siguientes Doña Alejandra, María del Carmen, Juana Cruz, Catalina, y Don Horacio y José Guadalupe quienes compraran borregos para criar y después venderlos mientras que Roció comprara Cerdos para crianza y venta de cerdos.
El lugar donde ellos viven es un lugar precioso lleva por nombre Yódense del cedro se caracteriza porque tienen una fiesta grande el día primero de noviembre que celebran día de muertos, es un lugar donde las casas son de madera. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron ya que el nombre lo eligieron porque quieren mejorar su calidad de vida de los clientes y para cada una de sus familias.
Doña Juna quien es la representante del grupo nos cuenta que tiene 48 años de edad está casada con el señor Félix desde hace 32 años quien trabaja en el campo quienes aun tiene un niño que depende de dicha pareja.
Doña Juana se dedica a la crianza de Borregos aunque también  tiene una tienda pequeña de abarrotes, y un molino de nixtamal.   Esta vez está solicitando el crédito para comprar 3 borregos y si le queda invertirá en su tienda para comprar cosas que le hacen falta.          
Nos cuenta que cuando inicio su actividad con los borregos  fue cuan recibió el crédito y de ahí pudo comprar sus borregos. Cuando inicio la tienda fue vendiendo dulces en una casa de madera y el molino lo inicio porque donde vive solo hay molinos de luz y el que ella tiene es de gasolina entonces cuando no habia luz no habia en donde moler el nixtamal.
Nos cuenta que la dificultad que presenta con sus borregos es cuando no tiene  agua potable y tienen que ir hasta el pozo para darles de beber agua.
La meta de doña Juana es mejorar su calidad de vida de ella y su familia también quiere tener más borregos y clientes para su tienda y molino ya que sus ganancias le sirven de mucho para solventar los gastos del hogar, para el pago con la institución.
Doña Juana y el resto del grupo están muy contentos y agradecidos con FRAC y KIVA por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
The group “To Live Better” is formed of two men and six women. They are very responsible and hard-working people. When we visited them they were very happy that their loans were authorized, meaning they could buy more animals. The following are the members of the group: Doña Alejandra, María del Carmen, Juana Cruz, Catalina, y Don Horacio y José Guadalupe. They will buy sheep to raise and sell. Roció  will buy pigs to raise and sell.
They live in a beautiful place called Yódense of the cedar. It is known for celebrating Day of the Dead the first of every November and the homes being made out of wood. They chose the name of the group because they want to improve their and their families’ lives.
Mrs. Juna who is the representative of the group is 48 years old, has been married to Mr. Félix for 32 years who works in the field, and are raising one son.
Mrs. Juna raises sheep for a living and has a grocery store and a grinder for mixtamal (corn dough). This time she was going to buy three sheep and if she has  any money left over she will buy merchandise to stock up her grocery store.
She started raising sheep with a loan she received. She started her grocery store business by selling candy in a wooden house and will invest in a gas grinder because the electric one could only run when there was electricity available to grind mixtamal.
The hardest part about raising sheep are providing them with portable water and having to take them to the well to drink.
Mrs. Juana’s goals are to improve her and her family’s life quality, have more sheep, have more clients for her store, and have a gas grinder to increase profits to pay for household expenditures and her loan.

loans.use: but 3 sheep

location.town: Yondece del Cedro, San Jose del Rincon.

loans.name: La Misericordia Group

texts.es:
La Misericordia es un grupo integrado por 8 personas, está ubicado en el municipio de Acatlán de Pérez Figueroa en el cual por ser municipio llega mucha gente de las comunidades cercanas y hay mucho comercio en sus avenidas principales.

La señora Rosa María tiene 54 años, solo estudio la secundaria,  es una madre soltera pero actualmente vive sola ya que sus hijos estan casados
Doña Rosa María es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual saco a delante a sus hijos y platica que hace 20 años tuvo la oportunidad de abrir su propio negocio de venta de regalos  en el centro de su comunidad, justo al lado del parque. El nombre de su tienda es "Novedades Rivera". Ella  habré su negocio todos los días desde muy temprano ya que piensa que esa es la clave del éxito, ella dijo: “el que madruga dios le ayuda”
Doña Rosa María tiene uno de los negocios más surtidos de su comunidad y siempre aprovecha las fechas importantes para vender productos de temporada por ejemplo el día de las madres vende trastes, flores, adornos para el hogar y el día del niño mucha variedad de juguetes, ella no deja pasar  ninguna oportunidad para surtirse de novedosos productos y  vender 
Doña Rosa Maria  necesita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de perfumes, joyería, juguetes, marcos de cuadros, bolsos, cosméticos y bolsas de regalo que ella puede vender en la tienda, aportando más ingresos para su familia y de negocios.
Ella quiere que su negocio continúe creciendo para así tener una mejor calidad de vida

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Rosa venta de cosméticos 
Adrian venta de tacos 
Martha  venta de antojitos mexicanos 
Teodulo venta de abarrotes
Esperanza venta de hot-dog y hamburgesas 
Rodolfo venta de rop a
Reyna venta de antojitos
texts.en:
Mercy is a group formed by 8 people and  is located in the Acatlán de Pérez Figueroa municipal. It is frequented by people from nearby communities and there is lots of commerce in the main streets. 
Mrs. Rosa María is 54 years old, studied until high school, was a single mom, and at the moment lives alone since her children have gotten married.
Mrs. Rosa María is a very hard-working woman who helped her children succeed. She tells us that 20 years ago she had the opportunity to start her own business by selling gifts in the central part of the community next to the park. She named her store “Rivera Novelties.” She opens her store every day very early in the morning because she believed that the key to success is in the old saying, “he who rises early God shall help.”
Mrs. Rosa María has the most stocked store in the community and takes the opportunity of selling seasonal products during the holidays. For example, on Mother's Day she will sell dinnerware, flowers, home decor, and on children’s day she sells a large variety of toys. She never lets an opportunity go to waste to stock up on more merchandise and sell.
Mrs. Rosa María needs to buy perfumes, jewelry, toys, picture frames, handbags, cosmetics, and gift bags to sell in her novelty store to increase income.
She wants her business to continue growing for a better life.


The other members of the groups are:
Rosa- sells cosméticos 
Adrian- sells tacos 
Martha- sells Mexican dishes
Teodulo- grocery sales
Esperanza – hotdog and hamburger sales 
Rodolfo- clothes sales
Reyna- sells meals

loans.use: merchandise for her store

loans.name: Las Buganbilias De Cochoapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre las buganbilias de cochoapa las personas que lo conforman decidieron ponerle este nombre porque en casa de la representante hay varios árboles de esta flor y también porque  así se llama la comunidad donde viven así se llama su comunidad, la historia es acerca de la señora María estela quien cuenta con 51 años de edad y está casada, ya todos sus hijos están casados, la comunidad donde vive se llama cochoapa un pueblo donde predomina el dialecto amusgo, una de sus principales actividades es la elaboración de  blusas, bisutería, monederos y bolsas de chaquira, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa de chaquira 
desde hace más de 4 años, todos los días dedica máximo 5 horas a coser ya que es una actividad desgastante para la vista ya que utilizan cuentas muy pequeñas.

Cuenta que decidió iniciar con este negocio porque desde niña veía como su mama cosía estas artesanías y le pidió que le enseñara, ya que le gusto mucho esta actividad, el préstamo que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de más material como son: telas, cuadrille, hilos, agujas y chaquira al mayoreo.

Doña María está muy contenta porque dice que le esta yendo muy bien con su negocio, ya que sus ventas van incrementado, por que ahora tiene un mejor surtido, tanto que está pensando en comprarse una licuadora.

La meta que tiene para su negocio es la de continuar invirtiéndole, también quiere comprar una máquina de coser, para agilizar su producción también dice que quiere empezar a vender refrescos. 

Esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los prestatatarios de kiva por el apoyo que le están brindando, ya que gracias a esta ayuda ha mejorado su vida y la de su familia.

Estos son los nombres de las personas y las actividades a las que se dedican cada una de las integrantes del grupo.
Isidra, Petronila, Leticia, María estela, gloria y aurora quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: elaboración de ropa de chaquira, farmacia, tienda de ropa, tienda artesanal, y cocina económica
texts.en:
This group is named Las Buganbilias de Cochoapa. The members chose this name because at the home of the representative there are a number of bougainvillea trees and Cochoapa is the name of the community where they live. 

Maria Estela, 51, is married and all of her children are also married already. She lives in Cochoapa, a town where the Amusgo dialect is used and many people work making blouses, jewelry, wallets and beaded bags. Maria Estela has been making beaded clothing for 4 years. Every day she sews for as much as 5 hours. It's an exhausting activity for her vision because they use very small beads. 

She says that she decided to start this business because since she was a child she watched how her mom sewed artisan crafts and asked that she taught her since she likes it a lot. The loan that she gets will be used to get more materials like fabric, pattern paper, needles, thread and beads in bulk. 

Maria is happy because she says that her business is going very well since her sales have increased because she has a better stock. She's thinking about buying a blender. 

Her goal for her business is to continue investing in it. She wants to buy a sewing machine to make her work easier and also wants to start selling sodas.

She's very grateful to the Fundacion Realidad and the Kiva lenders for the support that they are giving her. Thanks to this help she has improved her life and that of her family.

The group members are: Isidra, Petronila, Leticia, Maria Estela, Gloria and Aurora. The have businesses like making beaded clothing, pharmacy, selling clothing, selling crafts, and preparing food.

loans.use: to buy material like fabric, pattern paper, threads, needles and beads in bulk.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: Rukia is a resident of Kisauni, Kenya. She had previously applied for and received a Kiva loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings and has made a second Kiva application of KES 30,000. With the previous loan, she was able to expand her real estate houses. Rukia wants to purchase timber and cement to expand her rental houses. She believes this will give her a better competitive edge and unable her to open other types of businesses in the future.

loans.use: to purchase timber and cement to expand her rental houses.

loans.name: Ulziibayar

texts.en:
Ulziibayar is a 32-years-old married mother who has a son and a daughter and lives with her family in an outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia, where she lacks basic infrastructure. She supports her family by running a public transportation business.  

Her current business isn't profitable enough to her family and also running a public transportation business is very hard for a woman, thus she wants to operate another business.

Her sister-in-law has advised her to operate a business making building blocks, because nowadays people who live in the outer ger districts are really focused on their safety, so they are replacing their yard fences with blocks and are also covering their houses with blocks. 

First, Ulziibayar must purchase a building block making machine, therefore she requests 3,900,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT). Her goal in the future is to make good quality building blocks to sell in order to provide people with safety and better living condition. “With the help of this loan and the kind support of lenders, I can reach my goal” she said.

loans.use: to purchase a building block making machine

loans.name: La Capillita Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama la capillita los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre, porque cerca de su colonia hay una pequeña capilla de la virgen de Guadalupe, por eso lo nombraron de esta manera, esta historia es acerca de la señora julia, ya que una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella cuenta con 55 años de edad y está casada con el señor Paulo quien es campesino tienen 3 hijos, los cuales ya están casados, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva más de 25 años, vive en la comunidad de cuajinicuilapa en donde se encuentra el museo de las culturas afro-mestizos, antes conocido como el museo de la tercer raíz, es el primer museo en México dedicado a los descendientes de esclavos africanos en México y su historia.

Doña julia decidió iniciar con este negocio, ya que uno de sus hijos que vive en el extranjero le sugirió y apoyo para que pusiera esta pequeña tienda, va a invertir su crédito en la compra de mas mercancía como son: refrescos, leche, huevos, aceite, arroz, frijol, azúcar, nescafe, pasta dental, jabón papel higiénico, etc.

El sueño que ella tiene es el de continuar invirtiendo en su negocio para ampliar su local y tiene en mente iniciar con la venta de maíz, también quiere comprar otro refrigerador y comprar otros 2 estantes, para exhibir mas mercancía.

Comenta que está muy agradecida con fundación realidad y kiva por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgaron ya que gracias a esto su negocio empezara a mejorar, su vida y la de su familia también..

Las integrantes del grupo y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes: Lourdes- venta de quesos, maximina-dulcería, Leonila-venta de maíz, julia-abarrotes, Graciela-venta de refrescos, María Isabel-pollería, Elizabeth-venta de zapatos, Reyna-carnicería y Alfredo-deposito de refrescos.
texts.en:
This group is called La Capillita.  The members of the group decided to name it this because close to their town there is a small Virgin of Guadalupe chapel.  This is the story of Mrs. Julia, one of the members of the group.  She is 55 years old and married to Mr. Paulo who works in the countryside.  They have 3 children whom are already married.  She has a small grocery store which she has been working for the last 25 years.  She lives in the community of Cuajinicuilapa.  This is the community where the "Museum of Afro-Mestizo" cultures is located, which was previously known as the "Museum of the Third Race".  This is the first museum in Mexico dedicated to the descendents of the African slaves in Mexico and their history.  

Mrs. Julia decided to start with this business because one of her sons who lives abroad suggested it and supported her so that she could start the small store.  She will invest her loan into the purchase of more merchandise such as: soft drinks, milk, eggs, oil, rice, beans, sugar, nescafe, toothpaste, soap, toilet paper, etc.

The dream that she has is to continue investing in her business so that she can increase the size of her store.  She was also thinking of starting to sell corn, in addition to buying another refrigerator and two more shelves to display more merchandise. 

She mentions that she appreciates Fundacion Realidad and Kiva for their support and the loan which they are providing.  Thanks to the loan her business will start to improve, and so will her life and that of her family as well.  

The members of the group and the activities that they participate in consist of the following:  Lourdes - sells cheese; Maximina- sweet shop; Leonila - sells corn; Julia- groceries; Gracias - sells soft drinks; Maria Isabel- sells chicken; Elizabeth - sells shoes; Reyna - butcher shop; Alfredo - soft drink store.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of more merchandise such as: soft drinks, milk, eggs, oil, rice, beans, sugar, nescafe, toothpaste, soap, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Idimo

texts.ru: Идимо жительница района Дангара. Ей 57 лет. Она вдова. У нее пятеро детей. Идимо уже два года как занимается шитьем. Она берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки своей невестке, чтобы она научилась шитью и продолжила ее деятельность.
texts.en: Idimo lives in the Dangara Region. She is 57 years old. She is a widow. She has five children. For two years, Idimo has been working as a seamstress. She is taking out a loan in order to buy a sewing machine for her daughter-in-law, who will then learn sewing and continue her business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her daughter-in-law.

loans.name: Yurisan Vanessa

texts.es:
Yurisan es una mujer de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su pequeño hijo de 1 año, lastimosamente por diversas circunstancias se separó de su pareja; ella es una mujer muy empeñosa y trabajadora que ha podido superar las adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar un poco de música para relajarse; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no puedo cursar la carrera de enfermería que tanto quería, pero sueña con poder hacerlo algún día.
Gracias a su deseo de salir adelante y al apoyo de una buena amiga, Yurisan puso en marcha su negocio de venta de salchipapas, hamburguesas, así también se dedica a la venta de comida en general, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender buena cantidad de clientes, ella cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a su buena sazón, carisma y trato amable hacia sus clientes.
Yurisan se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cocina industrial, así como diversos utensilios de cocina, tales como: ollas, cubiertos, descartables, sartenes, manteles, entre otros, los cuales le servirán para acondicionar mejor su negocio; de esta manera podrá incrementar sus ingresos económicos y poco a poco Yurisan espera poder ahorrar lo suficiente para poder tener un restaurant amplio y con ello en un futuro no muy lejano desea tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Yurisan is a 28 year-old woman who lives in the city of Ica with her little 1 year-old son.  Sadly, due to a variety of circumstances, she separated from her partner.  She is a very hardworking woman who has managed to overcome the adversities that life has presented her. In her free time, she enjoys listening to a bit of music to relax.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, she was not able to pursue the nursing degree that she wanted, but she dreams of being able to do this someday.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, and the support of a good friend, Yurisan started up her business selling salchipapas (chicken and fried potatoes), hamburgers and food in general.  She works in her business about 10 hours a day, during which time she serves a good number of customers.  She believes that her business is doing well because of the good taste of her food, her charisma and the friendly service she gives her customers.  

Yurisan is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they are providing she will be able to buy an industrial stove, along with some kitchen utensils such as: pots, silverware, disposable dinnerware, pans, table cloths, and other items which she will use to better equip her business.  In this way she will be able to increase her income.  Yurisan hopes that little by little, she will be able to save enough money to have a big restaurant, which will give her the means, in the not too distant future, to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove

loans.name: Unidas Para Triunfar Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre unidas para triunfar los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre ya que dice que juntos en equipo lograran triunfar en todo lo que se proponen, el señor José quien forma parte de este grupo, cuenta con 46 años de edad y está casado con la señora Paula, tienen 3 hijos de los cuales solo Ricardo estudia, cursa el sexto año de primaria, el tiene un pequeño restaurante con el que lleva más de 25 años, vive en Ometepec guerrero.

Don José decidió iniciar con este pequeño negocio, porque trabajo varios años en un restaurante de cocinero y fue ahí donde aprendió, por eso decidió poner en práctica sus conocimientos para recibir un beneficio propio, el crédito que le otorgaron lo va a invertir en la compra de más insumos como son: carne, rábanos, cebollas, cilantro, aceite, sal, tortillas, etc.

Ella desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y así poder hacerlo crecer mucho mas, y así mejorar sus ventas e ingresos, también necesita comprar más utensilios de cocina y  una parrilla.

Esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios de kiva y con Fundación realidad, ya que gracias a ellos esta saliendo adelante y ha podido tener su propio negocio.

Otras de las compañeras de don José son: Laura, socorro, minerva, candelaria, lucia, Sofía y Nancy, quienes realizan variadas actividades como son: tienda de ropa, farmacia, restaurante, panadería, abarrotes, venta de zapatos, artículos para el hogar y venta de cosméticos
texts.en:
This group is called “United in Order to Triumph” as the members of the group will triumph together in whatever they undertake. Mr. Jose is a member of this group. He is 46 years old and is married to Mrs. Paula. They have three children. Only Richard is a student. He is in sixth grade. Jose has had a small restaurant for the past 25 years. He lives in Ometepec, Guerrero.
Mr. Jose decided to begin this small business as he had previously worked for several years as a cook. This is how he learned the restaurant business. He decided to use his knowledge for his own benefit. This loan that he is requesting will be used to buy more supplies such as: meat, radishes, onions, coriander, oil, salt, tortillas, etc.
He decided to continue to invest in his business so that it can grow further. His sales and investment will improve. He also needs to buy more kitchen utensils and a grill.
He is very thankful to the lenders from KIVA and to the Reality Foundation. Thanks to them he is able to progress and have his own business.
Mr. Jose’s other companions are Laura (first aid), Minerva (candle making), Lucia, Sofia and Nancy who do other types of businesses such as a clothing store, a pharmacy, a restaurant, a bakery, a grocery store, a shoe store, a housewares store and cosmetic sales.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of more supplies such as meat, radishes, onions, cilantro, oil, salt, tortillas, etc.

loans.name: Valentin Felix

texts.es:
Valentín es un hombre de 28 años, soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, conocida por los famosos geoglifos de las Líneas de Nazca, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar un poco de música para relajarse y en algunas ocasiones prepara uno de sus platos favoritos como es el delicioso “Puré con Bistek”; Valentín siempre ha sido un hombre muy emprendedor que ha trabajado desde muy joven, él culminó sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria pero sueña con poder estudiar la carrera de Agronomía.
Gracias a su entusiasmo y al apoyo de su Padre, quien le cedió una parte de su terreno agrícola para que lo trabaje, Valentín puso en marcha su negocio de cultivo de tuna, el trabaja un aproximado de 10 horas diariamente, él se siente muy a gusto con su negocio ya que siempre le ha gustado el campo y el trabajo que se realiza en el. 
Valentín se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la infesta de cochinilla a todo su cultivo de tuna, de esta manera podrá aprovechar la estación y obtendrá abundante cría de cochinilla, así cuando la cosecha de su cultivo terminé, podrá obtener buenas ganancias de las ventas realizadas, favoreciendo de esta manera a que poco a poco Valentín pueda cumplir su gran sueño de poder estudiar la carrera de Agronomía y obtener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Valentín is a 28 year old man.  He is single and lives in the city of Nazca, which is well-known for the famous geoglyphs of the Nazca Lines.  In his free time, he enjoys listening to a little music to relax, and sometimes he prepares one of his favorite dishes such as the delicious “Puré con Bistek”.

Valentín has always been a very enterprising man, who has been working ever since he was very young.  He completed high school, but unfortunately hasn't been able to attend university due to lack of resources.  However, he dreams of being able to study for an Agricultural Science degree.

Thanks to his enthusiasm and the support of his father, who gave him part of his farmland for him to work, Valentín has been able to get his business farming prickly pear cacti underway.  He works approximately 10 hours a day.  He is very happy with his business has he has always enjoyed the fields and the work he does there.

Valentín is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help provided he will be able to establish cochineal bugs throughout his prickly pear cactus crop.  In this way he will be able to take advantage of the season and have an abundant breeding of cochineal bugs, so that when his harvest of his crops is complete, he will be able to obtain good earnings from the sales he has made.  Favoring this approach is how Valentín will little by little be able to accomplish his main dream of being able to study for a degree in Agricultural Science and obtain his own home.

loans.use: to establish cochineal bugs throughout his prickly pear cactus crop

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
En el municipio Larreynaga  departamento de León, La señora María, se Desempeña como maestro de primaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 14 años, es Soltera con 6 hijo a los que tiene que proporcionarle las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.
Una de las necesidades que la  señora  María atraviesa, es la necesidad de mejorar sus condiciones de su vivienda ya que quiere seguirla mejorando, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como Hierro 3/8,  Hierro ¼ , Zinc, Ladrillo Bloques, Alambre de Amarre, Clavos, Cemento y Reglas.  para realizar las mejora en la casa,  y crearles mejores condiciones y nivel de vida a su familia
texts.en:
In the Larreynaga municipality in the department of León, Señora María works as a primary school teach in a small municipal school.  She has been doing this work for the last 14 years.  She is single, with six children for whom she has to provide the conditions necessary for their development.

One of the needs that Señora María faces is the need to improve the condition of her home, which she wants to continue improving.  This is why she has taken the decision to come to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of construction materials such as 3/8 inch iron, 1/4 inch iron, corrugated roofing, brick blocks, wire ties, nails, cement and the necessary paperwork.  These are to make the improvements to her home, and to create better conditions and living standards for her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as 3/8 inch iron, 1/4 inch iron, corrugated roofing, brick blocks, wire ties, nails, cement and the necessary paperwork

loans.name: America Yasmina

texts.es:
La señora America es originaria de Granada, casada, tiene cuatro hijos los cuales son mayores de edad, se dedica al comercio específicamente a la venta de productos derivados de la leche como queso, crema, mantequilla, entre otros. Inicio su actividad porque vio la necesidad de apoyar en la manutención y generación de ingresos para su hogar ya que necesitaba tener un mejor nivel económico. Ella tenia 31 años cuando inicio con este negocio el  cual desarrolla sola pues no tiene apoyo de nadie comercializando sus productos en la misma comunidad y en los alrededores del bello departamento de Granada, tiene otros ingresos los provenientes de la venta de lotería que realiza el esposo, se siente satisfecha en el lugar donde se encuentra pues cuenta con buena clientela.

Su crédito lo solicito para comprar queso crema, mantequilla, queso seco. Este préstamo le permitirá incrementar su negocio con más variedades de productos  obteniendo más ganancias para tener un mejor nivel Económico, sus planes a futuro es mantener su negocio para ofrecerle a sus clientes productos de calidad y poder satisfacer sus necesidades.
texts.en:
America is from Granada.  She is married and has four grown children.  She works in commerce, specifically in the sale of products derived from milk such as cheese, cream, and butter, among others.  She began this activity because she saw the need to help in the maintenance and generation of income for her home since she needed to have a better economic level.  She was 31 when she began this business which has grown on its own since she didn't have help from anyone in commercializing her products in the same community and in the surrounding areas of the beautiful department of Granada.  She has other income from her husband's sale of lottery tickets.  She feels satisfied with the place that she finds herself in since she has a good customer base.  

She is requesting a loan to buy cream cheese, butter and dry cheese.  This loan will allow her to grow her business with a greater variety of products, increasing her earnings to have a better economic level.  Her plans for the future are to maintain her business to offer to her customers quality products and to be able to meet their needs.

loans.use: to buy cream cheese, butter and dry cheese.

loans.name: San Miguel Arcangel Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama san miguel arcángel los integrantes eligieron este nombre porque todos son devotos a este santo y confían en que él los ayudara para que todo salga bien, la señora delfina cuenta con 51 años de edad y está casada con el señor tranquilino ya que también forma parte de este grupo, tiene 3 hijos los cuales cursan segundo y tercer año de prepa y el menor tercer año de secundaria, ella tiene un taller de costura con el cual lleva 6 años.

Dice que decidió empezar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar la manera de sacar a sus hijos adelante y ofrecerles una mejor educación y calidad de vida, el crédito que le otorgaron lo va a invertir en la compra de 
Hilos, tela, botones, cierres, agujas, manta, elásticos al mayoreo.

La meta que se tiene doña delfina es la de hacer crecer mucho más su negocio, estar invirtiendo constantemente para contar con una amplio surtido, también quiere ahorrar para compra otra máquina de coser y darle trabajo a alguien que lo necesite.

Le da las gracias a FRAC y Kiva por la ayuda brindada ya que por a ello ha podido lograr hacer crecer poco a poco su negocio y así cambiar su vida y la de su familia.

Otros de los compañeros de doña delfina son: Felipa, marciana y Antonio quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como: deposito de refrescos, pollería y abarrotes.
texts.en:
This group is called “The Angel of St. Michael”. The members chose this name because they are devoted to this saint. They are confident that he will help them to succeed. Mrs. Delfina is 51 years old and married to a calm man who is also part of the group. They have three children. The oldest two are in their second and third year of college preparatory school. The youngest is in the third year of secondary school. Mrs. Delfina has been a seamstress for the past six years.
She decided to start this business in order to help her children succeed. She wanted to offer them a good education and a good quality of life. The loan that she is requesting will be used to purchase thread, buttons, closures, needles, blankets and elastic at the wholesale level.
Mrs. Delfina’s goal is to grow her business considerably. She is constantly investing in her business in order to have a good assortment of products. She would like to save and buy another sewing machine and give work to another person that needs work. 
She gives thanks to FRAC and KIVA for the assistance they have provided. Because of this assistance she has been able to grow her business little by little and change the life of her family.
Her other companions are: Felipa, Marciana and Antonio who work at different activities such as a drink stand, a grocery store and a poultry shop.

loans.use: to buy thread, buttons, closures, needles, blankets and elastic at the wholesale level.

loans.name: Mirtalia De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Mirtalia de los Angeles, es una comerciante  que vende ropa interior en uno de los mercados de Managua, ha tenido 23 créditos con ceprodel, inicio desde el 2005.es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora, en donde labora diario desde las seis de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde, con los créditos  le ha permitido incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes, también los financiamientos con la institución
 Le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda y  llevar el sustento a su hogar. Solicita el  préstamo para la compra de   ropa interior y trajes para damas, Se siente agradecida con ceprodel, por la confianza depositada en ella, con los préstamos por que esto le ha permitido  mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Mirtalia de los Angeles is a businesswomen who sells underwear in one of the markets of Managua.  She has had 23 loans from Ceprodel, beginning in 2005.  She is an entrepreneurial and hard-working person.  She works daily from six in the morning until five in the afternoon.  The loans have allowed her to increase the variety of products that she offers to her clients.  The loans with the institution have also allowed her to improve her house and bring support to her home.  She is requesting this loan to buy underwear and dresses for ladies.  She is thankful to Ceprodel for the confidence placed in her.  The loans have allowed her to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy underwear and dresses for ladies.

loans.name: Perla Esmeralda

texts.es: Perla es una sencilla madre que vive en el departamento de Granada, casada, tiene tres hijos los que actualmente estudian. Ella se dedica al comercio a la venta de Ropa actividad que inicio a los 27 años de edad al sentirse apoyada por su esposo para que pudiera tener un negocio propio, ya que el es zapatero y tiene su propio negocio, siendo este su primer negocio anteriormente apoyaba a su esposo en el taller. Ella comercializa su producto en Granada, tiene otros ingresos los provenientes del negocio de zapatería que tiene su esposo. Solicito el crédito para comprar mercadería para la temporada del día de las madres como: blusas, zapatos, jean y faldas. Ella estima que el crédito le ayudara porque podrá surtir su negocio que le permitirá incrementar las ventas mejorando asi mismo sus ingresos ya que sus planes a futuro son tener un negocio mas estable y seguro para ofrecer una mejor presentación de su tramo, su meta próxima es seguir trabajando  para salir adelante y para cumplir las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Perla is a straightforward mother who lives in the department of Granada.  She has three children who are currently in school.  She works in retail selling clothing, an activity that she began when she was 27 to feel helpful to her husband by having her own business, as he is a cobbler and has his own business himself.  This is her first business as previously she helped out her husband in his workshop.  Perla sells her products in Granada, and has additional income provided by her husband's shoe business.

She is requesting this loan to purchase seasonal merchandise for Mothers' Day, such as blouses, shoes, jeans and skirts.  She expects the loan to help her because she will be able to stock up her business, which will allow her to increase her sales, improving her income at the same time.  Her plans for the future are to have a more stable and secure business so as to use her space for better presentation.  Her next goal is to continue working so that she can get ahead in life and meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise for Mothers' Day, such as blouses, shoes, jeans and skirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase coffee plants and to work at clearing his land.

loans.name: Mia Es La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mía es la Victoria está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Jesenia inicio hace 5 años con la venta de ropa y con las ganancias y los créditos empezó a vender comida. El crédito lo invertirá en la adquisición de trastes para aumentar su negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Jesica vende comida, pupusas y sandalias y María Luisa vende ropa usada, bisutería y prendas de oro y plata desde hace 19 años.
texts.en: The group, "Mía es la Victoria" [Victory is Mine] is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women.  One of them is Jesenia, who started her business selling clothing 5 years ago.
