MADAME MARIAMA QUI EST A LA DROITE DE LA PHOTO LEVANT LA MAIN ET L'EMPRUNTEUR EN VEDETTE. ELLE EST MARIÉE ET MÈRE DE CINQ ENFANTS. ELLE EST ÂGÉE DE 53 ANS.

AVEC CE PRÊT ELLE VA ACHETER DES LÉGUMES DANS LES MARCHES ENVIRONNANT POUR LES REVENDRE A COTE DE CHEZ ELLE OU ELLE DISPOSE UNE ÉTALE.

ELLE RENOUVELLE CHAQUE SEMAINE SONT STOCK COMPOSE DE 5KG D OGNON ET 2 PALETTES DE JUMBO ET CUBE MAGIE.

LES BÉNÉFICES TIRES DE SON ACTIVITÉ SERVIRONS A NOURRIR SA FAMILLE ET A PAYER LE SCOLARITÉ DE SES ENFANTS
texts.en:
These women are part of the members of the banc villageois "Boucotte sud nema", created on the 7th of June, 2001. They live in the same area and are small retailers.

Mariama, on the right of the picture, with her hand raised, is the featured borrower. She is 53 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She will use this loan to buy vegetables at the surrounding markets so that she can resell them near her home, where she has a stall. She restocks each week with 5 kgs of onions and 2 pallets of Jumbo and Magie (stock) cubes. The profits from her business will be used to feed her family and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Bartolome

texts.es: Bartolomé de sesenta años de edad vive junto a su familia, en su humilde casa en zona rural, él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz, maicillo, frijol, huerta de guineos; tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le ayuda a obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a la localidad donde reside, comercia en todas las zonas aledañas, tiene mucha clientela pues saben que todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Bartolomé es una buena persona, trabajador, honesto y responsable, cualquier vecino da buenas referencias de él, es muy visionario y desea un futuro próspero por eso quiere esforzarse al máximo; en este periodo de siembra quiere aumentar la producción  pues solo así aumentará las ganancias. Para invertir en insumos necesita de capital por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar una bomba achicadora de agua, necesaria para extraer agua y la cual ingeniosamente pretende ocupar para regadillo de sus cultivos, semilla de maíz, frijol, abonos y herbicidas. Bartolomé tiene buen record crediticio, recibe remesas de un hijo que se encuentra en el extranjero por lo que garantiza que podrá saldar su deuda y a la vez podrá darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Bartolomé is 70 years old and lives with his family in their humble home in the rural area.  He works in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of corn, sorghum, beans, and a banana garden.  He has worked in this field for many years and he has a lot of experience that helps him obtain great harvests.  The land that he cultivates is in the area best known for agriculture and very close to the area in which he resides.  He sells his products in all of the surrounding areas and he has many customers that know his products are the best quality at the lowest prices.  Also, he provides excellent service.

Bartolomé is a good person, a hard-worker, and an honest and responsible man.  All of his neighbors give him great references.  He is a visionary and wants a prosperous future, and because of this, he puts all of his strength into his work.  In the current planting season he wants to increase his production so that he can increase his income.

In order to invest in the supplies he needs, he is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL.  With it, he will buy a water pump that is necessary to extract water from the land and with which he will ingeniously use for the irrigation of his crops.  He will also buy corn seeds, beans, fertilizers and herbicides.

Bartolomé has a great credit history and he receives remittances from a son that is abroad (so it is certain that he can pay off his loan). He will also be able to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to extract water, and to buy corn seeds, beans, fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Bakhlul

texts.en:
Bakhlul, 47 years old, lives in a small village in the Kartli Region with his wife Kapaiat, who is a pensioner. They earn their living through a dairy farm with three milking cows from which they produce cheese and curds. Part of the milk products are used by the family, and the rest is sold locally.

They also have a plot of land upon which they grow various vegetables. Bakhlul and Kapaiat are especially busy with the plot during the spring and summer seasons in order to ensure a good harvest in late summer which they sell on the local open market. Their total average monthly income is 700 Lari.

Bakhlul is now requesting a loan to purchase calves to raise and later sell for a profit. He will reinvest the additional earnings to expand their agricultural enterprise to make it more profitable, thereby improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Ngekhokh Coin Sidy Group

texts.fr:
ce banc villageois a été créé le 01/09/2008.les femme habitent le même quartier,elles sont unies part des liens sociaux et font toutes le commerce.
Madame coumba est une femme marié et âgée de 55 ans , elle est mère de 11 enfants dont 3 garçon et 8 filles; son ainé a 38 ans .elle est restauratrice dans le garage de la ville, et avec ce crédit de 140000f elle compte acheter des condiments( riz,gaz,huile,oignon et pomme de terre)quelle va stoker pou les repas quelle vend
( déjeuner et diner)
Avec ses bénéfices elle parvient a payer le logement de sa fille qui est a l'université et aide son fils qui est avec sa femme et qui ne travail pas.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" was created on the 1st of September, 2008. The women live in the same district and are united by social bonds. They are all retailers.

Coumba is a 55-year-old married woman. She is the mother of 11 children, 3 boys and 8 girls. Her eldest child is 38 years old. Coumba is a restaurateur with a business located in the town's garage, and she plans to use this loan of 140 000 francs to buy condiments (rice, oil, onions and potatoes) and gas that she will store and use to make the meals that she sells (lunch and diner). Her profits enable her to pay for her daughter's university accommodation, and to help her son who is married and unemployed.

loans.use: to buy condiments and gas.

loans.name: Ngekhokh Coin Sidy Group

texts.fr:
ce banc villageois a été créé le 01/09/2008.les femmes habitent le même quartier.Elle sont unies par des liens sociaux et font toutes le commerce .
Madame Ndeye Ndombour est mariée et âgée de 54 ans,elle est mère de 9 enfants dont 3 garçons et 6 filles,son ainé a 37 ans .Elle fait du commerce de mil et d’arachide quelle achète dans le basin arachide et revend ca dans le marché. son nouveau prêt de 500000f lui permettra d'acheter 1 tonne de mil et une tonne d'arachide.
avec ses bénéfice elle aide son mari âgé de 84 ans qui ne peu plu rien faire. elle parvient aussi a payer la scolarité de 3 de ses filles dont la plus grande est a l"université.
texts.en:
This banc villageois was created on the 1st of September, 2008. The women all live in the same district. They are united by social bonds and are all retailers.

Ndeye Ndombour is 54 years old and married. She is the mother of 9 children, 3 boys and 6 girls. Her eldest child is 37 years old. She sells millet and groundnuts that she buys in the Groundnut Basin and resells at the market. Her new loan of 500 000 francs will allow her to buy a ton of millet and a ton of groundnuts. She uses her profits to help her 84-year-old husband who is no longer able to do anything. She also manages to pay for the education of 3 of her daughters, the eldest of whom is at university.

loans.use: to buy millet and groundnuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy used clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Zakhid

texts.en:
Zakhid, 50 years old, lives in a small village with his wife Minara, brother, sister-in-law, son and three nephews, the latter of whom study in the village school. The family earns its living through an agricultural business consisting of 400 sheep, 250 lambs, 4 milking cows and 22 calves.

The family works hard throughout each day and takes good care of their livestock. They produce cheese, curds, and yogurt, selling them on the local open market. They also sell lambs in spring. Total average monthly income of the family is 2000 Lari.

Zakhid is requesting a loan to rent mowing land, a measure that will decrease his dairy farm costs as he will make hay from the mowed grass for his livestock, thereby avoiding expensive purchases for feed. The loan will result in an increased family income which will be used to expand his enterprise, ultimately leading to better family living conditions.

loans.use: to rent agricultural land in the village.

loans.name: Ps1 Ngekhokh Coin Sidy Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été créé le 01/09/2008.les femme habitent le même quartier,elle son unies par des liens sociaux et pratiquent la même activité.
Madame Anna est une femme marié et est âgée de 43 ans,elle est mère de 4 enfant dont 2 garçon et 2 filles, l'ainé a 21 ans et fait une formation en hôtellerie.
Elle fait du commerce de tissu de parfum et de chaussures,et avec son prêt de 250000F elle compte aller dans les pays voisins pour acheter des tissu léger et compléter sa commande de chaussure qui va arrivé dans quelque jours.
Avec ses bénéfices elle épargne dans le banc villageois et paie la formation de sa fille; elle arrive aussi a satisfaire ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
This banc villageois was created on the 1st of September, 2008. The women all live in the same district. They are united by social bonds and all have the same type of business.

Anna is 43 years old, married and the mother of 4 children; 2 boys and 2 girls. The eldest child is 21 years old and is following a hotel business training course. Anna sells fabric, perfumes and shoes and plans to use her loan of 250 000 francs to travel to neighbouring countries to buy light fabrics, as well as to complete her order of shoes which will arrive in a few days. She uses her profits to build up her savings in the banc villageois and to pay for her daughter's education. She also manages to take care of her own needs.

loans.use: to buy shoes, perfumes and fabrics.

loans.name: Violence

texts.en:
Violence, a 50-year-old business lady, is married to John, a businessman, and they are blessed with five children. Violence has been a tailor for the past two years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000 which she uses to support her family.

Having repaid her previous loan, Violence is requesting her second one from KADET to buy cloth materials and a sewing machine. She will put the anticipated additional profits toward the education of her children, and in the future hopes to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy cloth materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Aby's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été crée depuis le 02/09/2008. Il regroupe des femmes d'un même quartier et des quartiers 

environnants. Les membres qui le composent sont unis par des liens sociaux.

Elles s'activent toutes dans le petit commerce.

Madame Aby est une femme veuve âgée de 86 et mère de 3 enfants .

Elle fait une petite activité de commerce de savon vu son age très avancé.

Son nouveau crédit de 80000f lui permettra de se procurer au près de son bailleurs .

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettent d'aider ses petits fils dans la prise en charge de certains de 

leurs besoins financiers.
texts.en:
This banc villageois was created on the 2nd of September, 2008. It groups together women from the same district and surrounding neighbourhoods. The members who make up the group are united by social bonds and are all small retailers.

Aby is an 86-year-old widow and the mother of 3 children. Because of her advanced age, she is a small retailer of soap. Her new loan of 80 000 francs will enable her to buy supplies from her landlord. The profits from her business allow her to help her grandsons to take care of some of their financial needs.

loans.use: to buy soap.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a mother of eight children between 15 and 5 years old and a farmer. She has been carrying out mixed farming in her rural home in Kitale, Western Kenya, for six years and produces maize and beans.

Beatrice has taken a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow and venture into dairy farming. Beatrice says the major part of her farming income will go into educating her children and expand her farming business in all aspects. She has high hopes she will succeed in her farming.

She says that poor infrastructure and price fluctuations -- especially for milk -- remain her major challenges.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kivanga

texts.en:
Kivanga is a 54-year-old businessman, married to Nzilani, who is a business lady. They are blessed with three children. 

He has been running an electronics shop for the past five years with the monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Kivanga will use the loan to purchase more stock of electric wires and sockets. With the anticipated profit from the loan, he will save towards the education of his children. 

He hopes to boost his business and open different electronics branches.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of electric wires and sockets.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 25 years old and married. 

He runs a taxi business to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.
  
He hopes to grow his business and employ people. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to repair his vehicle.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, 29, is married and has three children.  

He makes necklaces using beads made from bones. He has been in the business for two years.  

He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills. He hopes to grow his business and employ people.  

He has requested 20,000 KES to buy bones for making necklaces.

loans.use: To buy bones for making necklaces.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua, 47, is married and has four children.  

He runs a carpentry business to earn a living. He has been in the business from 1996. He also does welding to earn extra income.  

He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills. He hopes to grow his business and employ people. He has requested 20,000 KES to buy timber.

loans.use: To buy timber.

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly is 40 years old, married and has two children.  

She runs a computer college to earn a living. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.
  
She hopes to grow the college so as to get more students. She has requested 100,000 KES to buy computers.

loans.use: To buy computers.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married and has two children who both go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). Her monthly expenses include rent, utility bills and school fees. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  

She has a business of selling used clothes. She has been in this business for ten years and works seven days a week. She works at the market and sells to all categories on retail. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity.  

She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of used clothes. She is aspiring to import used clothes from Mombasa and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Keneth

texts.en:
Keneth is married and has a 12-year-old child.  

He runs a taxi business to earn a living. He has been in the business for only one year. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.
  
He hopes to grow his business and employ people. He has requested 20,000 KES to repair his vehicle.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a 29-year-old single woman. For the past four years, Noor has been a wedding planner, which has been a profitable project, but she needs more support to cover the costs of buying new supplies.

Noor is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing supplies she needs to complete her work arrangements, such as chair and table covers, flowers and accessories. This will improve her work, which will attract customers and lead to increase the size of her business and improve her income.

Noor is photographed in a wedding hall.

loans.use: To purchase party supplies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 23-year-old businessman who is single, but he supports his parents. He has been running a retail shop for the past year and earns a monthly income of KES 9,000, which he uses to cater to his basic needs. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. John will use the loan to add to his stock of sugar, rice, and cooking oil. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his siblings. 

In the future, he hopes to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add to his stock of sugar, rice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 51-year-old mixed crop farmer, and she is a single mother of four children. She has been in the farming business for the past three years and earns a monthly income of KES 9,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Margaret will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from her business, she will educate her children. 

She hopes to export her farm products.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 43-year-old businesswoman who is married and blessed with two children. She has been a tailor for the past three years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family. 

Mary is applying for her fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Mary will use the loan amount to buy fabric and a sewing machine. With the anticipated profits from her tailoring business, she will educate her children. 

Mary hopes to open a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 58-year-old businessman who is married to Teresiah, a farmer. They are blessed with five children. 

Peter has been operating a motorcycle transport business as his primary source of income and a dairy-farming business as a secondary source of income for the past four years. He earns a monthly income of KES 7,000, which he uses to support his family. 

Peter is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Peter will use part of the loan amount to service his motorbike and the rest to buy animal feed. 

With the profits from the two businesses, he hopes to educate his children at the university level and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To service his motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, leader du groupe d’affaire «Ujumbe », est jeune entrepreneur ambitieux, âgée de 35  ans, mère de 6 jeunes enfants, qui étudient encore à l’école primaire. Elle est  vendeuse de ciments et matériaux de construction.  Son mari est maitre maçon. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un dépôt situé au long de boulevard ULPGL. Il y a 8 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  9 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  40 sacs de ciments  à marchander.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et agrandir son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: The client, who is the leader of the Ujumbe business group, is an ambitious young entrepreneur. She is 35 years old and mother of six young children who are still at primary school. She sells cement and construction materials. Her husband is a master mason. She sets up her merchandise in a warehouse located on the ULPGL Boulevard. She has been working in the field of small income generating activities for over eight years. However, she has just fulfilled nine loan cycles with Hekima. This new credit will enable her to stock up with 40 sacks of cement for trading. In addition, she wishes to see her children grow up comfortably and enlarge her business. The client thanks Hekima for their support for poor women who are excluded from classic banking establishments.

loans.use: to buy 40 sacks of cement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a cow

loans.name: Entusa

texts.es:
Entusa tiene 60 años, es una mujer sencilla y bondadosa. Vive en compañía de Julio, su esposo, con el que tiene nueve hijos, de los cuales sólo viven con Antonia, la menor. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en la localidad de Chacas.  
Junto a su esposo trabajan las tierras que durante años de esfuerzo lograron adquirir. Sus principales productos son: maíz, habas, cebada y alverja. Los que fertilizan, riegan y extraen la maleza desde las primeras horas del día, hasta el último rayo del sol. En cada cosecha y con el apoyo de sus hijos, trasladan los productos a la ciudad, donde los comercializan en el mercado principal. Asimismo, posee cerdos y ovejas, que alimenta para su propio consumo, además de las dos vacas que posee que producen la leche que consume, así sostiene su alimentación. Su mayor deseo es seguir sembrando, le gusta mucho, por ello juntará más capital para seguir sembrando en más cantidad. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Sumaq Sonqo” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que podrá mejorar su negocio. Por ello, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues le gusta trabajar en su asociación, donde todos son personas responsables y solidarias.
Entusa invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de maíz.
texts.en:
Entusa, age 60, is an unassuming and kindhearted woman.  She lives with her husband, Julio, and they have nine children.  Only her youngest child lives with her.  She lives in her own house in Chacas.

She and her husband work the fields, which took years of great effort to manage to get.  Her main products are corn, beans, barley, and peas.  They fertilize, water, and weed them from the early morning hours until the last ray of sunshine.  During each harvest, and with help from their children, they take the products to the city, where they sell them at a main market.

They also have pigs and sheep that they raise for their own consumption.  They also have two cows that produce milk that they consume.  That is how the keep up with their food needs.  Her greatest wish is to continue planting; she likes it a lot.  Therefore, she will get together more capital in order to continue planting in greater quantities.

She belongs to the Sumaq Sonqo communal bank, and this is their third loan with MFP.  She appreciates the opportunity they have given her because she will be able to improve her business.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments.  She likes working with her communal bank where everyone is responsible and supportive.

She will use the requested money to buy natural fertilizers to spread among her corn plants.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers to spread among her corn plants.

loans.name: Muterian

texts.en:
Muterian is 64 years old and married. He supports a family of five. He has been farming wheat and maize for the last 22 years, earning a monthly income of KES 40,000. 

This will be Muterian's fifth loan from KADET. He will use the money to purchase farm inputs, including hybrid planting seeds and fertilizers, and to pay for farm labor. He expects a better yield, which will enable him to earn more profits. With this money, he will be able to diversify by purchasing livestock for fattening and later reselling. 

Muterian hopes to have a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, including hybrid planting seeds and fertilizers, and to pay for farm labor.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 48-year-old businessman who is married to Nancy, a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with three children. 

Joseph has been operating a motorcycle transport business for the past 10 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family. 

Joseph is applying for his fifth loan with KADET, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Joseph will use the loan to buy another motorbike. With the anticipated profits from the business, he will educate his children. 

In the future, he hopes to buy a taxi car.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Cayin

texts.es:
Cayin tiene 23 años, es un joven trabajador que vive en compañía de Ana maría, su esposa, con la que tiene dos hijas (Nayely y Kelly), a las que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en el pueblo de Chaccas.    
Desde muy pequeño aprendió a cuidar la tierra y vivir de ella, además que tuvo que afrontar la responsabilidad de tener una familia muy joven. Su principal siembra es el maíz y el zapallo, los cuales cuida con mucha dedicación, ya que no cuenta con terrenos propios, por ello trabaja en sociedad; es decir, recibe las tierras agrícolas de una persona con la condición de que él la produzca, cuide y fertilice. Por ello, es muy dedicado y como es un joven con iniciativa, busca sus propios compradores, quienes llegan a sus mismos terrenos a negociar los productos ya maduros. A su vez, trabaja arando la tierra, pues su juventud le brinda la fuerza que necesita para dirigir a los toros, ahí recibe un dinero extra que le ayuda en su economía. 

Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Sarita colonia” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que podrá mejorar su negocio. Por ello, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues le gusta trabajar en su grupo, donde todos son personas responsables y solidarias.
Cayin invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales y semilla de maíz para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Cayin is 23 years old, and he is a hard-working young man.  He lives with his wife, Ana María, and their two daughters, Nayaly and Kelly.  They take care of the children in their own house in the town of Chacas.

When he was very young he learned how to take care of the land and to live from it.  Also, he had to face the responsibility of having a family when he was very young.

His main crops are corn and squash.  He takes care of them with great devotion.  He does not now have his own land.  Therefore, he works in a parnership, which is to say that he gets farm land from a person on the condition that he produces on it, cares for it, and fertilizes it.  He is very devoted, and as a young man with initiative, he seeks out his own buyers.  The buyers come to these fields to negotiate  for the now mature products.  In turn, he works plowing the land.  His youth gives him the strength he needs to direct the bulls.  This way he gets extra money that helps him with his finances.

He belongs to the Sarita Colonia communal bank, and this is their second loan with MF.  He is grateful for the opportunity they are giving him because he will be able to improve his business.  He pledges to be punctual with his payments.  He likes working in his communal bank where everyone is responsible and supportive.

He will use the requested money to buy natural fertilizers and corn seeds for the next planting.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers and corn seeds for the next planting.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 36-year-old business lady who is married to Paul, a mixed crop farmer, and they are blessed with three children. She has been running a boutique shop as a primary business and is also a mixed crop farmer, which is her secondary business, for the past three years with the monthly income of 10,000 KES which she uses to support her family. 

Regina has requested a loan from KADET which she will use to restock her boutique shop and to buy seedlings for planting on their farm. With the anticipated profit from the businesses she will buy fertilizers. 

She hopes to educate her children up to university level and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to restock her boutique shop and buy seedlings for planting on her farm.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 27 años, su esposo es Eduardo, con quien tiene tres hijos menores, a los que cuida en su casa propia ubicada en el anexo de 2 de mayo.  
Sus terrenos se encuentran a una hora de distancia del pueblo, ellos construyeron su casita muy cerca para poder cuidar sus terrenos agrícolas y sus sembríos, los cuales constan de papa y maíz. Aún no cuentan con terrenos propios, por eso alquilan extensas áreas, por un año, de esa manera ya no se preocupan de pagar el arriendo de manera mensual. Junto a su esposo cuida, fertilizan y riegan sus sembríos, los dos trabajan, pues ambos toman decisiones importantes acerca de sus cultivos. “En la cosecha, viajamos a la ciudad, donde vendemos nuestros productos”, comenta. Así también, mientras cuida de sus sembríos, pasta a sus animales (cerdos y ovejas), los que le sirven de alimento, la vida en el campo le gusta mucho.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Sumaq Sonqo” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que podrá mejorar su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues le gusta trabajar en su asociación, donde todos son personas responsables y solidarias.
Rosa invertirá el dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en su próxima siembra de maíz.
texts.en:
Rosa is 27 years old.  Her husband is Eduardo, with whom she has three young children, whom she cares for in her own home.  Her fields are found an hour away from the town.  They built their little home very close so that they would be able to take care of their agricultural lands and their fields, which are sown with potatos and corn.  They still do not own their own land, and so they rent extensive areas by the year, and in this way they don't have to worry about paying a monthly lease.  Together with her husband, she takes care of, fertilizes, and waters their crops.  They both work and both make important decisions about their crops.  "For the harvest, we travel to the city, where we sell our products," she comments.  In addition, while she is taking care of her crops, she puts her animals (pigs and sheep) out to graze.  She loves the life in the country.  

She belongs to the community group "Sumaq Sonqo" and this is her third loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the opportunity that they are offering her, since she will be able to improve her business.  For this, she promises to be punctual with her monthly payments.  She enjoys working in her group, where all are responsible and committed to one another.

Rosa will invest the money in purchase of natural fertilizers to spread in her next corn planting.

loans.use: to purchase natural fertilizers to spread in her next corn planting.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has been in active farming for 20 years and currently employs two farmhands on her farm, which majorly produces milk, maize, beans and tea to the local markets in her rural home in Kitale. She lives with her two children, but has seven children with the first five now being adults, all self-dependent.

Jane has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says her focus is to own at least two better quality breeds of cows in the next 5 years. She believes this will generate enough milk with the capacity to meet family needs.

Jane says fluctuation in market prices remains a challenge.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 52 years old, married and blessed with five children, ages 25, 20, 17, 14 and 12 years respectively. He is a mechanic and owns his own garage that has been in existence for the past 5 years, with a monthly income of 3,000 KES. 

He has requested a first loan of 30,000 KES to purchase motor vehicle spare parts and tools for use in his garage. The profit he makes will be ploughed back to his business. 

His dream is to see his children get the best education.

loans.use: To purchase motor vehicle spare parts and tools for use in his garage.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 32 and is married with four children, ages between 1 and 11 years. He lives with his family in their rural home in Kitale. He has 7 years of experience in farming and currently sells his products of milk, eggs and vegetables to the local markets. He works as a cobbler in the local market besides farming.

Timothy has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He is optimistic his milk output will improve and justify his sales to Kenya Co-operative Creameries, which is giving better prices for milk compared to local market centers, though it is fairly far and needs farmers with high volumes.

Timothy points at poor infrastructure and animal diseases as being the major challenges.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Lumiere Group

texts.fr: La représentante du groupe d’affaire « Lumière », qui lève sa main sur la photo,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 30 ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants, tous étudient.  Son mari est un chauffeur – Taximan motard dans la ville de Goma. La cliente  est commerçante des articles divers  au marché communal de  Nyabushongo.  Il ya 7 ans révolus qu’elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 9 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’acheter  10 paires de souliers, dizaine de bassins plastics, 1 carton biscuits, 1 box du sel de cuisine, dizaine de gobelet, etc.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire confortablement sa maison.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: The representative of the business group " Lumière ", has her hand raised on the photo. She is a 30 year old entrepreneur who is married with five children, all of whom go to school. Her husband is a driver - a motorcycle taxi-man in Goma. This client sells various articles at the local market in Nyabushongo. She has been doing this job for more than seven years. However, she has just achieved nine loan cycles with Hekima. This new credit will enable her to buy 10 pairs of shoes, about 10 plastic bowls, a box of biscuits, a box of kitchen salt, about ten cups, etc. Furthermore, she aims to send her children to school and build her house comfortably. The client thanks Hekima for their support in favour of poor women who are excluded from classic banking institutions.

loans.use: to buy 10 pairs of shoes, about ten plastic bowls, a box of biscuits, a box of cooking salt, about ten cups, etc.

loans.name: El Sol Group

texts.es:
Doña Sacramento tiene la edad de 39 años, solo estudio la primaria y esta casada con don Joaquin que trabaja como campesino, ellos tienen 4 hijos que estudian la primaria, Doña Sacramento nos platica que siempre ha buscado la manera de trabajar desde su hogar realizando pequeñas ventas para poder contribuir con los gastos del hogar, fue hasta hace 3 años que con el apoyo de su esposo logro abrir en un espacio que acondiciono en su casa una pequeña tienda de abarrotes la cual ha crecido con el paso de los años hasta llegar a ser una de las mas surtidas de su comunidad, ella esta muy contenta con su negocio no solo por el progreso que ha tenido su negocio,sino porque le ha servido mucho ya que sus ganancias las utiliza para dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, también platica que ella piensa que el dar un buen trato a sus clientes ayuda a atraer mas gente a su negocio. Doña Sacramento invertirá el crédito en la compra de jabon en polvo, frijoles, arroz, galletas, refrescos, cloro, dulces, jugos, sabritas y productos enlatados para resurtir su negocio, ella desea que su negocio continúe creciendo ya que quiere dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una profesión.

Doña Sacramento es uno de los integrantes de un grupo integrado por siete personas, cual se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Buenos Aires, las personas que habitan esta comunidad se dedican al trabajo del campo a la siembra y cultivo de caña, ademas de que existe una árbol Palma que solo se puede encontrar en esa comunidad.
  
Los demas integrantes de este grupo y sus actividades son:

Alvaro: servicio de albañilería.
Maria Luisa: venta de abarrotes. 
Tereso: venta de tortillas. 
Teofila: venta de refrescos.
Maria Esther: cría de borregos. 
Mariela: venta de refrescos.
texts.en:
Doña Sacramento is 39 years old and only has an elementary school education. She is married to Don Joaquin, who works as a farm laborer. They have four children who are in elementary school. Doña Sacramento says she always looks for ways to work from home by making small sales so that she can contribute to the household expenses. Three years ago and with the help of her husband, she set aside a space in her house to open a small grocery store. Over the years, it has grown to the point that it has become of one of the better-stocked stores in her community. Doña Sacramento is very pleased with her business, not only for the progress she has made, but also because of the profits that have been used to provide a better quality of life for her family. She also believes that treating her customers well has helped to attract more people to her business. Doña Sacramento will invest her loan in the purchase of powdered soap, beans, rice, cookies, soft drinks, bleach, candy, juices, snack foods, and canned goods to restock her business. She wants her business to continue growing because she desires for her children to have the opportunity to study for a profession.

Doña Sacramento is a member of a group that consists of seven people who are from the community of Buenos Aires. The people who live in this community engage in farm work, such as planting and cultivating sugar cane. In addition, there is only one palm tree that exists in this community.

The other group members and their business activities are as follows: • Alvaro provides masonry services. • Maria Luisa sells groceries. • Tereso sells tortillas. • Teofila sells soft drinks. • Maria Esther raises sheep. • Mariela sells soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy powdered soap, beans, rice, cookies, soft drinks, bleach, candy, juices, snack foods, and canned goods

location.town: Buenos Aires, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 29 años, es una mujer trabajadora que vive en compañía de Antonio, su esposo. Tienen dos hijos (Stefany y José), a los que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en el pueblo de Chacas. 
Junto a su esposo comenzaron a dedicar su tiempo y esfuerzo en la agricultura en los terrenos que heredó su esposo. Produce maíz, zapallo y papa, los que en temporadas de siembra grande aprovechan todo lo que pueden, ya que saben que sus esfuerzos serán recompensados, pues cuanto mejor calidad obtengan sus productos, más ganancias tendrán.  A su vez, se dedica a la crianza de animales (vacas, cerdos y ovejas), las que engorda para luego venderlas a los carniceros que la visitan constantemente. Con la leche que producen las vacas realiza un promedio de 10 moldes de queso al día, los cuales vende a los pobladores del mismo lugar, quien son conocedores de lo rico que los prepara.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Sarita colonia” y este es su sexto crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que podrá mejorar su negocio. Por ello, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues le gusta trabajar en su asociación, donde todos son personas responsables y solidarias.
Julia invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla de maíz, pues piensa sembrar en un extensión de terreno más grande.
texts.en:
Julia, 29 years old, is a hard-working woman who lives with her husband, Antonio. They have two children (Stefany and José), who they care for in their own home in the town of Chacas.

Together, Julia and her husband began working in agriculture, using the land inherited by her husband. She grows corn, squash, and potatoes. They make the most of the ample sowing seasons as much as possible, because they know that their efforts will be rewarded. The better quality products they grow, the more income they will earn. In addition, Julia also works by raising animals (cows, pigs, and sheep), which she fattens to later sell to the butchers who constantly visit her. With the milk from the cows, she also produces around 10 moulds of cheese a day, which she sells to the residents of the same area. They all know about the great quality cheese she prepares.

Julia belongs to the Sarita Colonia support group and this is her sixth loan with MFP. She is grateful for the opportunity they offer, so she will be able to improve her business. Therefore, she promises to be punctual with the payments. She likes to work with the association, where all the people are responsible and supportive.

Julia will invest the requested loan into buying seeds for corn, as she is thinking of planting on a larger piece of land.

loans.use: to buy seeds for corn

loans.name: C 2386 Abajyamugambi Group

texts.en:
Annonciata is 47 years old and is married with three children, ages between 8 and 15 years old. She sells various goods such as sugar, salt, soap, rice, etc.. She has 3 years in this work. She currently employs one person to help her and her business starts from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily per week. 

Annonciata is the leader of this group, which is called "C 2386 ABAJYAMUGAMBI" in the local language, and she is the one who has a paper in her hand. Annonciata has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as sugar, salt, soap, rice, etc. for resale. She will be able to save for her future and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as sugar, salt, soap, rice, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Sakhan

texts.ru: Сахан 62 года, вдова, мать 2 детей. 25 лет назад, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Сахан начала свой бизнес в полеводстве и животноводстве, стартовав с покупки лошади. Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Сахан сумела развить свое хозяйство, насчитывающее 2 лошади и 1 корову, 10 голов мелкого рогатого скота и 3,6 га земли с ячменем, приносящее ежемесячный доход  в сумме 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сахан обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 телок.  Доходы от кредита Сахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Sakhan is a 62-year-old widowed mother of two children. 25 years ago, searching for a way to support her family, she bought a horse and started a farming and animal raising business. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, her business has now grown to two horses, one cow, ten heads of small-horned cattle and 3.6 hectares of land. It brings in around 4,000 soms a month in income. 

Hoping to expand her business further, Sakhan approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" with a request for a loan of 70,000 soms (KGS) in order to buy two heifers. She plans to invest profits from the loan back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase two heifers.

loans.name: Medardo Ernesto

texts.es: Medardo Ernesto vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura, se ha hecho de mucha experiencia y eso le ayuda a obtener muy buenas cosechas, el terreno donde cultiva está cercano a lo localidad donde reside, comercia en todos los alrededores de la zona y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues saben que todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un servicio inigualable siempre está a la orden de las personas que lo visitan; Medardo es un hombre trabajador, responsable, pero sobre todo humilde siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le ayudará a salir adelante; en la última cosecha tuvo pérdidas debido al clima de lluvia, por eso en esta nueva temporada quiere recuperarse y sembrar un poco más. Quiere invertir en insumos agrícolas pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, fertilizante, insecticida, herramienta etc. Medardo Ernesto tiene capacidad crediticia y tiene la certeza que podrá cancelar el financiamiento y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Medardo Ernesto lives with his common law wife and children.  He raises corn and has been farming for several years and has become very experienced and this helps obtain good harvests.  The land on which he raises his crops is near his home and he sells all around the zone and has many customers because they know that the items he sells are of high quality and good prices.  Aside from that he provides unequalled service and always there to serve those who visit him.  Medardo is a hardworking, responsible man, but humble above all.  He is always looking for new opportunities to help him get ahead.  He had some losses in his last harvest due to the rainy climate, but he wants to recover in his new climate and plant a little more.  He wants to invest in farming supplies but he needs capital, so he has requested a loan through INTEGRAL so that he can buy corn seed, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc.  Medardo Ernesto has certified training and is certain that he will be able to repay this loan and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and tools.

loans.name: Fayzulo

texts.ru: Файзуло проживает в районе Фархор. Ему 52 года. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Он занимается торговлей. Файзуло арендует магазин, где продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Fayzulo lives in the Farkhor region of Tajikistan. He's a 52-year-old married man with six children. Fayzulo rents a store where he sells various food supplies.
He's asking for a loan in order to increase his sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies.

loans.name: Balentina

texts.es:
Balentina tiene 54 años, es una mujer humilde que vive en compañía de Humberto, su esposo. Tienen dos hijos (Marco Antonio y Ana María), a los que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de 2 de mayo. 
Su casita se encuentra en la zona alta, ella tiene que bajar al río, donde quedan sus sembríos para cuidarlos fertilizarlos y cultivarlos. Sus principales cultivos son la papa y el maíz, los cuales siembra en terrenos propios, y en cada cosecha los comercializa a la ciudad donde su esposo trabaja, en la gobernación. Es por eso que ya conoce a los principales compradores, quienes le ofrecen buenas ganancias, ya que sus productos son naturales y nutritivos, pues hace descansar la tierra, para que produzca con mayor mejor.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Sumaq Sonqo” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que podrá mejorar su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues le gusta trabajar en su asociación, donde todos son personas responsables y solidarias.
Balentina invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para sus próximos sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Balentina is 54 years old.  She's a humble woman who lives in the company of her husband, Humberto.  They have two children, Marco Antonio and Ana María, whom they care for in their own home.  Her little home is found in the highlands; she has to descend to the river, where her crops are to take care of them, fertilizing and cultivating them.  Her main crops are potatos and corn, which she plants in her own fields and at each harvest, she sells them in the city where her husband works for the government.  It is for this reason that she already know her main customers, who offer her good earnings, since her products are natural and nutritious, as she allows the soil to rest so that it produces a better crop.

She belongs to the group “Sumaq Sonqo” and this is her third loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the opportunity that they offer her, since she will be able to improve her business.  For this, she promises to be punctual with her monthly payments.  She enjoys working with her group, where all are responsible and committed to one another.  

Balentina will invest the money in the purchase of natural fertilizers for her next potato crop.

loans.use: to purchase natural fertilizers for her next potato crop.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 48 años, vive en compañía de Paulino, su esposo. Tienen cuatro hijos, todos menores, a los que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Chacas.   
Todos los días, junto a su esposo, salen a cuidar sus sembríos de maíz y papa en sus terrenos propios. Como le gusta mucho la agricultura aprendió la manera de utilizar las sobras de los fertilizantes y semillas, construyó en su casa un vivero, donde siembra diversas hortalizas y vegetales. En época de cosecha comercializa sus productos en la ciudad, donde ella misma lleva a vender sus productos, ya que es conocedora del lugar y los negociantes. Ahora posee dos vacas que piensa alimentar y engordar para poder extraer leche y así realizar queso, espera concretar su nuevo proyecto. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Sarita colonia” y este es su quinto crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que podrá mejorar su negocio. Por ello, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues le gusta trabajar en su grupo, donde todos son personas responsables y solidarias.
Juana invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra de una hectárea de maíz.
texts.en:
Juana, age 48, lives with her husband, Paulino, and their four minor children.  They are raising their children in their own house in Chacas, a rural community.

She and her husband go together every day to take care of their corn and potato crops, which are on their own land.  As she likes farming very much, she learned the way to use the left over fertilizers and seeds.  At her house she built a nursery where she grows diverse vegetables.

During the harvest time she sells their products in the city.  She takes the products there herself in order to sell them.  She knows the place and its businessmen very well.  

She now has two cows that she is planning on feeding and fattening.  She will do this to be able to get the milk and make cheese.  She hopes to firm up her new project.

She belongs to the Sarita Colonia communal bank, and this is his fifth loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the opportunity they are giving her because she will be able to improve her business.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments.  She likes working in her communal bank where everyone is responsible and supportive.

Juana  will use the requested money to buy natural fertilizers and corn seeds for her next planting of one hectare of corn.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers and corn seeds for her next planting of one hectare of corn.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan Francisco de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su esposa María y su nieta; él es albañil realiza trabajos en diferentes viviendas,  las personas lo contratan porque es uno de los mejores, su trabajo es de calidad y da muy buenos precios; Juan es un hombre emprendedor, visionario con muchas ganas de superarse, para él, el significado de hogar es muy importante, valora mucho a la familia y desea darle a la suya lo mejor, desde hace algunos meses su vivienda se ha visto deteriorada y le ha robado comodidad y seguridad a sus habitantes, quiere hacerle reparaciones y necesita de materia prima para realizar la labor  pero no posee del suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar duralita, ladrillos, cemento, polines, entre otros. Juan Francisco es un hombre responsable y con buenas referencias crediticias está seguro que podrá saldar en el periodo establecido el financiamiento y a la vez podrá darle a su familia una vida mas digna.
texts.en:
51-year old Juan Francisco lives with his wife María and granddaughter. He is a bricklayer and builds houses. People hire him because he is one of the best; he does quality work for a reasonable price. 

Juan is an enterprising man with an eye on the future. He always makes an effort to overcome any problems. In his view his family and home are the most important things in his life, and he wishes to provide them with the best he can. 

Over the last few months he has noticed his house deteriorating so that his family are less comfortable and safe. He wishes to make some repairs so needs construction supplies but lacks the money to buy them. He has approached INTEGRAL for a loan to buy roofing, bricks, cement, posts etc. Juan Francisco is a responsible person with a good credit rating. He is certain that he will be able to make the repayments according to the schedule and at the same time provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy roofing, bricks, cement, posts etc.

loans.name: Ndeye Awa

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Awa  vit au Sénégal. Elle gère un restaurant dans la localité ou elle habite. Elle est  mariée et membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC .Elle a déjà remboursé 5 crédits antérieurs et capitalise une expérience de 10 ans dans son activité. Elle sollicite un prêt de 500 000 frs prévu pour la réfection de sa propre maison qu’elle compte mettre en location. Par conséquent ce financement pourra l’aider à acquérir des revenus  supplémentaires en dehors de ce que lui procure son activité de restauratrice. Avec l’accroissement de ses revenus elle prévoie d’élargir le nombre de ses employés à deux. Ce phénomène lui permettra de supporter les frais scolaires de ses enfants et aussi de mieux épargner. Son objectif est d’acquérir une grande boutique remplie de marchandises diverses  et de  voyager vers les pays du monde  les plus développés dans le domaine commercial.
texts.en: Mrs. Ndeye Awa lives in Senegal. She manages a restaurant in the locality where she lives. She is married and a member of a U-IMCEC service point. She has already repaid five previous loans and has a total of ten years experience in her business. She requests a loan of 500 000 frs. intended for the renovation of her own house which she hopes to rent out. As a result, this funding could help her earn supplementary income in addition to that which comes from her activity as a restaurant owner. With the additional income, she plans to increase the number of her employees to two. This would enable her to assume school fees for her children and also to save more. Her ambition is to acquire a big shop full of a variety of merchandise and travel to the more commercially developed countries in the world.

loans.use: to repair her house for rental.

loans.name: Blanca Eufemia

texts.es: Blanca Eufemia de cincuenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida, sus hijos y sus nietos; ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas, revueltas, de queso, chicharrón entre otras, pero también posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad huevos, frijoles, leche, pan, su negocio está ubicado en el lugar donde vive, es  muy conocida en la zona pues saben que es de las mejores vendedoras, siempre tiene a la orden lo que el cliente necesita, además todo lo que comercia es de calidad y a precios accesibles; Blanca es una mujer visionaria con grandes metas para el futuro, pretende aprovechar cada oportunidad que se le presenta porque eso le ayudara a alcanzar el éxito; en los  últimos días ha aumentado la demanda y se necesita invertir más para no decepcionar a la clientela por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, maíz, verduras, pan golosinas, producto instantáneo, bebidas, etc. Blanca Eufemia es muy responsable y con excelentes referencias de pago tiene la certeza que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca Eufemia, 53, lives with her life partner, her children, and her grandchildren.  She sells "pupusas" [stuffed tortillas], scrambled eggs with cheese, and chicharrones, among other things.  She also has a store where she sells staples: eggs, beans, milk, and bread.  Her business is located in her home.  She is very well known in the area because they know she is one of the best merchants.  She is always ready with what the customer needs.  Also, everything she sells is high quality and affordable.

Blanca is a visionary woman with big goals for the future.  She hopes to make the most of every opportunity that presents itself because this will help her succeed.  Demand has increased lately and she needs to invest more so her customers won't be disappointed.  This is why she's asking Integral for a loan that will help her buy basic grains, corn, vegetables, bread, sweets, instant food products, beverages, etc.

Blanca Eufemia is very responsible and has excellent payment references.  She is certain she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, corn, vegetables, bread, sweets, instant food products, and beverages.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 41 años, vive en compañía de tres de sus cuatro hijos, a los que cuida en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la localidad de Chacas. 
Se caracteriza por ser una mujer tímida, y desde muy joven asumió los roles de padre y madre para sus hijo. Comenzó a sembrar maíz y papa en sus terrenos, los cuales cuida con mucha dedicación, ya que son el único sustento económico que tiene. Su principal ingreso económico proviene del secado del maíz que siembra, éste sirve para tostar, como una especie de aperitivo. Son muy pocos los agricultores que se dedican a realizar ese proceso, por ello que obtiene buenas ganancias. Asimismo, tiene animales (cerdos y gallinas), que cuida y le sirven para su consumo propio. Gusta mucho de vivir en el campo, por ello desea incrementar sus ingresos para  sembrar en mayor cantidad, ya que el dinero invertido en la siembra es mayor.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Sarita colonia” y este es su sexto crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que podrá mejorar su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues le gusta trabajar en su asociación, donde todos son personas responsables y solidarias.
Julia invertirá el dinero que ahora solicita en la compra de fertilizantes y semilla de maíz para su próxima campaña.
texts.en:
Julia is 41 years old and lives with three of her four children, who she looks after in her parents house which is located in Chacas. She is a very timid woman by nature, and from very early on she has taken on the role of father and mother for her children. She began to sow corn and potatoes on her land, which she looks after with great dedication since they are her only source of income. Her main source of income comes from the dried corn she grows. It is good for toasting as a type of appetizer. There are very few famers who work using this process, and for this reason she has a good income. 

She also has animals (pigs and chickens) which she looks after and uses for her own consumption. She likes living in the countryside very much, and for this reason she wants to increase her income so that she can sow in a greater quantity, since the money invested in seeding is greater.  

She is part of the group “Sarita Colonia” and this is her sixth loan with MFP. Thanks to the opportunities they offer, she will be able to improve her business. For this reason she promises to be punctual with all her repayments. She likes working with the Association, where all the people are responsible and cooperative. 

Julia is asking for the loan so that she can buy fertilizers and corn seeds for the next season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and corn seeds for the next season.

loans.name: Eriberto

texts.es: Eriberto de sesenta años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida, él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz, tiene varios años de dedicarse al rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener muy buenas cosecha y mantenerse adelante de la competencia, el comercia en todos los alrededores y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues saben que todo lo que vende es de calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Eriberto es un hombre emprendedor con  muchas ganas de salir adelante y ser un hombre exitoso, está luchando duro para lograrlo, por eso en esta temporada de siembra quiere aumentar la producción e invertir en insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, fertilizante, herbicida, herramienta etc. Eriberto es responsable con una moral intachable está seguro que podrá cancelar el crédito y a la vez darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Eriberto, 60, lives with his life partner.  He works in agriculture, specifically growing corn.  He has worked in the area for several years and has gained a lot of valuable experience that allows him to have very good harvests and keep himself ahead of the competition.  He sells in all the surrounding areas and has gained a lot of customers because they know that everything he sells is high quality, and he sells it at affordable prices.  Also, his service is excellent.

Eriberto is an enterprising man who very much wants to get ahead and be a successful man.  He is fighting hard to achieve this, so this planting season he wants to increase production and invest in supplies.  This is why he is asking Integral for a loan that will allow him to buy corn seed, fertilizer, herbicide, tools, etc.

Eriberto is a responsible person of high moral character.  He is sure he will be able to repay the loan and give his family a full life at the same time.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizer, herbicide, and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, tools

loans.name: Chinara

texts.ru: Чинаре 41 год, замужем, мать 4 детей. 20 лет назад, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Чинара начала свой бизнес в полеводстве и животноводстве, стартовав с суммы 800 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Чинара сумела развить свое хозяйство, насчитывающее 2 коров, 1 бычка и 2,5 га земли с сахарной свеклой, приносящее ежемесячный доход  в сумме 3,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чинара обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян сахарной свеклы и удобрений.  Доходы от кредита Чинара планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Chinara is 41 years old, married and the mother of four.  20 years ago, in the search of a source of income for her family, Chinara launched her business growing produce and raising livestock. She had  a starting capital of KGS. Thanks to Chinara’s resilience and hard work, she was able to grow her farm, which now includes two cows, one bull and 2.5 ha of land for growing sugar beet, and brings in a monthly income of 3,000 KGS. IN order to continue developing her business , Chinara turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 40,000 KGS in order to buy sugar beet seeds and fertilizers. Chinara plans to  invest the resulting revenues  into growing her business further.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 22 años, es soltera, pero muy responsable con su hijo Marck. Vive con él y su madre (Felicita), en su casa propia ubicada en el pueblo de Chacas.  
Desde niña le enseñaron a sembrar y dedicarse a la tierra. Tiene terrenos propios que le fueron dados por su madre, allí siembra maíz, su principal y único cultivo, pues como ella dice, ahí obtiene mayores ganancias, ya que es el producto que más se consume en la región y siempre mantiene el precio de venta en el mercado. Los meses donde obtiene más ganancias son setiembre y octubre, por ello se encuentra en planes de sembrar programando la cosecha para esos meses. A su vez, tiene dos toros que le sirven para arar la tierra al comenzar la siembra, “de esa manera no pago a otras personas por hacerlo”, comenta.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Sarita colonia” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que podrá mejorar su negocio. Por ello, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues le gusta trabajar en su asociación, donde todos son personas responsables y solidarias.
Maribel invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de semilla de maíz y fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Juana, age 22, is single, but she is very responsible.  She lives with her son, Marck, and her mother, Felicita.  They live their own house in the town of Chacas.

When she was a girl they taught her to plant and devote herself to the land.  She has her own fields that her mother gave her.  That is where she grows corn, her main and only crop.  As she says, that is where she gets greater income because this product is consumed the most in the region.  The price always holds in the market.

She gets the most income in September and October.  Therefore, she is now planning on planting and getting the harvest during these months.  She has two bulls that plough the fields to start the planting.  She says, “This way I do not pay other people to do it.”

She belongs to the Sarita Colonia communal bank, and this is her second loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the opportunity they are giving her because she will be able to improve her business.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments.  She likes working in her communal bank where everyone is responsible and supportive.

Juana  will use the requested money to buy corn seeds and natural fertilizers for her next planting.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and natural fertilizers for her next planting.

loans.name: Angel Abelino

texts.es: Ángel Abelino  vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace varios años, su trabajo en la  agricultura le ha regalado mucha experiencia, que utiliza siempre para trabajar sus siembras de la mejor manera, el terreno donde cultiva está ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su hogar; al mismo tiempo se levanta desde muy temprano a laborar, comercia en todos los lugares aledaños al cantón y ya tiene mucha clientela fija pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a un precio accesible además el servicio es excelente; Ángel es un hombre entregado a su labor con muchos sueños que quiere alcanzar, piensa trabajar duro para lograr su objetivo y tener un futuro más próspero, quiere expandir el negocio por lo que necesita aumentar la producción para ello necesita invertir y necesita de capital por eso le solicita INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, fertilizante, insecticida, herbicida, herramienta, etc. Ángel es responsable y con buen record crediticio, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ángel Abelino lives with his common law wife and three children.  He has been raising corn for several years and his farm work has given him lots of experience that he uses to work his crops in better ways.  The land where he grows his crops is located in a high concentration farming zone and very close to his home.  He rises very early in the morning to work and he sells all around the settlement area, now that he has many steady customers because they know that everything he sells is of high quality, good prices, and the service is excellent.  Ángel is dedicated to his work and has many dreams.  He plans to work hard to make his goal and have a more prosperous future.  He wants to expand his business and needs to increase his production.  To do this he needs to invest and needs working capital, so he is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL, that will allow him to buy corn seed, fertilizer, insecticide, herbicide, tools, etc.  Ángel is a responsible man with a good credit record and is certain that he will be able to repay this debt and at the same time improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar de cuarenta años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida Ada y sus tres hijos; el realiza viajes a todas las zonas aledañas a donde reside y posee dos vehículos con los que transporta cargas y personas, tiene varios años de trabajar en este ámbito y le ha dado muy buenos resultados, cuando posee tiempo libre su mejor lugar para disfrutarlo es en su hogar, desde hace algunos meses su vivienda ha sufrido deterioros y necesitan ser reparados por la época de lluvia y porque le quita comodidad a su familia, necesita comprar materia prima para poder realizar la labor, pero necesitan de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar lamina, polines, hierro, cemento, ladrillo, y mas para reparar su techo. Julio Cesar es responsable con capacidad crediticia y sobre todo comprometido, tiene la seguridad que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez ofrecerle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Julio César, 40, lives with his life partner Ada and his three children.  He travels to all the areas near where he lives and has two vehicles for transporting cargo and people.  He has been working in this area for several years and it has given him very good results.  When he has free time his favorite place to enjoy it is in his home.

His house has deteriorated in the last few months and needs to be repaired because of the rainy season and his family's comfort.  He needs to buy raw materials to be able to do the job but he needs capital.  This is why he is asking Integral for a loan that will allow him to buy metal sheets, wood beams, rebar, cement, bricks, and more to repair his roof.

Julio César is responsible and committed, and has credit capacity.  He is certain he will be able to repay the debt and give his family a better life at the same time.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood beams, rebar, cement, and bricks.

loans.name: Shadia

texts.en:
Shadia is 32 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with one of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Shadia has been working hard to manage her small shop which sells phone accessories. 

To help expand her business, Shadia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more phone accessories for resale, and will help Shadia to generate greater profits and improve the standards of living in her family. Shadia hopes that in the future she will be able to provide materials like mobile phone accessories at a cheaper price. 

Shadia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Shadia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more phone accessories for resale,

loans.name: Jasiri Group

texts.en: Afua is in her late 40s, single and the mother of one child who is in college. Since 2006, she has earned a living by running a food cafe. She works from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. She is requesting her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to restock her cafe and pay school fees, and has repaid all of these loans successfully. She plans to use this new loan to buy more supplies for her cafe and pay school fees. Her dream is to one day build her own house. She will share this loan with her group "Jasiri," which has 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her cafe and pay school fees.

loans.name: Mi's Group

texts.en:
Mi is a 34-year-old mother of three children, all of whom are still in school. To earn a living, she has been farming in a rural village of the Sa Ang district for approximately 10 years. 

Mi has been with VisionFund since 2008 and successfully paid back the loans with VisionFund. Mi's group consists of two female members. After having completely repaid all of her previous obligations to VisionFund, she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to have more rice to sell and, as a result, to better feed her family.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique tiene 48 años, es un hombre ejemplar, enviudó hace 7 años y desde entonces asumió los roles de madre y padre para sus cuatro hijos, a los que ama. Ahora vive junto a su hija Diana, la menor, a la que educa en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Colcabamba.  
Desde hace muchos años su principal ingreso económico es la fabricación de helados de diferentes sabores. Lo realiza a base de colorantes naturales, como también de frutas que crecen en la zona, como la granadilla, buena para los problemas del estómago. Desde las primeras horas del día se levanta muy temprano para elaborar estos helados, ya que gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo logró adquirir las máquinas que necesita. Ahora desea incrementar su producción, pues la temporada de verano es donde hay más demanda. En la actualidad cuenta con trabajadores, pero no son suficientes, por ello desea comprar más carritos heladeros para incrementar sus ventas. Y como su casa es muy grande la dispuso para alquilar sus cuartos a personas que lo necesiten, de esa manera tiene un ingreso extra para su economía. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que podrá adquirir el dinero solicitado para mejorar su negocio. Por ello, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues le gusta trabajar en su grupo, donde todos son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el dinero solicitado, Enrique completará su ahorro para la compra de un auto, con el que piensa trasladar los helados que realiza.
texts.en:
Enrique, age 48, is an exemplary man.  He was widowed seven years ago, and since then he assumed the rolls of mother and father for his four children, whom he loves very much.  He now lives with his youngest, his daughter, Diana.  He is raising her in his own house in Colcabamba.

For many years his main source of income has been making different flavors of ice-cream.  He does this with a base of natural colors and fruits, like passion fruit, that grow in the area.  Passion fruit is good for stomach problems.  He gets up in the very early hours of the day to make these ice-creams.

Thanks to his effort and work he managed to get the machines he needs.  Now he wishes to increase his production.  Summer is the season when there is the most demand.  He currently has workers, but not enough.  Therefore, he wishes to buy more ice-cream carts to increase his sales.

As his house is very big, he rented out rooms to people who needed them.  This way he has extra financial income.

This is his first loan with MFP.    He is grateful for the opportunity they have given him because he will be able to get the requested money to improve his business. He pledges to be punctual with his payments. He likes working with his communal bank where everyone is responsible and supportive.

Enrique will use the requested money and his savings to buy an auto, which he plans to use to transport the ice-cream that he makes.

loans.use: to add to his savings in order  to buy an auto, which he plans to use to transport the ice-cream that he makes.

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en: This is 42-year-old Jenneh. She is married and has five children who range in age from 11 to 22 years old. She has five additional dependents, including her elderly mother and four sales assistants. In 2002, Jenneh established a textile business to support her children's education. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 550,000 SLL every month from her work. She is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 SLL to buy various items she needs to make more textiles. She hopes that this loan will allow her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Jenneh plans to send two of her children overseas to complete their education and also finish construction of her house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a textile business.

loans.name: C 8085 Coabunya Vi Group

texts.en:
Edouard is 42 years old, is married with three children and takes care of eight relatives. Edouard sells cassava and is a leader of this group, which is called "C 8085 COABUNYA VI" in the local language. In the photo, he's the one who has a paper in his hand. He has been in this business for two years and he works from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily, except on the weekends, every week. Edouard currently employs three people to help him. 

Edouard has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to cultivate a large quantity of cassava for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, to pay school fees for his children and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to cultivate a large quantity of cassava for resale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 42 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Emmanuel has been working hard to manage his small shop which sells hardware items. 

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hardware items like iron sheets and cement for resale, and will help Emmanuel to generate greater profits and pay medical expenses for his family . Emmanuel hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business bigger .
